5iIr1D9Gop8XjFMWGQae6g.text: My favorite Shadyside bar. Good menu with lots of options (including both terrible-for-you-but delicious stuff like Totchos, and reasonable decent things). Several vegetarian options. Great draft list that changes often. Fun staff, and great outdoor patio.

3OsnItIEY5vbope0a50fdQ.text: I am not really sure what took me so long to visit Harris Grill cause I live close by, but I am sure this was not the last time. I came here on a Sunday for brunch at around 10.30am. Even though they had just opened, the place was packed! And that's usually a good sign. We had to wait proably 20 min to get seated inside, but it was worth the wait. Our waitress came 2 min after being seated to offer water, the ordering was easy (we went for the $16 buffet breakfast) and the selection was really good. From smoked salmon, fruit salads, chicken and waffles to omelettes of your choice, I am sure you'll find something to brighten up your sunday morning! The staff was really nice and friendly, The buffet always kept with a decent amount of everything so we didn't have to wait at all. Everything that I had was of decent quality and for the price I really can't complain! Needless to say, I will definitely come back and try more.

3M1IpCX_3hZIdVcYoOMHbg.text: If you have a sense of humor, if you love frozen cosmopolitans or if you're just looking for a fun, casual place to get your grub on, Harris Grill is where it's at. I recommend the Henny Penny, but be adventurous; they are always changing their menu to incorporate a plethora of ingredients, so you're bound to find something you love. Plus, they've got a sweet outdoor patio for the warmer days.   Make sure to spend some time with the menu. It's a riot. Brilliant!

vUYUrh3i9XdPWBQiy_PUsQ.text: I normally avoid brunch buffets as a rule; the food is never up to par and it's a cattle call. Usually a poor excuse for restaurants to make money. However, when a local friend suggested we meet here he insisted Harris Grill's brunch was legit. He had me at "bacon trough".  Nice patio seating and friendly service! You get a frozen mimosa (and it's not overly sweet or weak; actually tastes like a frozen mimosa) or bloody mary with the $15 all you can eat brunch. Omelets made to order, lox and mini bagels, fresh fruit, trough of well done, really quality bacon as previously mentioned. There's even pre-assembled eggs benedict, which I expected to be a mess but they were perfect.   I wish all brunch buffets were like this. It is a tiny bit cramped when there are several people loading up plates, but everyone was understanding and laughed off the occasional bumps. Brunch is serious business, you do what you gotta do.

oyyHyIDIawc_iAqrRiUX0Q.text: I have only been here multiple times for brunch, but I keep returning because the staff is wonderful and the food and the drinks are fantastic!! Definitely a good place to go if you want to make friends and eat fresh comfort food. I am addicted to their frozen mimosas.

ePl08m8vYqEpBcnASjSUIg.text: I'm not sure what's going on with the bad reviews, and it has been over a year since we've been here.  But as always we've been very pleased with our meals and the waitstaff at this location.

eMKaYkeDwAx5YtI0ZTyzdA.text: One word: brunch. If you're hungover and hungry, Harris Grill is the place to be. I was not hungover but still enjoyed the complimentary mimosa. Any of their options would have been great but I ended up having the mini chicken sandwiches. I was able to enjoy my food and catch up with old friends without having to shout. Affordable and yummy food makes Harris Grlll a go-to place for brunch.

aJnqN1W-gn2UnE9diYQ4tA.text: A last minute cancellation afforded me the rare opportunity to have a weeknight dinner at a 'normal' person's time, so I decided to redeem one of my many (READ: TOO many) Groupons.   On the left: The "I Can Has Bacon Cheezburgher?" cooked to medium-rare perfection on the optional pretzel bun. A solid and above average burger for certain. Not quite on the level of Winghart's Burger & Whiskey Bar or Burgatory Bar, but also without the price tag that comes with those burgers. Head & tails above any burger I've had at Tessaro's!   On the right: The "Kielrogieretzel Sliders" - kielbasa, sauerkraut, whole grain mustard, and cheese-stuffed pierogi together in mini pretzel buns. Yeah, those were about as awesome as they sound, albiet alsightly overpriced for what you get. I think I've found a new place to add to the short rotation.   NOTE: Not pictured was the Cookies-N-Cream dessert, which in their words is: "A freshly baked chocolate chip cookie of prodigious diameter served hot out of our Easy-Bake oven (powered by a 40-watt light bulb) in a lethal cast iron skillet with French vanilla ice cream. Give us a few minutes to make this: mom's baking these."  One of the better desserts I've had, so I devoured it before photographic evidence could be obtained.   If I needed any more evidence this place is kinda place, Tuesdays are 'Bacon Night'!  This was on a Wednesday around happy hour - atmosphere was chill, quiet, and relaxed. Service from Byron behind the bar was attentive without being overbearing. Nice people.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;I Can Has Bacon Cheezburgher?&#34; on the optional pretzel bun and the &#34;Kielrogieretzel Sliders&#34;

YULXzaPsS34tPDrNlpaOiw.text: This place took apart part of their deck to retrieve me debit card which had fallen through the cracks.

AGgDPhN8YhrIraVBMXyDOg.text: Harris Grill is very yummy. I frequented there for awhile! The menu will make you laugh and the options are pretty good. Typical bar food and REALLY good Mac and cheese. Best for late night and dinner. I was not impressed by the brunch buffet and they don't serve lunch. Would only go for dinner.

x_v75rI0gNXh79jYVEcfqg.text: My cousin recommended this place. It had a nice ambiance and a cool decor. I ordered the seafood macaroni and cheese. It was excellent! I would personally prefer more seafood, but the cheese sauce in the noodles was amazing!!!!!! I usually don't like Mac and cheese dishes but this was an exception.

HPFNJR0UA4D2FYdjMta4Dg.text: I LOVE this place. Here's why...  1.The service is awesome. Hostess jokes while seating you. Awesome. Server knows his shit and rocks at presenting it. Gave us a rundown of the highs and lows of the menu. If he didn't know about something (like a beer we asked about) he went, grabbed samples and came back fully knowledgable on them.   2. The outdoor seating is baller. They have a back area that is no smoking so you don't have to get a whiff of smoke in your face while enjoying the weather and eating. They also have creative seating upstairs. Awesome.  3. The food is DELISH! Try the rib tacos. They are sooooooo good. I've never had a bad meal here.  4. They have a sense of humor. Menu is fun to read.  Beers also aren't overpriced. WIN.

PW3WtMINB80zYdQ7EO9t0w.text: My favorite drink on the menu is the vanilla white Russian.  Get it, trust me you won't regret it!  I don't like the graham cracker rim so I request cinnamon sugar instead.  Food leaves much to be desired - could barely find something I wanted.  Ended up with the meatballs which was one entre of 4 small meatballs skewered on a stick and that is it - no side items and no sauce.  Had to ask for a side of sauce to properly enjoy the meatballs.  They were just so tiny though.  Thank god for my white Russian to fill me up the rest of the way.  Already went back within a week of my first visit to get another one of those white Russians - awesome!!!

ef8gwQPRNNpyiLkfSN34qg.text: I ate at the Harris Grill for the first time last night, and it was fantastic! It will not be my last time there. The staff was very friendly and welcoming! I ordered a Surly Temple, which was cherry and fizzy, and perfect for enjoying. It was a tad cool on the front patio to enjoy the whole drink, but this will definitely be my summer drink!  My boyfriend and I started out with the hummus and pita bread. I ate half of it before he had any! Oops! It was really great hummus!! I could have stopped here and been really happy, but I was hungry, so I ordered the mac and cheese and added grilled chicken. Oh holy cow!! This mac and cheese is cheesy, but not overly so. It's the perfect amount of gooey for mac and cheese. The chicken was seasoned, tender, and not dry. Great mac and cheese!!  I'm already looking forward to my next trip to Harris Grill!!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EhAES3-gDSM-ocoKy9UJcw.text: Very hit or miss place. Best to come during happy hour. They have frozen cosmos which my girlfriend loves. They have bacon night (they give free baskets of bacon) and they have a decent draft list but mostly craft beers.  Waitstaff is very hit or miss they seem to have their friends and regulars there so you may sit around at a bar with 10 seats waiting for 15 minutes to get a beer while the the bartender is talking to someone, or you may get it right away.  Patio is nice during the summertime, but service is not the greatest out there. Not a bad place but service could be better

hZMp_HeMtFNJAqgni8_eBA.text: Came here with a party of 5 others for brunch at 11am on a Sunday. We were seated immediately but were surprised to learn that there is no brunch buffet during the winter.  My eggs benedict was good, so was my bloody mary. Don't expect vegetables and meat to go together here--they are mutually exclusive options on this menu. That said, I counted only 3 dishes with any vegetables at all. The coffee was disappointing--it came with plastic cups of half & half. Any respectable restaurant should do better.  Overall, the food is good, heavy, and served in decent-sized portions. I would come here again although there are certainly better venues for brunch in the city.

Hj84hSBA7J5A2aWrPYCjkw.text: Excellent happy hour specials (get the frozen cosmo) and nice outdoor ambiance. I have only been there once on a weekend morning/afternoon and once at happy hour, but found it a comfortable place with good service and good food and drink. I plan to hit the happy hour again in the near future!   They also have a bacon night. I haven't been to it, but that sounds like a good thing.

hlx4XcnxkGcUqqyUspgEVg.text: Light your torches and get the pitchforks, because I'm not shy about writing scathing reviews on some of Pittsburgh's beloved restaurants. I don't enjoy doing it.  I love our city and I think our diverse restaurant choices make us a great place to live and visit. But when I hear great things about a place only to be consistently let down, I have no choice.  That being said, I'm going to have to rip Harris Grill a new one.   I waited a long time before reviewing Harris Grill.  I've been there loads of times; happy hours, bacon night, brunch, crowded Friday nights, and not-so-crowded Monday nights.  Almost every time I have been let down.   I'll break it down.   DRINKS: The drink menu and draft lift offer a solid list of (overpriced) choices.  That's fine.  What isn't so fine is that the bartending is inconsistent and I have too often received ill-concocted highballs and sangria that tastes like Franzia.  Perhaps I'm just unlucky, but almost every time I'm there at least one or two beer taps "aren't working."   APPETIZERS: Nothing really wrong here.  Good spinach and buffalo chicken dips, the "Britney Spears" (chicken strips), and hummus are all very tasty. Thumbs up.  MAIN COURSES: I guess it depends on your taste, but I am simply not enthralled by any of the entrees.  The salads are overpriced for their small size, their highly touted macaroni and cheese is bland, and their chicken quesadillas are NOT quesadillas.  Just about everything on the menu at Harris Grill is overpriced for the quality.  $17 dollars for homemade hamburger helper?  $16 for two fish tacos?   I don't HATE anything on the Harris Grill menu.  Their entrees are between "ok" and "good." Just overpriced.  I do enjoy the Henny Penny and as I said before, all of the appetizers.  I'd give them a 3-star review if it wasn't for the....  SERVICE:  Or lack thereof.  Sure, Harris Grill gets crowded, especially on the weekends.  That does not excuse the waitstaff from being rude and ignoring their tables for upwards of an hour.  On one occasion, our server clearly forgot about us and we watched astounded as tables seated long after us were brought their meals.  When we finally did inquire about our food,  the waiter made a beeline for the computer to put in our orders.  No apologies, no offer to comp a side or a dessert.  In fact, the check was rushed to us before we even finished our food because the restaurant had a long waiting list.  Bad form, Harris Grill. What makes it worse is that I've been here many times, and have had similar problems with the service.   But truth be told, I'll probably be back.  Because I really want to like Harris Grill. Moreover, my friends love Harris Grill and I love my friends.  I just sincerely hope they hire more competent waitstaff.  Revising their menu wouldn't be a bad idea, either...

nxEW8aIBrM4Df-SbM6JaAQ.text: I used to go to Harris Grill quite often, primarily because the place feels cool: outside patio, nice big windows if you're lucky to get the sunny spot, frozen mimosas. This was back in the day when they had the brunch buffet style, which I guess meant we were always biased by quantity vs. quality. My last recent trip there left me kind of annoyed. We went there early before the crowds gathered so we got a nice spot. I asked for some suggestions from the menu and got blank stares. Eventually, I went with bacon wings. Terrible idea. I think I'm not going to have wings for at least a year. Or salt for that matter because the whole thing was fried in what appeared to be smoked salt. The wings came with two spoonfuls of scrambled eggs which luckily were not seasoned at all so that compensated a bit for the NaCl overdose from the wings.  I like  a fun menu but their pompous blurbs for each item ("oh how creative we are"  said in the hipstery ironic tone) should be followed with some actual information from the waiting staff!

r5sdKjtvP6CkLHQlJCCx3w.text: Great evening.  Basics: Great service,  Very good food..hamburger Helper ( not like I remembered ) Very good beer with pumpkin for my wife and met with her approval! Desert ...homemade cookie with Ice cream and whipped cream was perfect Cheers

OvFa9HBKdU5UOveGa270iA.text: Good food and speedy pick up, prices are a little steep for what you're getting though.

M-uUqmbyg2MkFj8uNKMjRQ.text: My friend and I came in for the happy hour specials and half off apps. It was our first time visiting. The service was friendly and helpful with the menu. The food we ordered was just the apps and they were something I may not order again but the main course meal (chicken sandwich of some sort) was good! The drinks were nothing to complain about either. I would visit this place again for the happy hour at least. The atmosphere was nice too since they have an outdoor patio had lots of customers to make the place lively.

ZDw26Yvm_Y0Zq8iYICPfZg.text: I've been a fan of the Harris Grill for quite some time. The patio in the warmer months is awesome! Had lunch recently and the tomato soup w/ grilled cheese killed! Also the beer selection has always been on point, a great neighborhood type place that's relaxing and perfect if you're seeking comfort food with a twist.   One negative: sometimes the wait staff can be a bit on the slow side in following up after food is delivered. One time(not this past visit, but recently) our party wanted to order more beers, but we finished our meals before the server came back around. Of course, when he did come by we got hear all about how he was an extra in a movie... that overshare cost him on the tip... Dude, no one gives a fuck, we just wanted another round!

jKSEHGAxiVdptY3--PKf-w.text: This is our go to dinner spot. The menu is as amusing as it is delicious. We love that the kitchen stays open late, bacon night, and the outside seating . Shout out to  Kazzandra for being such a helpful and great waitress!

OvLUi1noIUnsyp6QmrJeVQ.text: Best garlic and herb wings ever. The service is great, and reasonably fast given how busy it is. Great atmosphere no matter where you get seated. A fantastic selection of spirits. The hotter than Hell sauce is appropriately named. Good god.

Th-nMxMQIB5JgTRFskOnRQ.text: Great outdoor seating. Only had 1 app (hummus) and it was real good. My beer was flat and the computer went down twice so it took 25 mins to get check. Our waiter was super nice though so that was a plus. I was hoping for a comped drink or something due to wait but that didn't happen.  I'm sure if I go back on a better day, i may have a better experience but based on my time there I unfortunately gotta go with 3 stars.

ZAs2x71xFT3ve-BfDfReuw.text: I've always enjoyed the food and experience at Harris. This restaurant is right in the heart of Shadyside and to many is known for its happy hours and brunch. To me, it is know for MAC AND CHEESE.  I've sampled other things on the menu from the Britney Spears chicken tenders to the Shortrib Tacos. Don't get me wrong, they are delicious, but the Mac & Cheese is so good that I don't know if I can ever visit Harris without getting some. It is SO creamy and cheesy and they will make it custom with pretty much whatever you want. Onions? Mushrooms? Fried Egg? Tator tots? Yes. Please go get some.

6F8UnLdJueVVTnXerq3ltw.text: Just stopped in here because nothing else seemed good and we didn't want to get back in the car. Really glad we did! I had the salmon bowl and it was wonderful!

DU6OmssVr5CaCPBwrfZoBQ.text: A unique little spot with a quirky menu.   I usually frequent this place with friends or with my lifelong dining partner due to the fact that it's close to my workplace as well as my abode. I really go here just for the atmosphere at night. When I'm feeling lively, I'll choose to sit inside and let the thumping of the music and cacophony of voices take over as I indulge in my meal. However, during those off days where I just want a place for (somewhat) quiet contemplation, I'll decide on the outside patio. If the weather doesn't permit and I still want that solace, they also have a lounge with a fireplace directly above the bar. It really does have a place for any sort of mood.  The food is decent. Their menus do change quite frequently though, so it's best not to get *too* attached to a certain dish. One aspect that I love is how they name and describe their food. There's so much thought and effort put into each item as they come up with the most interesting of names and elaborate stories to introduce them to their guests.  Their drinks are very good. They have a small little book dedicated to the cocktails and other alcoholic beverages they offer. It's always an adventure, choosing a drink as they offer a wide range of quirky mixes and cocktails. My personal favorite would be the Happy Ending, which is a cucumber-mint based cocktail that entails the magic of vodka and a few other liquors. It's perfect for refreshing the palate between dishes.   Sadly, Harris Grill is a bit on the pricey side and the service is a tad inconsistent. But their unique menus and overall atmosphere is what keeps me coming back.   PS. Tuesday is bacon night aka free bacon!

Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The pussycat
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. It&#39;s an upstairs lounge kind of night.

PdkA7F6jqc5759P9yCKhDg.text: I've never had a good experience here. Most recently I stopped in on a Sunday, ordered our drinks then when it came time to order food we were given a long list of things they were out of. Including mac n cheese (a very big portion of their menu and half the reason we went in) Also out of fries, buffalo sauce, some of the burgers etc. I decided on a salad and was then told they didn't even have croutons ha. We got some queso which was good but the waitress never brought over the refill of chips that we asked for so half of that went to waste. The other bad experience was during brunch. We were seated upstairs then when our waitress came over she asked if we there there for drinks or brunch which I found odd given we were seated at a table, not that bar. Once we said brunch we were told they only have a brunch buffet on the first floor. I'm not lazy but I am clumsy so carrying plates of food up steps just is not ideal for anyone involved. We ordered a mimosa and left. The hostess should have asked us if we were eating when we came in, then gave us the option to wait for seating downstairs in my opinion. Out of 3 trips here, 2 have felt like a waste of money so that's why I'm giving 2 stars.

m51FYIsTvdtIg0uKSN2MXQ.text: Perfect place in Shadyside for a cocktail or bite to eat with friends.  Several levels of seating including outside patio setup.  Cocktails are handcrafted and unique - the blueberry basil lemonade is a must try item!

FjOpVLLwM9PBRsQYHV0QrQ.text: Harris Grill is great - but what's NOT great??? Why they even bother being on the Nowait app. Put our name in for a 30 minute wait for party of 6, got there when they said our table was up only to be told we had to wait another 40 minutes? Why even be on the app if it doesn't work?!? Stupid.

9afeXbPowLzGO9y5ONiukw.text: Decent food, but average. Not really anything you couldn't make better at home. (Delivery)

FxhnGqCWRvk_wslzm4FtBw.text: I really liked this place!!  The atmosphere is inviting and cozy.  We ate upstairs at the table facing the window and it was a nice spot to relax and people watch. It looked like they had other cozy group seating arrangements up on the second floor too.  Our waiter was really nice and attentive.    The menu is great.  Not so much that you get lost, but covers enough for everyone's taste....and it's full of jokes and hilarious descriptions.  Lots of comfort food, and tasty twists on classics.  They have a huge drink menu (...more like book) with lots of creative originals.  I had the Jamaican chicken mac special (the dish may have actually been titled "Imagine the Rastabilities").  The serving was huge, and the mac was awesome.  It was a bit too spicy for me (but still SO GOOD...worth the pain), but that's just my taste and I think it was a really cozy meal.

Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ya7qZlV3yCiNVMj5K0R2Ag.text: My family was in town visiting and we wanted to stop and relax for some brunch before they hit the road. I can not say enough about our waiter! He did so great with my two year old niece and my sister (who was a server herself) said it was the best treatment she's had with a two year old in a very long time. Thank you for all being so considerate. The food was awesome and we will definitely be back!

h6q-tnDwFp0ycgStQfbDgw.text: Great bar service but horrible host. Asked to sit outside - was told it would be a 10 minute wait when we arrived. After 45 minutes of sitting at the bar, no one from the hosting staff came over to offer us one of the several open tables outside. Left and had dinner elsewhere... despite the nice bar tenders, I was pretty disappointed.

PExblW7X6yA_XLG_1voYeA.text: PSA: there is a groupon for this place that is valid until May 2015!  Burger was good. Mac and cheese was a little salty and not very warm but it wasn't terrible. Cookies and cream dessert was super yummy.   Service was very attentive and we went on a Saturday night.   Kinda dim and loud in there...it is a bar after all, and there is some interesting religious art work on the walls.

7eewZQk8lgC6vVzjN_k-FA.text: Harris Grill is type of place that I enjoy when I'm there, but isn't crave-worthy enough to make me a regular. The fun menus, nice staff, solid beer selection, and good food won't disappoint (and bacon night is always a plus) but there's very little that you can find at Harris that you can't get - or top - somewhere else. That's the primary reason that I'll rarely wait for a table when it's busy.  The mac & cheese is a standout, as many will tell you. Rich and creamy, with the cavatappi pasta being the difference...definitely a winner! As far as the food goes, I've never really had anything that I didn't like, but many items that I used to love are no long on the menu (pulled pork sliders being the main one, but the big sandwich is still there). Nowadays, I usually go for the fish tacos (good, but not a lot of fish on them) and the hummus, which is excellent. Henny Penny is another go-to, but be warned, as the spice levels have varied from time-to-time from so-so spicy to mouth-on-fire spicy.  If you're looking for a nice vibe in good weather, it's fun to try your luck landing a table on the patio. Service can occasionally be slow outside and it almost always gets crowded, but it definitely beats the inside when it gets packed. The only real downside is that it gets packed most nights, and as mentioned before, it's not really worth the wait. Enjoy!

YceIY8ucsGAIEEexe4vVpw.text: Harris Grill is 100% OK. The service is nice, the drink list is nice, the menu (albeit confusing) is nice, and my overall experience has been...err...nice.  Everything is a little expensive, and I don't really understand the menu (are they joking in some places? Is it supposed to be serious? Why is everything priced awkwardly?), but they have a solid brew list and the outdoor seating is crucial.  Take a date here, take a group here, or come on a Sunday morning for their brunch (which is also nice).

tjd2szjEzjZNZn4R-YNaow.text: One of my favorite Pittsburgh restaurants. Had the Spinach dip and a crab cake sandwich. Both were delicious. Service was excellent even though it was a busy Saturday evening. Stop here. It's worth it.

m5naqskvizPuMrkhLyg0UA.text: stopped in the Harris Grille last night after doctor visit. Doug our server was fantastic, he was very knowledgeble on all the menu items. he could list the make up of every item. very impressive. they had a unique and interesting list of foods. Both of us had superior Bloody Mary's. I had a carnitas (pulled pork sand) on a pretzel roll with the best Gazpacho I've ever tasted. Wife had a great Flat Iron on Mac & Cheese, very, very  good. We sat in the "Mural Room" trying to interpret the mural with Doug. very interesting. U must go and enjoy this unique grille. It's a fun place in a cool part of PGH.

KRax55gKk3k3DCTXe84Jbw.text: Harris Grill is definitely one of my favorite places to go in Shadyside. Their happy hour is the best in the neighborhood - their beer selection is diverse and interesting, the frozen Cosmos are both delicious and strong, and the apps pair well with them. But the best part of every trip to Harris is our most of the time waiter Justin. Every time we are at Harris he is friendly, responsive, and knowledgeable about the food/drinks served. We have been there with large groups where people keep moving seats (sorry!), and he always gets the bills correct. He is a fantastic waiter and a big reason of why we keep going to Harris. (Also, the man looks great in tight pants!)

d7Bg-qDlrB6O1Z-9ePD9LQ.text: Being an outsider to Pittsburgh, I wasn't expecting much before we walked into Harris Grill. As soon as we entered, it was clear that this place had a lot more ambiance.   The Pro's: - The menu is funny. - There are a fair number of vegetarian options which are clearly labeled - The onion rings are amazing. - The portions are large, you can get more than you fill for a good price - They have root beer floats! - Our server was hilarious, you know that self-deprecating kind of humor  The Con's: - There were a lot of items that had run out - The service was a bit slow...it took forever for that root beer float to come out.  Overall, I'd come back!

Gik8d31O7RPJSZ79qyr5mw.text: I cannot speak to the merits of the cuisine here, but I will discuss the bar menu with which I was thoroughly satisfied.  Harris Grill features extensive outdoor seating arrangements, making for a pleasant visit on a summer afternoon. The draft beer selection is respectable and caters to a wide range of taste for craft brews. The bottled beer selection is likewise commendable and versatile. I like that there were enough options to please the palate of almost any beer drinker, but not so much as to weight the menu down with endless variations on the same style. Far too many establishments invest heavily in a quantitative selection that actually inhibits customers from trying a few quality beers by swamping them with a lengthy draft list. I would recommend Harris Grill for a casual beer with friends.  Cocktails: The "Gods Swill" cocktail menu at Harris Grill features a nice balance of classic cocktail variations and a few house blends with the emphasis rightly placed upon the former. I was pleased to find a half dozen variations of the manhattan, a cocktail of whiskey, wine, and bitters, that were each unique takes upon this staple of the American bar. I was disappointed in their "Rye Mint Julep" as, being from the south, I do not take to soda in my whiskey, particularly in a mint julep. The drink was watery and lacked the viscosity of a proper julep. I was impressed with the "Chelsea Manhattan" (served "up" after my experience with the julep) and would say that all considered, the Harris has a strong bartender. The cocktail menu itself is accurate if verbose.  The service was neither slow nor fast, with attention at the right moments and minimal interruptions. A great level of service for enjoying a few drinks. The food is by all appearances standard bar fare but who cares; the lord didn't give me a liver for eating. A very enjoyable bar and outdoor seating arrangement. Although I did not probe the wine selection, I would recommend the Harris Grill's bar to beer and cocktail enthusiast alike.

yB9gaLLE2qxeQhGtuXGRGQ.text: Let me tell you about my experience at the Harris Grill, I know I have eaten here before, years ago. So I was in need of a lunch and off to the garden. I decided a nice salad would do the trick so I ordered the Salad de la Burgh. While I waited for my meal I was sitting in the little room right off the bar, first thing I notice is the table is a tad sticky, then I noticed the hole in the wall. After these little gems I started to scope out the place, kind of soak in the atmosphere. "Filth" the joint is run down and fifthly, make matters worse was the cement block propping open the door to the patio outside ( this is the front door to the restaurant people ).  The restaurant was busy and my server was a pleasant enough young woman. I received my beverage and then started to check the staff out and how unkempt most of them where, jeans extremely tight and unflattering on the best figures, Harris Grill shirts were not much better trust. I long for the day when restaurants hired servers because they had mad skills not because they are young or hip. My favorite is when I realize that under the host station there were bus pans ( dirty & full ), one young employ thought nothing of maneuvering it with her foot ( disgusting it is on the floor but also the unsanitary way it was handle ) Let me now explain the salad I got for eleven dollars and some cents. The lettuce was about a cup spring mix I think, not crisp and wilty, and kind of room temperature. The chicken was cold, so was the few fries they put on it, and a half a hardboiled egg. I think I found a few pieces of onion? Two grape size tomatoes, and two thin slices of cucumber. "Oh" there was a sprinkling of mozzarella or provolone cheese on it, could not tell which ( they say both so I will go for that ). This was placed in an average soup bowl. To say I will ever go back to the Harris Grill is a definite not & I will warn others to avoid.  "PS" I did not expect the salad to be huge or grand but decent and somewhat hearty, this was subpar, could have gotten a better one at Wendy's and it would have been warm meat, and fries ...

TvemmFbSQr-KP1ROjNwnfw.text: Harris Grill was long one of my favorite spots to goto just about any night of the week.  However it's changed in recent months and I don't think I will return.  On a recent Thursday night, my friend and I had possibly the worst waitress ever.  Her name was Amanda and this is my story about her as our waitress.  She was not present for about 15 minutes after we were sat.  She finally appeared and asked us for our drink order. She disappeared for about 10 minutes before returning.  She served us our drinks then immediately left for another table. It was another 5 to 10 minutes before she came by again, this time taking our order for food.  She return 5 minutes later with another round of drinks which we don't remember ordering, but we weren't going to complain. We never saw her the rest of the night.  Other waitresses were making their rounds every 5 minutes out on the patio, but ours never appeared once.  I thought she may have died in back in the kitchen or was burned beyond recognition.  I even asked one of the other waitresses out of concern for her safety if she was okay.  She said they would check.  She returned not long after and said she was alright.  I relaxed a little, until another 15 minutes went by... it was now about 30 minutes since we had ordered and no food.  We waited a bit longer, we still hadn't seen Amanda (our waitress for those paying attention).  An hour went by and we had had enough. I really couldn't believe this.  Not only did we not have our food, but we hadn't seen our waitress in an hour.  An hour.  What the hell?

3HYelLNiRYkGOyMlr41B2g.text: I used to be a regular at Harris Grill until I moved a bit further away, but I still try to return for the I Can Haz Bacon Cheesburger and Bacon night. Where else can you go on a Tuesday and order a side of bacon with your meal?  While Harris isn't the only place in Pittsburgh where you can get your drinks delivered to you by a cute hipster waitstaff, it certainly has one of the widest & best beer selections in the city. I've also heard tell that the frozen cosmos are quite good.

w3Sx6uk9Vh22r06-xJcLWQ.text: Great place to be at on Friday or Saturday nights. The patio outside is sweet. They also have a "patio" in the back, but don't go there. It feels like a lost dungeon. The upstairs is nice and the crowd is a good looking crowd.

03_nKqlRhIrTWW7AoRX4zw.text: I eat at Harris' all the time.  I don't even MEAN to, I just happen to end up here a lot.  I think it's because it's the kind of place that lots of people can agree on - pretty good food and drinks and a KILLER patio.  For me, the patio kicks it up from 4 to 5 stars.  in the winter they don't serve lunch.  In the summer this place is hoppin' all the time and yes, I'm that jerk hogging a giant table waiting for my friends to show up - they're just PARKING.  (speaking of parking - don't park in the lot next door you WILL get towed!)  None of the other reviews mentioned yet that they recently changed the menu - one of the great new additions is the BBQ pork sandwich.  I love it in slider form - get the coleslaw with it and stick it on the sando.  delish.  I don't even LIKE coleslaw - including on a primanti's bros sando - so you know it's good.  The mac and cheese (add the andouille sausage!) is a staple and you can get a mini version as a side to an entree for just a little extra.    Another new addition is the chicken fried bacon - yes, you read that correctly.  It is a hearty plate of bacon that is battered and fried and comes with white gravy.  I've shared it 3 times with friends and each time it's been a little different but also kind of left me a little queasy although with a happy novelty food feeling.  I would definitely not recommend one person trying to eat this unless they were trying to commit suicide by bacon - which I also don't recommend - and I LOVE bacon.     Overall I love this place and I don't think the drinks are more expensive than most of the other places on Ellsworth - half price frozen cosmos are definitely worth it.  Service is also usually great.

zHsZd2AE9TkFxdivOCIQ7Q.text: Relaxed, laid back atmosphere and fun menu with healthy options. Always good drinks. It's a great place for either a date, an evening out with friends or even a work happy hour. No complaints about Harris Grill!

okxyiSOqWw9F2CYO1XO3qw.text: They tell me it's global warming; but, I just don't want to get into a scientific/political debate about this. All I'll say is if global warming means I get these beautiful nights in early November, I don't know what the big deal is. Ok, before I get flamed, I'll just continue with my review...  I was fortunate enough to eat at Harris Grill on a beautiful night in early November. The temperature was just about perfect for a fall night to eat out on their patio. The outside seating gives a really nice atmosphere to wind down after a long day at work. Now I know why people like coming here for Happy Hour. The inside has a nice lounge area, also good for getting to know your co-workers outside of the office structure. I give it a good solid 4 stars for the restaurant itself.  The food is okay too. I had the Lettuce Pray - seared tuna and grilled peppers with lettuce to wrap it all in. I liked it; it was a nice small snack to accompany my beer. I did enjoy the entertaining menu names. The beer selection is not that big, but they have an ok variety to choose from.  For the food, I'll give it 2.5 stars because, although it wasn't bad, it also wasn't anything to remember.   3 stars for Harris Grill. I would definitely recommend this place when you just want to go out on a casual fun night with friends. You can grab a drink, order something to nosh on, but you're really there to enjoy the company.

akdydxIADbOQtehbmMIjRQ.text: 1 of 5 stars  Nice outdoor patio, great beer selection, cool old house, but in general the venue is kind of dirty, and our server was seriously on overdrive, running about all herky jerky spouting his funky hipster spiel a mile a minute. Ordered a $12 Caesar salad; menu description included the ingredients buried in some lengthy weird non-description that referenced Caligula.  Wow!  How did they know that CALIGULA was exactly who I wanted to envision as I ate my meal.  Caesar salad arrived: romaine lettuce, institutional croutons, sprinkle of parm cheese, teaspoon of dressing. Hmmm. Asked the waiter where the chicken was. He noted that he "forgot to ask if we wanted it added". It's no wonder, the poor chap, as we had to wade through the Caligula verbiage to point out that it was supposed to come WITH chicken (not sure why they didn't pull out all the stops and make a reference to teenage hooker Iris in Taxi Driver too. Caligula and A LITTLE BIT OF CHICKEN! Har de har har! Ain't I clever?) Anyway, the menu leaves one with the impression that its author might have been hyped up on any myriad of mind altering substances, and thought themselves to be oh so cheeky. But what the heck, right? To each his own. Apparently somebody likes the place as reflected by the positive reviews, but in my humble opinion our food was lack luster, our server could have used some Chamomile tea (hey, was his name Fire Marshall Bill?), and their menu was so tedious, ugh, I'll never return.....even if I want to know "Where do babies come from".  That's the menu title for sliders. Yup SLIDERS. Ya want some MAYO with that?!  Har de har har AGAIN!!!  I'm so funny right? RIGHT???    P.S.  Can I just order some FOOD please?  For the love of Pete.

-zYMqhN2EHkHvR7TBDpo3g.text: Great ambience and good food! Got their spinach dip and lasagna aubergine. Both of those were amazing!

I4ah5oezj4FmhudUjFZvAw.text: Most of the reviews are regarding slow service and crappy waitresses.  While things such as that must be mentioned, I have to say Harris Grill is a favorite spot of mine. It was the go to place for large groups and a small catch-up with a friend. The frozen cosmos with a shot of chambourd is AMAZING.  4 bucks between 4:30 and 6:30.   YUM!  2 of those and you won't notice if the service is slow or not! I think the food is great and I love the upstairs view and the patio out in front.  The one time I had a less than stellar meal, my waitress removed it from the bill with no hassle. I will always stay an advocate of Harris.  It is a happy place for me!

TpwuvIFyQr9EeCLhMkircQ.text: My husband and I tried Harris Grill for the first time on a Sunday night. We moved to the area in August and are moving away in June, and unfortunately decided we won't be coming back here before we leave.   There was only one very small table open in the crammed dining room downstairs when we got there. I'm not sure if there were tables open upstairs, but it didn't look like the hostess checked before seating us. Our table was facing the door, so I kept feeling the cold air every time people came in and out, and we were very close to the table behind us, beside us, etc. We eventually asked to move, but I thought the hostess should've asked us if that table was okay before seating us there - because I would've rather waited for a better one to open up.  I thought the selection on the menu was pretty poor. I wanted an entree rather than a salad or a sandwich, but since I didn't feel like Mexican or a huge plate of macaroni & cheese, there were really only a handful of options. None of them appealed to me, so I ended up ordering the "Henny Penny," a chicken sandwich. I asked for the spicy chipotle mayonnaise on the side because I have a really low tolerance for spiciness. When it came, the mayonnaise was on the sandwich. I said I would try it in case it wasn't that spicy, but when I took a bite I felt like my mouth was on fire! Then the waitress asked me if I knew the chicken itself was spicy. The menu said nothing about that, so I had no idea. She suggested they re-make it with plain chicken, which was nice, and it was fine after that. I also had the sangria, which sounded like it would be amazing from the description, but I actually didn't think it was good at all :( It tasted really watered down to me.   A few redeeming things: the mac & cheese that came with my sandwich was really, really good! My husband liked the fish tacos he had, and three different people checked up on me after the incident with my sandwich, so we at least felt like the staff was pretty attentive.

YBGK7b9-KpdqRkc2Lq42_w.text: I frequent Harris Grill quite often. Whenever we need a place in walking distance I always pick them over all the other high priced or mediocre Shadyside restaurant/bars. Their menu changes seasonally and is always hilarious (more so than Mad Mex, which they poke fun at along with other local restaurants). They're surprisingly vegetarian friendly for the amount of meat they have on their menu. I have not had anything here that wasn't delicious; favorites will come and go, but I'm a fan of their HUGE salads and the eggplant lasagna (noodle free).   Absolutely go for brunch - Sundays 10 to 2. It will either be a buffet or a menu for a fixed price of $13. VERY meat heavy, but I'm sure there is always something veggie-friendly, but never expect vegan-friendly. They include two drinks and a fresh fruit plate - one of the drinks can be a bloody mary (which we got and regretted, it was very unpalatable) or a frozen mimosa (get that instead).   What I really love, aside from the fantastic food, is the creative cocktails. These drinks are going to be on the $8.50 side, some are worth it and some aren't, but The $3 Frozen Cosmo happy hour is the best deal on Ellsworth. Even if you're a manly man, this very pink booze slushie is amazing. Go with a big group and ask for the lounge upstairs or a window booth. Service is usually either chipper and delightful or just barely okay. We don't come here for the service or the dim lights - we go for a good meal and you should too.

7Y7wX_GC3DDKMYSEtl3djQ.text: Harris has a nice patio and a decent bar, but good luck getting served.  If it is crowded or the bar is just full I've always had to wait to get served.  The beer selection is decent, but not all that big.  For a much larger beer selection check out Buffalo Blues a few blocks down the road.  The best part is the patio, if you want decent food and good outdoor seating, Harris is a good choice - if you don't mind waiting.

7Qf6vsdtc6fpivu86VcUEw.text: This place just bored me. Really don't know what to say. Bored, bored, bored, bored, bored.

RgFWJSdOsmfm_n8TPK3Rjg.text: One of the best casual restaurants in Shadyside, and to echo a previous reviewer, always at the top of my list when I want someplace walkable.    My most recent trip was this past Saturday (1/23/10).  I was hoping that the unseasonably warm weather would make for good outdoor dining on their awesome patio (I'm pretty sure they were voted near the top for outdoor dining in one of the local Pittsburgh magazines) however, the rest of my party nixed that idea.  My usual order includes the mini pulled-pork sandwiches (swine & dandies), the mini crab cake sandwiches (crabby-patties), a side of the macaroni and cheese (I defy you to find better mac & cheese in Pittsburgh) and the buffalo wing dip.  I would highly recommend any of these dishes.  This trip, I tried the pierogies for the first time.  They were decent, although they seemed a little overcooked on the outside (too much time in the frying pan).  I also had the full sized pulled pork sandwich and a side of the aforementioned mac & cheese.  As usual, these were great.    I definitely recommend giving this place a try.  As other reviewers said, the frozen Cosmo's are great, and definitely add the shot.  For beer drinkers, their prices are somewhere between fair and overpriced, but they have a very large selection of unique bottled beers.

LwrgN4K513cBPgMKFkS-Lw.text: This is the bar that will not die, nor should it with it's awesome outdoor space.  These guys have one of the best patio areas in the Burgh, second of course to Mallorca's outside area.   The food is creatively named but otherwise not their dramatic strong suit.  Granted, everything I've had there is good (pierogies, chicken breasts named "Nice Breasts", Turkey Burgher), but not overly spectacular.   The beer menu, however, is inspired.  These guys stock more unique beers like Omegang Hennepin and Victory Ales that are not usually on most bar menus in town.    And you have to give this bar credit for using a flame-logo after having burnt down 3 times.

ybNrCtm8G47ZbxKzQYC-QA.text: A pleasant enough little place for "Hipster Yinzers" to engage in those unique conversations where everyone talks simultaneously and loudly and no one is heard. The fare is somewhat overpriced for minuscule drinks, meager portions and lackluster service.  Oddly, everyone seems to rave about their tater tots......yeah, the same processed frozen spud you enjoyed in elementary/parochial school.

EbnbHW9XoSW83UrRir7GUg.text: My 1 star is as misleading as their drink menu. Who the fuck has a table of contents on their drink menu. I instantly saw "Grill cocktails.........4" and so I ordered a cocktail. I get my bill, ask my server and she responds "Yea that happens a lot, but if you look at the pint of beer, there's no way it's 22 (bucks)" Yea no shit but if it happens a lot, why not fucking remove the table of contents? The drinks were tasty and the venue is nice and so normally I'd give it 4 stars.

NDaUcNfihcR4O3yi5ghymw.text: I was in Pittsburgh on business, and wanted to get dinner with my nephew. He just moved to Shadyside, and didn't know Harris Grill. We went based on the Yelp reviews and loved it top to bottom. It's a cool place outside and in, and the staff was fun and friendly. There's something great about a restaurant with a happy staff. Rare these days. Anyway, we shared a delicious pierogi app, he had a steak sandwich that he loved and I had a unique strip steak over mac and cheese. The decor is a mix of grill and grunge with the right amount of humor. Definitely a step above in terms of feel, nothing low-end here.

f0DIKc1yDj8XWb9LnooNYA.text: Food: the food at Harris grill is the epitome of average, nothing is great and nothing is terrible, everything is mediocre, there are plenty of options for vegetarians, and they have an unnatural love of bacon here, the appetizers are more interesting than the entrees  Price: too expensive for the quality of the food, the prices aren't staggering, but considering the quality of the food it feels like you are overpaying for nearly everything  Drinks: beer is one of the strengths of Harris, always a good selection of draft beers, and an extensive bottle beer list, the mixed drinks are all average to below average though and the bartenders do not mix good drinks, aside from the signature Frozen Cosmo I would stay away from everything, including the mojito  Atmosphere: this is what you pay for at Harris, they have a beautiful porch for outdoor seating in the front, an equally nice back porch, and the inside decor is pleasant as well, the menus are very cleverly organized and a lot of personality was put into the presentation  Service: the service is average at best, we have had meals and specific orders confused multiple times, service is also slow  (+): great location, great atmosphere, good beer  (-): overpriced food, poor service, worse bartending  Would I go back again? Only because I live nearby.

pShnceEsMfl3k9Qk6RkILA.text: Your lips are attempting to distract me from the heinous crime you're committing.   That's what I said to the urinal in the Men's room at the Harris Grill. The urinal that is a bright-red lipped mouth is a fine idea; however, you blew it when you placed it within 6 inches of the sink, sans partition.   Having said that...Harris Grill left a taste in my mouth that wasn't the pink urinal puck...it was of the fine Belgian Ale on tap (a clean tap with ample choices from Troeg to Belgian seasonals) and the half-price wings that were keeping me sweaty on the chilly September Pittsburgh patio. Harris Grill goes down as the first place I fully enjoyed a wing sauce that wasn't Buffalo...their Jamaican Jerk made me boogie.   The pulled pork and slaw was traditional, which I appreciated.   Forgo the thought you'll park close to Harris...it's tucked in a great neighborhood...embrace the walk. Embrace the heat of the wings. Embrace what local joints in Pittsburgh have to offer.

MiIv9Jxo_pHgGU2lrVFudw.text: The vibe here is great. The servers et cetera have great energy and are the kind of people I'd like to invite to sit down and share dinner with them. I have only been there twice. I had the Henny Penny twice and it was a very different sandwich on each visit. The first time it was over-spiced. It was dry and I'd swear it had no cheese. The second time, it was moist, cheesy, just the right amount of spice and it was delicious with fries and a Lagunitas IPA (or two.) If the food was more consistent, I'd give it four or more stars. Updates as they happen....

nfm_jMMcXYDHT6AF1LF3IA.text: I have nothing good to say about this place. I've been here on several occasions over the years and here's what I have observed:  1- If the place is crowded (which it almost always is) expect terrible service from your waiter/bartender. Waitstaff has a pretty poor knowledge of their own drink menu.  2- The food will be overpriced/sub par. On one occasion me and my entire party got food poisoning from their fried calamari  3- You will be seated somewhere awkward/uncomfortable. The interior is cool looking but not functional, gets very congested when there are big crowds.   There are plenty of other bar/restaurant destinations in Pittsburgh that can deliver and execute the same idea in a much better way. Avoid Harris Grill.

3vOiSrk0zVvzdQMMzjHM8w.text: I've been in Pittsburgh this past weekend for the first time in four years, so my two visits to the Harris Grill recently were the only ones I've made since it burned down a few years back.  Prior to that, I lived in Pittsburgh and ate at the Harris Grill at least a couple times each month.  Fortunately, not much has changed in the time I've been gone.  Sure, there are a few new things on the menu, and some of the old items are gone, but, as always, the draft beer list rocks, the servers are awesome, the food is fantastic, and the clientele is fabulous.  I think my girlfriend and I broke open the front porch for the year on Friday, as we sat, alone, in the chill Spring afternoon, eating amazing hummus and drinking beers and cocktails.  We won't be back again (at least) until the end of June, so Harris employees, please keep the seats warm and the beer cold!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The only thing you need to know about the men&#39;s room: its name is Kisses.

3atgH5zW4vfNP1wPxa1UaA.text: What a cool place. We were having a bad night out for food. One place packed one place blaaaaa. We walked out of place two. That's when we went to Shadyside and went to The Harris Grill. We have seen it before but never have gone and I'm not sure what we waited. Cool place great atmosphere and the food was top notch. My wife went with the steak salad with the steak RARE and they hit the mark. I had a sample and it was great. Me I opted for the vegetarian zucchini pasta dish. It was awesome. Zucchini, olives, fresh mozzarella, other vegetables with pesto. My wife had a glass of the house Cab and I had a nice Otter creek pale ale but in retrospect I wish I would have went with a nice Blanc. Great place defiantly give it a try........

f4kPwrXhB99OecVl7GFJJA.text: Went to Harris tonight, and everything was very good. Dexter, our server was very patient and helpful with us order our food. He was very attentive, and followed up several times to make sure everything was fine. The drink and the food I ordered was perfect, and came out with in reasonable time.

TOtUyTOukP7o5ZiMTXekfg.text: Great place for Sunday brunch (they only serve brunch on Sundays) I have had a hard time since moving to the east side of the country to find a brunch that is worth talking about. Harris Grill does brunch and spicy bloody marys right. The service during Sunday Brunch can be a bit slow..but aren't we all after a good night out?

nMzECPaSxhP5D66qf7dDhA.text: Really fun place to go, especially if you have a sense of humor and enjoy good food.  I've been here twice and never been disappointed.  Their menu descriptions change periodically, as if one of their staff members got a degree in comedy writing but hasn't made his/her big break yet.  It's always fun reading the menu for the quirky stories that poke fun at CMU students or current events or what have you.  Menu content aside.  I've never been disappointed with the food.  The fish tacos are definitely an excellent bang for the buck, at under $10 (maybe under $9 but I don't recall exactly) and comes with a side of your choice.  The spinach dip is delicious but just a tad too cheesy for me.  I had one of their pasta dishes a long time ago, loaded with chicken and vegetables, which was one of their pricier items, but it was a large dish so I was able to eat it the next day.  Also, if you're not driving, please try their dessert drinks.  Or at least read the menu for it.  You'd have to splurge a little, but they're still worth a try.  For those not interested in dessert drinks or mixed drinks, the beer selection is decent here, too.  Overall, I like coming here.  It's kind of like entering a house, with the various seating areas -- tables if you like (inside or outside), or couches if you prefer to lounge around.  The lighting is dim but warm.  Music is contemporary and lively.  It's a great place for young people.

rRZpcVPwXaydIhR3og3DfA.text: I have to say that I became a Harris convert very early on. I moved a few blocks down on Maryland and this became my mainstay while in Shadyside. This is bar far the hippest restaurant in Shadyside, and it has just enough quirk and a nice clientele to keep my faith in the typically snooty Shadyside goers. The food here is great- with possibly the coolest menu in the city- and a few good vegetarian options to boot. The hummus is good, and the vegetarian chili is incredible. The beer selection and unique cocktails, while a bit expensive, are extensive. And leave room for dessert- the ice cream covered cookie thing is to die for, especially after a couple of drinks. The bartenders are great (except for a douchebag that I believe has recently left). Harris boasts maybe the best brunch with amazing mimosas along with the buffet. In the summer months there is a chef that makes your omelettes however you want them right in front of you. Try the frozen cozmos- I have had some crazy nights off of those.

uQuIrfguZLy59kRQRGLiGA.text: Visited this place three times. I never used to go because it was across the street from the original Elbow Room but three times this summer.   I've usually stuck to the Baby Burgher Platter. Burgers are really tasty and just hit the spot. It's not like having a huge burger, but I've never found myself wanting more. Tonight, I think they had some new fries out. Massive improvement over the old ones!  I've never ordered the entree mac and cheese, but it makes for a tasty side. My sister had the Henny Penny sandwich. Just know....it's spicy as all hell. We thought my sister was going to explode. She couldn't finish it. So, if that's your thing, go for it but be prepared. The Pulled Pork sandwich was also a hit with my family.  As for desserts....they have root beer floats. And that's enough for me. Do they take any skill? No none at all. Is it still wonderful to see one pop up on a menu? Oh yes.  Service has always been very efficient and polite, no complaints or rude servers. Atmosphere is nice but a little too dark and loud for my tastes. Patio usually fills up, but if you set up near the big windows, it's almost the same thing but with AC.  And they're open late (1:30) which is a huge plus for Pittsburgh. Definitely think I'll spend some more time there.

fTJaT6EawyTQ9YTXB6C7jQ.text: I can't believe this place hasn't gotten more 5 star reviews.  People!  This is as good as it gets...well at least when it comes to drinks and blackened chicken sandwiches (Henny Penny).  I've been to all sorts of places, pubs, restaurants, cities and tried variations of the Henny Penny and this is the ultimate in blackened chicken sandwiches.    Overall, I really like the vibe of this place.  It's totally unpretentious although it's in a very prententious part of the city.  The crowd is usually laid back and it's a great place to hang out with some friends, grab some drinks, and eat some killer food.  So what are you waiting for, get yourself a Henny Penny!

JUBSQSDJNII3cucbZm7Fww.text: Considering I live around the corner and eat here all the time, I can't believe I've never given them a shout.  They are dependable for a good meal and stiff drink.  I thoroughly enjoy Tuesday Bacon nights (where they give out baskets of bacon at the bar or you can get them to your table for a buck) and any and all swag from the tap takeovers they host.  It's a good Shadyside crowd and full of familiar faces that don't suck to chat with. Their mac & cheese is crave worthy, as are the pulled pork sliders and the calamari.  Their menu is fun to read and has something for everyone and the atmosphere is relaxed and cozy.  The bar area gets a little crowded for happy hour but whatever, I like it and the big front patio in the warmer months is so clutch.  Yes, sorry Regina George, but I'm still trying to make clutch happen.

s2FXSGbi2GK95Cc7b02jaA.text: So I am a newbie to Pittsburgh and Harris Grill came highly recommended.  Our first visit was great, good food, delicious drinks.  Our second visit the food and drinks were still delicious, however, the service was terrible.    Conclusion, worth a try, just hope you get a good server.

ERaLNTsWjxj8Hjb7qa1Y4w.text: 5-star drinks, 2 star food.  Let's start with the bad. The food here is just all kinds of disappointing. First of all, their labyrinth of a menu. I understand that they are trying to be cute and witty by concealing the item descriptions within paragraph-long stories and forcing you to read them due to the completely nonsensical names they give to said items. I truly understand the concept behind this. But can I be the first to say...IT'S NOT CUTE! For the drink menu, fine. I'll admit to having a few laughs at their PG-13 drink encyclopedia. I'm not that cold-hearted. But when I'm hungry, the last thing I want to do is spend 20 minutes trying to decipher what my options are.  Clearly I have a vendetta against their obnoxious menu, but the real problem here is that the food is the definition of mediocre. I go here fairly often, so I've done a lot of hopping around their menu trying to build my go-to order. I still haven't figured it out, and it's at the point where if my friends want to grab food here, I'll make a point out of eating beforehand. Plus, oh WOW is this place overpriced! This was especially highlighted to me on a Sunday morning when our bill came to $42 for brunch. Not expensive, but the wheels started turning in my head...we just paid $42 for an appetizer, two entrees, and two bloodys, all of which were eh, passable. For exactly $6 more, we could have went down the street to Casbah and had TWO appetizers, two entrees, and two much stronger bloodys, all of much higher quality.  The reason I still come here though is the drinks. My favorite is the Happy Ending which involves pineapple juice, ginger, and cucumber. You really can't go wrong with anything though except for the Statutory Grape--if the name doesn't dissuade you enough, just heed my advice and don't order it. Unless of course, you want to have flashbacks to that time you attempted to robotrip on Dimetapp in middle school. Memories!  It's official, I am done with the food at Harris Grill. Drinks only!!

tgxHPGhky3yDkvq4cllE0Q.text: Harris Grill is a decent place to head to in Shadyside.  The drinks are well-made and the tap selection is nice.  The atmosphere is great and the crowd is hip.  The food, however, has disappointed me on multiple occasions.    Harris is on a nice little section of Ellsworth with a big outdoor deck in front and back.  They're great places to chill out on a summer day.  The inside is nicely decorated and has several levels.    The drinks here are good.  Apparently the frozen cosmo is great, but anything with "frozen" in the name isn't my sort of thing.  The tap selection is constantly rotating.  Happy hour here is great, with cheap beers and wings.  It's one of my favorites in the city.  And of course, no review can go without a mention of Tuesday night, where free bacon is served with drinks!  The food, I'm sad to report, is pretty mediocre though.  Not that they're not trying to have interesting things on the menu, but it all just ends up not being that great.  The prix fixe brunch is similar.  The menu is pretty hilarious, but the food usually disappoints.  The exception is the wings - which do have great sauces, especially the strawberry chipotle BBQ.  The service, however, is very good, as are the bartenders.  BOTTOM LINE:  Go here, but stick to the drinks or wings.  It's a fun place with a great atmosphere and happy hour.  Prices are moderate and pretty standard for Shadyside.

5pvan5ZNL7Vh0rl07xJ4zQ.text: I don't understand why this place is so popular.  I've been there 4 times and each time the food was pretty gross.  Most recently, I ordered a Del Monico sandwich and the thing was dripping with oil.  The beer list is decent.

AS3hoeqeGNg_YW8hKmvoiA.text: So, I have to admit, I really am in love with Harris. I think its a mutual relationship. So far. I don't know how I gave it 4 stars before. I apologize Harris, lets try this again. Harris has never let me down (can't say that about any other relationship that I've been in). Every single time I go there, I just love it. You can just tell ingredients are perfected by someone who knows what they are doing. It has a unique character in both the food and the atmosphere. If someone is coming from out of town that wants a casual, not super expensive meal, I usually take them here at least once, and every time they love it.

JHYzQIDgT8yvgpAk0wSeig.text: SERIOUSLY AMAZING.  My friend introduced me to this gem during my weekend visit to Pittsburgh and I have not stopped thinking about it since.    The menu was fun and the food was perfect.  I went with one of her recommendations and ordered the Delmonico A Go Go, which will now be the high standard that every sandwich I eat from this day on will probably be measured against.  The bread by itself would have been delicious but then it was piled with quality toppings -  steak, grilled onions, peppers, mushrooms and swiss cheese.  I then followed her recommendation to get the tots as my side...and I know what you're thinking tots are tots...but now they are the perfect little crispy side dish to an already perfect entree.   FLAWLESS & WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delmonico A Go Go and tots

nFice9Oi5MeI5n4zZqCWig.text: Harris seems like one of those bars that you go to when you're tired of the usual things. From creative drinks to an entertaining menu to multiple different events per week, it seems like you'd rarely get bored here. Having only been twice, I am not sure if the food is as unmemorable as some other reviews say, but we personally enjoyed both dining experiences, one as a Sunday brunch buffet and the other a late night dinner. The star of the brunch for us was the eggs Benedict as well as the hash station, and we found ourselves refilling several times.   For our second visit we ordered tacos and a pork shank special. Both came with vegetables that were grilled nicely--some were pretty much burnt on the outside but those were easy to take out, and the rest was super flavorful. The tacos had a crispy tortilla shell and ample fillings, but the pork shank stole the show. Lots of tender meat and super tasty. It was also huge and was more than worth its price.  Service was a bit slow but it's understandable. Having multiple levels so that you can choose to be farther away from the bar was definitely nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork shank special

FZg2bMx6OT0QY9bAglEr5w.text: Good place to hang out with friends, with outdoor seating as well. Friendly service, good drinks. Especially liked their vegetarian chili and loaded tater tots.

mlppEh_WYvwe7vt5oT-MBA.text: Sunday Brunch unnecessarily complicated and underwhelming. Buffet crappy and uninspiring. Low grade lox and only flavored cream cheese on dinky gooey bagels. I don't think they get it. Weird sliding price scale for kids. WAITER FORGOT MY COFFEE. Better choices for the money. Seemed popular.

SL6Nmu9W6Jz6juU0Jgdm9g.text: We had an awesome late night dining experience at Harris Grill last night.  We decided to sit and order at the bar and I was really glad that we did.  The bartender provided us with such wonderful service.  Harris Grill never seems to let me down!

2QGLGPtzS9vR6lyDRsLjOw.text: Food was great but service was "meh." The Macaroni and Cheese is delicious! My friend and I also split the Queso which was phenomenal. However, the wait time to get the food was super slow so by the time we got these dishes the pasta was cold and we had to ask the waiter to take it back. Moreover, I was given the wrong drink (I ordered a beer and was brought champagne.) This is a great place to meet friends but always busy (usually a wait for a table.) The drink selection is very extensive and makes up for this wait though!

qZd-lsMCAjWCE9jwh_JMcw.text: It's time for an update, as promised, since I revisited Harris Grill the weekend before last.  This time, I came with CM and a friend of his for dinner, instead of late night drinks and snacks.  Although we came at prime time (around 7:00pm on a Sat.), unlike my last visit, it wasn't crowded at all, which was probably due to the snowy/cold weather.  This time, instead of being seated at one of the cramped tables next to the staircase, we were seated at a prime corner table upstairs with a great view of Ellsworth Ave.  Between these factors, our visit was off to a good start.  After perusing the menu, I decided to go with the pork shank special ($17), and CM ordered the jerk chicken tacos ($12).  Additionally, as promised, I ordered the large mac and cheese again to split, to which we decided to add bacon ($13).  CM's friend went with the turkey burger ($9), which came with fries.  Upon being served, my pork shank entree looked quite impressive, impaled with a knife and surrounded by steamed veggies and some mashed potatoes.  When I tried it, however, it tasted like something from a chain restaurant--meaning that while it wasn't bad, it wasn't particularly special, either.  I didn't try CM's jerk chicken tacos, but he seemed to enjoy them, and I didn't ask his friend what he thought of the turkey burger, so I can't offer an opinion on those items.  As for the mac and cheese, this version was better than the version I'd had previously.  This time, it had an acceptable amount of cheese (although it would have been improved by even more...), and the bacon added some savory depth to the flavor.  As before, it came sprinkled with bread crumbs underneath the bacon, which gave it some extra crunch (as mentioned previously, I enjoy bread crumbs on my macaroni).  However, some of the noodles were a bit burnt (see photo)--perhaps this was due to toasting the bacon and bread crumbs on top?  Overall, while this was an improvement over the prior version of this dish I had here, it was only okay to good, failing to crack the top echelon of PGH mac and cheeses (score: 7.0/10).  Service was about what I'd expect for a place like this--not super attentive, but there when we needed it.  The check for CM and I came to around $50, which seemed steep for the quality of the food received.  Fortunately, I had a City Dining Card, which knocked off $10, but even so, with tip, we still almost cracked the $50 mark.  Taking everything into account, I'd be willing to return for Happy Hour or Bacon Night, but I doubt I'd return for (regular priced) dinner, since the quality:price ratio was lower than I'd like, and there are many other options in the area. 3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Macaroni and cheese with bacon
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork shank redemption special
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thanksgiving in Blawnox turkey burger

IXS2dx-CsYnZ5S5In3WFdQ.text: I've been frequenting Harris Grill for a few years now and it typically doesn't disappoint. Their outdoor patio is delightful on warm summer evenings, and the inside, while dimly lit and a bit hipster-y, nevertheless feels welcoming and cozy. The menu is written with a heavy dose of sass and snark, which makes it a fun read. Who wants to order boring old chicken tenders when you can order "Britney Spears"? I should probably look into hiring their menu writer to help me jazz up my tech reports for work.  Anyway, I've ordered many things here, and their food is usually solid. My favorite meal begins with a plate of their "church basement pierogies." They cook up a legit pierogie, with a soft, tender shell browned to perfection and housing a ton of delicious, fluffy, flavorful potato and cheese filling. They are *almost* as good as actual church basement pierogies. Then I like to wash down my pierogies with an order of their mac and cheese topped with blackened chicken. Their mac is addictive -- creamy, rich, cheesy and topped with crunchy breadcrumbs. I really like the blackened chicken paired with the mac, as the spicy cajun seasoning on the chicken cuts through the fattiness of the cheese sauce quite nicely. Supremely delicious. I will admit that once in a blue moon the mac and cheese will be a bit dry, which is a bummer. So the consistency is not 100% there. But nine times out of ten, I'm graced with a good amount of cheese sauce and I'm a happy camper. And then I pass out in a carb-induced coma.  The downside here is, of course, their prices. They are pretty expensive. I recently got my standard pierogies-and-mac meal for take out after not having visited for awhile, and I had forgotten just how pricey they are (it was $25 + tip for my meal for take out).  So be prepared to have your wallet cry a little, but the mac and cheese should help cheer it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac and cheese with blackened chicken (take out)
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Church basement pierogies (take out)

1DpUssBfqTCXu1p3x6Nnuw.text: Amazing menu!  Not only are the items unique, but the author of the menu is hilarious!  Good service, good food.

-HviVCfWdTn6_snH0L0-JA.text: This was close to one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had. The single star was solely because my food was delicious. Let's just start by saying that on a Tuesday at 11:30pm the restaurant was moderately busy but at the end of a the dinner rush. We were greeted and promptly seated on the first floor on the other side of the wall from the bar. We sat for a moment until our server came to ask us what we wanted to drink, we told her we were still looking at the menu, to which she returned about 10 minutes later. After placing our drink order (a bourbon peach spritzer, a whisky tango foxtrot, and vodka double), it took at least 20 minutes to receive our beverages. Being in the industry myself, I totally understand being in the weeds and then having to make specialty drinks which can be a couple steps between muddling, pouring, straining, etc. However, I watched the drinks sit in the well while we sat at our table waiting. Mine was good, however the foxtrot was absolutely awful. Between being strong and outstandingly tart it was extremely unsatisfying. One of our friends joined, and another 15 minutes to get his drink (a vodka red bull). We ordered food, which was also a slight wait, but nothing we didn't expect at the end of the night, however we ordered bacon and spinach dip as an appetizer and got it with our meal so we sat hungry until our food finally came. As we were eating, my boyfriend who had ordered a dish that was supposed to have bacon on it did not receive his bacon, but the waitress came so few and far between we just decided to let it go since we had our bacon basket anyways. It was 10 minutes until midnight, to celebrate my birthday, we ordered a round of fireball, which we did not receive until 10 minutes after midnight. I was ready for a second drink, and was nervous to try another specialty drink, so I ordered a double peach and tea which is what my friend was drinking at the table with me, thee bartender came back and said they were out of peach, no problem I'll take citrus and sprite, she came back to the table again asking what flavor I said? Mandarin? Sure, just pour a drink whatever is fine. When she came back, 15 minutes later, my friend at the table asked her twice for another drink (vodka red bull) and she ignored him twice...but 15 minutes later brought him a drink. The over all experience was so mediocre which was a shame because I spoke very highly of the restaurant to my friends who had never been. Our waitress was so unfriendly it was almost rude and was only attentive when it was time to cash out like she was waiting to leave. Sad because I love coming for brunch, but am not sure we will ever be back.

hvlyrVtaoKPMjAriRstAlA.text: First off, I HATE the menu. Its one paragraph per food item, most of which is a rambling joke with seemingly no punchline. None of the dishes are named anything useful, so you end up having to dig for what each dish actually is, not to mention the price. I gave up after the first page and just looked at yelp pictures to figure out what to order. Maybe if I wasn't so hangry it would have been somewhat funny...  The food was okay, I got the chicken wings with strawberry chipotle sauce, about $7.50 for 6 wings. They were fine, nothing to write home about. My boyfriend got the grilled salmon salad for $14, again, fine. I feel like this summarizes my hand-full of experiences here. Nothing on the menu is that cool or daring, and the prices are rather high for traditional bar food.  The best part of my meal was the bloody mary ($7), and I've never been disappointed in my drinks, but I don't think I'll be spending any more money on food. I also wish the cocktails had prices on the menu. Service is always great, and I've never had to wait for a table. Maybe I'll check out bacon night and they'll win me back.

_L7QviGi2aomSdmVbLQMGQ.text: I am not sure how I have not reviewed Harris Grill before, but here we are! It is hard not to enjoy the food...and the occasional free bacon! The mac n' cheese is brilliant, especially the lobster mac! Well worth the $20+ price tag! The last time I went, I switched it up and got a braised beef quesadilla that was amazing! We also shared the hush piggies and oh my goodness! I could have made a meal on those alone!!!! Cheesy..bacony! They are soo good! The only issue I ever have with going there is the menu. It annoys me to no end...I just want to know what's in the food! Some of the descriptions are literally just clever anecdotes with no discussion of a single ingredient. But, ya know, if i order it and it tastes as good as everything I've tried, I'll leave that up to the peanut allergy folks and veggie haters to be upset! Me, I'll continue searching for context clues and taking gambles!!!

KUFYPft8kDGFkfQMEgb2Yg.text: We start with the most important factor of this bar: BACON!  I was here this past Thursday for Happy Hour, for a beyond needed break from studying for my Supply Chain final. The decor is quaint from the first Barstool to the Bathroom [apparently the men's bathroom is a must-see. I will take my friend's word for it] During the warmer months, the outdoor patio area is a great section to soak up from sunshine or enjoy Brunch.   Our happy hour special was great. Do make a point to arrange a group outing here, we offerings are more than accommodating. You cannot pass on the frozen margaritas or one of the craft beer selections.  There is a range of half off appetizers, do a must with the Pierogies. I am so glad that they are still served with the grilled onions and are the non-baked versions that have replaced the originals on so many menus. [You can never go wrong with grilled onions]  Now to return to my first point: This is the only place I know of that has Bacon Night. Every Tuesday [and for us on Thursdays] come to the Bar and snack on strips and strips of delicious pig dripping in its own greasiness. In all shades of burnt eat them on their own or wrap them in their also delicious spinach dip, with or without ketchup/hot sauce/bbq sauce whatever you can get your hands on.  Harris Grill Sunday Brunch is a must, the menu is sassy and clever indulged with witty sayings and includes a drink for an ever low price of $14. I cannot wait for it to get warmer to come back.  The service is amazing, considering we are even greedier with our beers than we are with our bacon. Make sure to tip well and come often.
