Ti9tggUnuhNlHW2hjCBKig.text: I was excited to try Harris Grill after hearing great things from friends, but I was disappointed with my experience at Brunch this morning. We arrived around 10:30am and were seated right away. The waitress came over and stated that the only option was the buffet and there was no menu. She then walked away without giving us any more information or room to ask questions. We decided to go for it, but when we went downstairs there were only a few options to eat. The hashbrowns, Eggs Benedict, and tatertot casserole were all almost gone. The pancakes looked good, but it was taking so long to wait for one that we decided it wasn't worth it. The only redeeming quality about this brunch was the frozen mimosa that came with our meal. If this buffet had been around $8 I would have been okay with this, but $17 for this mediocre food was just not acceptable.

zW4vSF5WGeRvS-LZtJrSiw.text: This restaurant is great for happy hour. They have half off appetizers and draft specials for beer. My wife had the frozen cosmo and she liked it a lot. We split three appetizers for dinner and that was enough. We got the Buffalo chicken dip, tot nachos and pierogies. The pierogies were our favorite. I plan to comeback to try something off of the dinner menu.

I4Eq7fSvcqnypiXoVu5SGg.text: This experience was a lot better than the last time we were here. The wait time was very short. The table was a little weird. We were in a booth upstairs that the middle leaf was taken out so it could be two tables instead of three. The other people on the other side left shortly after we got there, thank God, or else we would have been facing each other.   We started off with a plate of Mac and Cheese to share. Delish. Then I had the Pgh Salad and Chris got the Burger. The salad was good but it wasn't anything special. The salad had more of the crunchy iceberg lettuce than the other mixed greens so eh...   The burger was really good. I had a bite and I kinda wanted to trade meals! He got mashed potatoes instead of the fries, and that was a great choice.   So maybe Harris Grill will get another chance after it redeemed itself yesterday. All I have to remember is to not order a salad.

eU-GzGCwyPFtUUc2t-2haA.text: This is the spot to be on a Tuesday night and I can sum up the reason in one word: "bacon". That's right, every Tuesday is bacon night at the Harris Grill and it's amazing! I mean who doesn't like bacon? And it's even better when it's free bacon!  You don't even have to ask. It's just brought out in baskets and placed in front of you. All the bacon you can eat. What a brilliant concept! A bar wants to sell beer so why not offer something that's salty and chewy and would make you want to drink more?    Oh, and the beer selection isn't all that bad either. I had a Founders Centennial IPA and a Philly Kilty Pleasure. Both paired perfectly with the bacon.  The service was spot on too... although the place was pretty crowded, I got my first beer within a minute of being there and my second beer within a minute of finishing my first. This was all accomplished while the bartender was keeping a steady stream of bacon baskets flowing from the kitchen to the bar. I was with a group of eight others and when it came time for us to leave, the bartender printed out our checks and, without even asking, every one of our checks were correct. Maybe I shouldn't be surprised at this but I think it's pretty amazing how one person can orchestrate all this, making it look so easy and keeping a pleasant demeanor with a smile on his face.   On top of a great gimmick, good beer and fantastic service, I'd be remiss if I didn't comment on the atmosphere. There's seating out doors for the warmer months. The building looks like it was a house at one time that got converted into a bar/restaurant. There's an elegant staircase heading to the second floor, a fire place giving it a nice cozy touch and there's a number of knick knacks throughout. You just feel comfortable being there.  I need to make note to stop by sometime and try one of their "Build-A-Bowl Workshops" for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon and Beer... Mmmmm
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuesday&#39;s Bacon Night
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. squirrel on the wall

R_kO4IOGzR3oUVdBM9d2kA.text: I went for brunch. They have a buffet only - no menu. The buffet of $16 includes one drink (Bloody Mary or Frozen Mimosa). The buffet contained a salad, chef tended omelette station, egg's Benedict, boneless chicken fingers and waffles, potatoes with peppers and onions, bacon, sausage, and bagels with toppings like smoked salmon.   My omelette was really good and made well. I also liked the potato mix and found the bacon to be made at the perfect crispy level - though you had to dig for it as there were a lot of fatty pieces. The Benedict and the chicken and waffles were really basic - literally plain chicken fingers (great stand alone option if you brings kids I guess) and plain waffles.   For the price though you can't beat it and both of the free drink options were good. There is a nice bricked patio out front. And our waitress was really nice. She kept checking on us, she was super friendly, and when she accidentally dropped a knife near one of us when she was clearing a table she gave him a free drink. Proactive and full of smiles.   A neat place to keep in mind if you are in the neighborhood. I had no wait for a table for 4 on a holiday weekend.

OoPwdnmAFdUfbzh1Hfgx3Q.text: Excellent food, great service. Had the Mac and Cheese with steak... cooked perfectly. Everything was absolutely delicious. My girlfriend had the Lobster Mac and Cheese and had only good things to say about it, as well. We had wings as an appetizer, which were done well, especially by Pittsburgh standards.  Parking was no big deal, and the only issue was a bit of a draft from the front door constantly opening and closing, but that's to be expected when it's something like 9 degrees outside.

IZvJ9iuQ7GEIT_NIxi1NGw.text: This was a pretty disappointing brunch experience. There were red flags from the moment we walked in when they stressed that there were no substitutions of any kind allowed, and they had to check with the kitchen to see if they could leave cheese out of a dish that was being ordered by my lactose intolerant friend. Seriously? You had to check that?  The service was friendly, but very slow.  My friend ordered a veggie omlette that arrived in a lake of yellow grease. It was inedible. By the time we FINALLY got the waitress's attention to have her take it back and order plain eggs, she warned us that the kitchen was super backed-up and it would be a very long time for a replacement order. Not ok. The food took another half hour to arrive, at which point, we were no longer hungry. And it tasted mediocre at best.  Highlight: fresh squeezed orange juice included in the price of brunch.  Should have gone to elbow room.

SEhZd8C6gdkmTRUP4BOHgA.text: Went out with some friends for a ladies night.  We had a great time in the environment, our server was very friendly.  I had the truly dirty - which was truly delicios!  Our food was good.  I had the falafel and side salad.  They had a drink menu that is pages and pages long.  We all had good food and great drinks.    (March 10th Bells Brewery will be there)

JkY9GiloASkqEmViy51MVA.text: Nice!  Spacious outdoor patio in the front, but it tends to fill up fast.  That's ok, though, because the inside is comfortable as well and has two floors, the second of which contains a lounge area with couches.  Interesting beer selection, all pretty high quality in my humble opinion.  Our waitress kicked butt, and was friendly enough to chat with us for a few minutes each time she came by.  The burger I ordered was about two inches thick and very tasty.  Our shared pierogies and hummus with pita vanished within minutes.

7V8PAWw9qkMLiyeHwmFcRA.text: Why hasn't anyone mentioned bacon night? Do they still have it? We found this place a couple year ago when we lived down the street in shadsterside.  Everything that I could want and more.. best place in the burgh.  Since moving to DC, I am still on their email list and tear up a little when I realize what specials and events I am missing at Harris.

7Yu6ObXmvebt2JuuxH6bZA.text: Amazing beer selection, wings, pierogies, sandwiches, salads and the best patio in Pittsburgh.  I am especially grateful that it is open again after the fire last summer.  If you can't sit outside, then go to the 2nd floor where you can people watch over Ellsworth.  Staff is awesome, helpful and they really know what they are doing when it comes to beer.  One of the only places I would go to in Shadyside, a great vibe, awesome home made style food and great beers to choose from.

oClDCv-SPHjKFO5zqhUHig.text: only a stupid, spoiled, new york shiksa such as myself would order something on the menu called a latke at a place like this ("the boxty").  it was disgusting and didnt resemble any latke i have ever seen.    lucky me, i had about 4 bloody marys during the hour wait for my table so I was full anyway.

JDmlhPQYgJsZCA80uZp-pw.text: I had heard of "bacon night" from a friend and ended up going to the Harris Grille with some out of towners, hoping we could pull off a memorable bacon-y Pittsburgh experience. Though I'm told others have had better luck our server was forgetful and many jokes were made to explain time and time again why no bacon had appeared. I'd say skip the bacon night. Other wise the turkey burger I had was affordable and tasty with a salad on the side. I had an organic Oatmeal ale that I would recommend. The menu was humorous and others at my table were also pleased with their food. It's a step up from standard bar food and not greasy which is a +. The interior was dark- too dark for my tastes unless your on a date and after that mood. Outside was nice- they ran out of seating shortly after we arrived and several people stood around us, but again, maybe this was an effect of bacon night. Enjoyable enough. I would go back- good chill spot for a group if you can wrangle seats.

SfZfbiRAIx8cR35XBlGobQ.text: I went here last night with a couple of friends befor watchin' the black and gold complete the almost annual boring task of wooping' on some brownie as* in Cleveland.  We were seated upstairs at a great table upstairs facing ellseworth.  The view was great watching many of my fellow burghers' imbibe on a windy Sunday afternoon.  The positive experience ended here.  Well, maybe except for the humorous menu that made me smile.  The waitress was so below average, you know the type... she is doing you a favor by taking your order.  I had the pierogies appetizer which was flavorless potato filling served in a overcooked pasta shell served in vegetable oil with maybe one or two slices of onions.  Come on!  This is Pittsburgh. You should be ashamed.  Then another server brought my burger and I made the unforgivable mistake of asking her to grab me another beer.  Sorry, I know you are not the one who took my order, but you are bringing my food.  I've made this mistake before and usually the person says "okay, I'll let your server know", not "Ummmm, I'm not serving you,, you'll have to talk to your server".  Funny, I thought you might run into each other in the back.  Anyways, the burger was close to inedible burnt to a crisp resembled a hockey puck.  We also tried the hummus which was pretty good.  I ordered a kettle one with cranberry and was brought absolut.  Friends ordered a chicken sandwich and a chicken salad.  They both said they were pretty good, if not a little dry.  Then we had to wait 30 minutes to get our bill.  If they executed the food well and had at least average service I'd be back, however they don't and I won't.

Yw5p6hqpoXxTTIuA7DLbPA.text: A quick bar update: when I was here over the weekend, I noticed that they are now offering a frozen mimosa with Sunday brunch.  During my visit, they were also offering a new cocktail on special.  It consisted of fresh muddled watermelon.  There were even seeds in the glass!  It was tasty and novel, but the amount of triple sec made it too sweetly acidic.

LRr0lvbvCVZ0LsWhWjLjjQ.text: Harris is the best.  Good beer, good bar food, good juke box, decent outdoor seating and all of the Pittsburgh charm you would want from your bartenders, servers and management.  It's my go-to bar when I'm in the Burgh.   It's a bar; it's a good bar--if you're looking for life changing event I would recommend staying home and punching yourself in the face, since you're likely a Nickelback loving douche.

4E4laWfN9qmVGd6iJx36xw.text: So pregnant lady with craving comes to her once-beloved Harris grill- only to find- no cheese curds, no buffalo chicken dip, spinach dip should've been called garlic dip- yuck!!!! Love love love the drinks and love the bartenders- but as far as the food- no more- to add insult to injury- I actually just got back on Yelp to add this- we waited for our check for 20 minutes and the table next to us sat waiting to have their order taken until they went downstairs to ask if someone was going to come up- no- they didn't rush up- they came up 5 minutes later. Terrible terrible service- super disappointed!!!!!

3AipOjNOpXcMFONXIjYOCA.text: Yummy food and cool drinks in a casual atmosphere. Crowded and full of people on a weekday, which is a good thing. Enjoyed the diverse selection of dinner items, especially the salads and drink choices. Salmon salad was tasty and so was my blueberry lemonade! Next time I visit Pittsburgh, I will dine here.

FSFNDKzabx_i7wZ4e49izg.text: How have I NOT reviewed Harris Grill yet!?  I am embarrassed to admit how many times I have been here. Actually, I probably couldn't even figure it out if I tried.  This is a top happy hour spot amongst my friends. You just can't beat the $3 frozen cosmo deal. I can't say I'm usually a fan of bright pink slushy drinks, but a post-work frozen cosmo (or three) on the patio on a warm day? Yes, please.   That being said, we come here a lot in the warmer months as there is always outdoor seating availability. The inside isn't bad either but you have to take advantage of the nice weather when you can!   As far as food, Harris has a selection of 1/2 price apps during happy hour--a good option to soak up some of those cosmos. I've had a number of entree items as well, my favorite being the "Imagine the Rastabilities" (spicy Jamaican jerk pulled chicken mac and cheese). I'm also a fan of the jerk-style tacos and the (oh so classic) Pittsburgh salad. I can't think of anything from here that I haven't enjoyed.  Service isn't terrible, but not the best. We've had mixed experiences. Some of the waiters and waitresses are extremely attentive and friendly, and others not so much. One time it took nearly an hour to get our checks. We actually had to send a member of our party into the restaurant to find someone who could print the checks for us. Right before we left, a manager was coming around to check on tables, and we expressed our frustration to her. She was wonderful about the situation and gave us vouchers for a free entree on our next visit. As a frequent visitor, I really appreciated that she was receptive to our concerns and didn't try to make excuses. I very rarely complain but there was no reason for this kind of hold-up.  Overall, one of the best Shadyside happy hour spots. I'm already looking forward to spring so that I can sip some cosmos and unwind outside!

jF__X382ncQe7Q9ur_ijyA.text: atmosphere is nice, drinks aren't too bad and the kitchen makes good food. however, small portions and high prices. yes don't go to a bar for the food but i'm still seething over the 15 dollars for 10 pierogies that were mostly salt. damn good though, just way too expensive. mac an cheese is pretty good, fairly salty but again way too expensive  if i were choosing a bar on elsworth for a pretty good time and more relaxed atmosphere I would go here. beer snobs, it has a decent selection and tyhe server was very nice.

sIG6_8kkYpJ4Lb4zzKIKcQ.text: Harris Grill is a restaurant in a house that looks like The Addams Family's home, but it doesn't mean you should be afraid to eat there.   You can either sit out front or hide away in the inside OR sit at the bar with giant TV's that usually have on something more interesting than the latest game, sometimes Discovery Channel or Animal Planet.  The food is a little pricey but the quality justifies the cost.  The mac and cheese is amazing and made fresh there.  The presentation and plating felt high end but the place is very casual.  Rumor is Tuesday night is all you can eat bacon night, I'll have to make it for that.  If you go or it's another day, let me know!  Tellem HITTofMCM sent ya!

ipNMRPuU6Y92ART-rwsr9g.text: After the woeful Stillers game vs. Tampa, we did some Yelping to figure out where to go.  Hey 'Burgh...what's up with all your decent establishments being closed on a Sunday?  Harris Grill wasn't, and we're certainly thankful for that.  This review should actually reflect 4.5 or 4.75 stars if possible- just a neat place.  We ventured over and found parking without issue.  I can imagine on a Friday or Sat evening this might be a little more challenging.  Since it was a beautiful fall evening, we opted to sit outside and we were approached quickly by our waitress with water, and asked for a moment to review the hysterical drink menu.  Much props to a place that doesn't take itself too seriously.  Just read the menu and if you have an ounce of humor in your body, you should at least salts (smile a little then stop).  I salt because LOL is so yesterday.  I opted for the manly Sangria, which was outstanding, and she got some lemonade concoction with vodka.  Both were hits.  We also read a lot about the hummus, so we were followers and went with it...very pleased we did.  A great appetizer.  She went with the skirt steak mac n cheese.  I went with the lobster and crab mac.  I'm just going to laugh at my kids when I make them microwave mac n cheese from here forward.  THIS is mac n cheese- it's creamy and fattening and has a crunchy topping and soft noodles (but not too soft) and well...it's perfect.  There were generous portions of lobster and crab in my dish and it was delish.  Her steak was seasoned and cooked to perfection.  I was almost jealous I didn't get it, but then I'd grab a huge hunk of seafood and quickly realize the mistake of my ways.  Both are very rich dishes.  If you can finish the big plate of mac, God bless you---you're a better person than I am.  However, it does make for a wonderful breakfast.  Don't judge me.    She finished with a dessert type drink that featured Rumchatta and strawberries- not my thing (said the guy who ordered Sangria), but she enjoyed it.  Dessert looked tempting, but the button on my jeans was already stressed, and not wanting to hold my pants up on the walk back to the car, I shook off the waitress and asked for the check.  If memory serves, 3 drinks, an app and 2 fine dinners came to roughly $75 plus tip, so, roughly $90....and if I lived there, I'd do it at least once a month or more.  The menu is diverse (and funny).  The service is timely and I saw a manager deal with a couple 'difficult' customers in a way that I'd want my manager to treat any customer.  Pittsburgh's lucky to have this place.  When we're back in town, we'll be going here again.

7huFqAdiS9YYJVyqytiwtA.text: Just around the corner from my work, me and a few coworkers came looking for some play!  We went early and got a cush spot on the top floor with the window.  Clearly it's a hot spot in the neighborhood because it was packed by 7 pm on a Tuesday?!  The outside seating area was buzzing even in the chilly fall weather.    The first quenching sip of that half-price RASPBERRY COSMO and I was sold!  Add on some True "Pittsburgh" food (I'm talking about putting fries in a salad, oh yes!) and other yummy munchies like a super stuffed chicken quesadilla and our fun time was complete!

SPPmsTO3kE1wVM0MgVbhgA.text: Things I love about the Harris Grill.   Outdoor seating.  Great place for summertime/fall time drinks and dinner.  Upstairs couch seating. I always like the comfy atmosphere.   Food. Most selections are always really good. Burgers, hummus, spinach dip. They always have a good rotating menu with seasonal apps and entrees. One I love that used to be a regular and returns at times is the Rita Hayworth and the Pork Shank Redemption. Most delicious pork shank!   Happy hour is good with deals on apps and drinks. Beware the frozen Cosmo. While quite delish, get a driver. I swear to you I had two one night and had to stay at a friend's house up the street.   Things I don't love.  My only disappointment as of late are the seasonal drink features and a lot of the cocktail prices. I had a black walnut Manhattan and while it was very good, it was not $12 good. Prices are never listed for the drinks and they should be.   To end on a positive, my service has always been great here. It can get quite busy and snotty at times from the customers who feel entitled to their neighborhood and the hosts/hostesses take the brunt of that. They are really accommodating and very diplomatic dealing with the shittiness of some of the customers. That cannot be easy! Bartenders and servers have always been on top of service even during the busiest of nights.

_pBpxmQ89M5G5Gew2tKdlQ.text: My favorite place for brunch or dinner, their menu and drink selection is awesome. The lobster mac and cheese is bomb, also who doesn't love Bacon Tuesday?

HHv04SNPiGJ5ubYSxzLZIw.text: During happy hour, get the frozen Cosmo with the added shot of Chambord.  They have pretty great happy hour specials.  I've been too many times to count for both food and drinks, and the service there is relliably great.  Paul G. is the best bartender!  Food-wise, you can't go wrong with the jamaican tacos, thanksgiving in Blawnox turkey burger, the Tots. The salads are all solid too.  In the summertime, the small back patio is the best seat in the house.    I agree with other reviewers that the mixed drinks are a little pricey and that the prices should be listed on the drink menu.   In all, this is my neighborhood spot and I plan to spend many, many more summer evenings here whiling away the hours with great friends.

VKxYB9HQP-2LXML5B3DUxw.text: Sunday night, one week after the Steelers were officially "out".  The restaurant was not crowded.  There were (2) 20-somethings and (2) 50-somethings which turned into (2) Burgers (1) Pulled Pork and (1) Angus Salad.    Everything was done perfectly.  Calamari was spicy, tender and fantastic.  Service was good and everyone was friendly.  Almost too dark to enjoy the meal, but ok.  We all agreed that we'd like to go back and try out a few other menu items.  Especially in the summer, to try out the patio!

wFvpbp4qUlh1Prk1w1gfIg.text: I normally love this place for happy hour but I had a terrible customer service experience when I stopped by yesterday. I came in during a time when the front patio was packed with people, but there was one open table. I walked in and asked the hostess (not sure her name but she had pink hair) if I could be seated out there. She said okay and that she would run out and clean it up for us. Immediately after, a lady started telling the same hostess that it was freezing upstairs and that she wanted to be moved outside. This lady said, "I know she just asked you for that table outside, but I would like it." She said that right in front of my face! I couldn't believe it. I don't know what made this snob think she was entitled to that table over me, but I was even more surprised when the hostess said okay, also right in front of my face. And then when the lady walked back upstairs, the hostess really just said "yeah I can't give you that table anymore" as if I hadn't witnessed her just pass it off to someone else. I was so stunned. I decided to forget about it though and sat down at the bar with my friend. A few minutes later, I went back over to the hostess and asked if she could at least seat us at the next open table. She looked really annoyed when I asked and informed me that in the 5 minutes it took for me to ask, a waitlist for tables outside had formed and I was #3 on the list. I was shocked that she wouldn't move us to the top considering she gave my table away right in front of my face. Well we were there for almost 2 hours and were never moved outside. Let me say that I completely understand that it was busy and I was okay with sitting inside, but I still cannot believe I was treated that way.  UPDATE: I still get upset about this all the time. It didn't help that the lady was a rich looking white woman while my friend and I are people of color. Even if the hostess wasn't thinking about color/class at all, you can all still imagine how the whole ordeal made us feel.

8E1iTdfM56oBk9jvYtVL5w.text: The frozen cosmos and mimosas are great, especially on special during happy hour. They also have a great list of beers and other cocktails.  The menu is a little creative but has mostly basic bar food. If salad is your thing you must get the one with beets and goat cheese.

2pafNqnWBwJD_mU4-jSmEQ.text: Harris Grill is by far my favorite restaurant in the city. The food is amazing! The prices on some things are a little hefty but you don't mind paying the money when the food is that good! I come here often and always recommend this restaurant to friends, family, and acquaintances. If you've never been, I highly recommend that you go!  Just be careful at the bar. The drinks are good but they can be very strong....the bartenders have a little bit of a heavy hand! I tend to order things that are bottled so as to avoid this. That being said, the strong drinks aren't bad enough to keep me away!

ptbmzy9InTqS8_6-TFYCaw.text: I have so many fond memories of coming here in the summertime with my sisters or friends to relax and unwind after a long day with a few frozen cosmos. For $3 at happy hour, you seriously cannot beat this price. They are incredibly strong, so I always say no to the extra shot of Cassis, but if you are feeling adventurous, it's only $1 more for the extra shot! Anytime friends come to visit from out of town, they ask if we can please go get some frozen cosmos. Apparently I talk about them a lot...  Frozen cosmos aside, the food is actually pretty good as well. I really enjoy the turkey burger filled with cranberry stuffing as well as the upstate chicken riggies. This is definitely Western PA chicken, piggie, wedding riggie gone very very right. I love the combination of vodka sauce with fresh bell peppers. And who doesn't like tots on the side? Brings me back to my childhood, stealing tots from friends at school whose parents let them buy their lunches.  This is the perfect place to go with friends. Go in the spring, summer, or fall when it's nice enough to sit outside on the patio, kick back with a few fro cos, and enjoy friends. You won't be disappointed.

RXxhJpIRnZn6GML838VSxw.text: I cannot complain about the Harris Grill.  I mean, who does not love Frozen Mimosas and Frozen Cosmos?  They also have  a pretty good brunch too.  Oh, and who can forget bacon night (although I wish the bar area was bigger as the seats get taken fast!).  This is exactly what I think about it's sister restaurant The Shiloh Grill in Mt. Washington as well.    They have an extensive drink menu and their menu has something for everyone in my opinion.  Some of it is done much better than others though.  The service here has been consistent for the most part so I cannot complain there.    I love the outdoor seating area when the weather is cooperating with us too.

Bv08ggj-6cblOFyB4qhGNw.text: Sunday not so much a Funday. Between the dim lighting + the overflowing toilet, it was difficult to shake the grime and distinct sense of dinginess. Thankfully their grub redeemed the experience though the draft list left some room for improvement. Next time? Patio only fo sho!

Gsrs1bknkk0Kd4vLkgWsaQ.text: Just wow! Plate of pierogie, two baskets of bacon, and two Iron City, and I'm down $17.50!! That is just a heck of a deal!! Ask for Brian, he's a terrific and attentive server!!  I'll be back next Tuesday, you can count on that!!

xKCVU1tViW5Cft7gTEN5Tw.text: This is a great place to go to during the summer time. I love sitting out on the patio. I got the chicken sandwich and my friend got the Pittsburgh salad. I would totally recommend getting any of the salads. The steak salad looked amazing (the people next to us got it) and the Pittsburgh salad tasted delicious. My sandwich was fine, but nothing to write home about. Overall, it was a good experience and will most likely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Henny Penny

8BsGTN1sTWGyz1qf3Xxisw.text: Harris Grill is a nice place on Ellsworth.  It has excellent seating options outside and I was surprised by how much room there was.  Our waitress was really friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.  I overheard some of the other waiters talking to their tables and everyone really seemed like they enjoyed working there.  There was a particular table I thought to be pretty troublesome but the waiter didn't bat an eye.  I would stop back in at Harris Grill.  I wasn't a super fan of the food, but I think that has more to do with my taste-buds than the quality of the food.  My boyfriend went crazy for the Mac & Cheese with beef.  I don't think the plate lasted longer than 5 minutes on the table.  We, however, long overstayed our welcome and we didn't get any nasty looks from either our waitress or any other waiters.  It's a nice place to grab a drink as well and it feels like a place you can go to catch up with some friends for a decent price.

o5dDsmwjcdKflGBRNlcnAg.text: Omg. The food incredible, great choices, relaxed atmosphere, bands on the 3rd floor( thu I think) owner amazing. Staff bent over backwards. Comfort food, great salmon. What a mix. My summer spot. Best Moscow mules!

qXFW0YfbHQ06LIxhzo_7WA.text: My partner and I went to the Shadyside Harris Grill location on Easter Sunday. We had two entrees; she had the Henny Penny and I had the Pittsburgh salad with their blue cheese dressing (WHICH IS THE BEST BLEU CHEESE IVE EVER HAD.) The server was friendly, the vibe was chill, and our food was fantastic. And somehow, our bill came to less than $30. Recommend highly!

-PxtaIqtIqg9no_ovmbeYg.text: We tried delivery - something different other than the usual pizza, Chinese or Thai food offerings around the area. The delmonico a go-go steak sandwich was pretty good! There was a little less meat, and a little too much bread, but overall, flavorful and well balanced with the different ingredients. I did a side of mac&cheese for a little uncharge. *Delicious! I would definitely recommend it. Next time, I am trying a mac&cheese with chicken or seafood. Something fun. The tater tot appetizer (with gravy and cheese curds) was a unique twist on regular tater tots. The gravy was yummy, and melted cheese is always a win! The tater tots were crispy. The spinach dip was not a win for me. My friend loved it; however, I had one pita bread chip with a scoop, and that was more than enough. It tasted way too much like spinach (and not in a good way).  My friend ordered the For carnitas, you can't beat us sandwich. He loved it. I had a bite, and must admit that the sandwich was tender and had some flavor. He ordered the chili as his side, and said that was some of the best vegetarian chili he's had before (he ate the whole thing in 6 bites).

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delmonico a go-go sandwich
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac &amp; cheese - YUM!
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tater tots, gravy, cheese curds

mVvEy1xy5q1d6pz6jHSCJg.text: I remember when the food at the Harris Grill was just meh and the interior hadn't been updated in God knows how long.  Suddenly, they have a bacon night, the interior is hipster chic and the food has been significantly upgraded.  I just recently went there again this past Saturday with my daughter Muff and my sister Luch and we had a pig-out moment. There is no good reason why three people should order entrees and several appetizers for lunch, but we did that.  My sister and I ordered the Salmon BLTs. (She tried to be healthy by ordering a side salad with her sandwich, but I went all the way in by ordering the fries to go with!)  Muff ordered the "I Can Has Bacon Cheezburger?" and tatter tots. (Muff could only finish half of burger since we got the appetizers too.) We also ordered the Hush Piggies, which are home-made tatter tots with bacon and cheddar cheese (What's wrong with that?) and Chimichurri Flurry wings.  (Those wings were delightful and delicious!  I usually ask that my wings be fried on the hard side, but they instinctively knew that's the best way to serve them.)    We also ordered the Cookies-N-Cream dessert which is a hot chocolate cookie served in a small cast iron pan with a scoop of French vanilla ice cream and hot fudge sauce.  I'm not really a dessert person, but I have to say that that warm chocolate chip cookie with the ice cream was tasty.  Go on Harris Grill, you have stepped up your game!   It's nice when an older restaurant in a quote, unquote "chic" neighborhood decides to do a remix of their space and menu.  That has been the death knell of many established restaurants. (I miss Eddie's Restaurant in the Hill District for a good old-fashioned soul food breakfast.  However, I don't think that they renovated the place since Van Gogh had both ears.)  Harris Grill did a nice update and should be rewarded by having more customers come through their doors.

Bt_ixgc3I60zzCw9IodfhA.text: Okay. I want to put more than three stars because I really do like this place. However, the food and the waitstaff are SUPER inconsistent. Sometimes, we will get someone really friendly and attentive but other times the server will appear annoyed. Food wise, everything tastes good...depending on who is working in the kitchen that day. Just as an example, the spinach dip (which I've gotten before and loved) was watery and salty this time and when we mentioned it to the waitress she said "oh, it's probably because of who is in the kitchen today..."   However, the cocktails are creative and tasty (albeit a tad expensive not during happy hour) and happy hour is fun - especially when you can sit out on the patio on a nice day. I'll definitely continue coming back but I'm wary about the inconsistency of the food.

QQa9eWtpch3z2XelrcOVQA.text: The hostess and waitresses were extremely nice and the food was very good. We went for the Sunday brunch buffet, which included an alcoholic or non-alcoholic drink and brunch options. It was not advertised online as a brunch buffet, but we were not disappointed for $14. I think they change the menu, but they offered eggs Benedict, bagel and lox, Mac & cheese, bacon, sausage, potatoes, fruit, and someone was making pancakes with 6 filling options (chocolate chips, bananas, strawberries, blueberries, cinnamon apples, and walnuts). We sat outside, which was nice on a beautiful day.

gSatWM3rrrXfxCLLcUCCjQ.text: If you like patio eating and drinking, go here in the warmer months! Their patio is fairly large and opens up to a fairly busy street, which is prime time location for people watching. I really enjoyed my fish taco meal! My friend ordered salad and said hers was "alright"...but when has anyone really been that satisfied with a salad? (half joking...)   If you like wine, go on Wednesdays! I am definitely a wine fan and have experienced their $6 Wine Wednesdays. And let me tell you, this $6 glass of wine is more like a $6 LARGE pour of wine that would probably be worthy of 2 glasses.   If you like bacon - go on Tuesdays! I am not a bacon fan, but I have heard that they serve free bacon on Tuesdays! I will definitely have to take my sister her on a Tuesday. It will for sure become her favorite restaurant in town!

nft1DUK3ofsNvmuCslt2sA.text: Fun patio & decent happy hour specials. Worth a visit to check out their funny menu and take in the ambience, although nothing I've eaten here has blown me away. Cool location being on Ellsworth and you can pop into a few other places too when you stop here. I have also visited their sister restaurant, Shiloh Grill in Mt Washington, and you can expect almost identical offerings and the same type of vibes inside & out.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lunch special Tuna salad sandwich and grilled veggies side
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon BLT (kind of dry) with a side of Mac n cheese

qjqPvQ3zesupgHyHSAgxjQ.text: I have a strange obsession with this restaurant. I don't know if it's the absurdly worded menu, Tuesday bacon night where the bacon is actually free and unlimited at the bar, or the fact that they'll put anything you want in your mac 'n cheese, but I am enamored with Harris Grill. The draft list doesn't hurt either and service has always been great.  If you're looking for a fun and hip-but-not-very-hipster new American joint, you've found the spot. And even if you weren't looking for one of those, seriously - the mac 'n cheese is amazing.

A47CXoTexA_l7E2ahzYVEQ.text: I dined here on a Saturday night with my boyfriend, and we had a really good experience! Our wait was about a half an hour so we sat at the bar until our table was ready.  The service at the bar was very speedy; we each had 2 drinks served to us and our tab closed out just in time for our table.  When we were seated, we immediately had waters brought to us and our appetizer order taken. We ordered the cheese curds and we loved them!! I was hesitant that they might be really heavily fried and make me feel kind of gross, but they were surprisingly light and the sauce that came with them was excellent (it reminded me of a tangy honey mustard almost).   For our entrees, I ordered the eggplant lasagna and my boyfriend ordered the Thanksgiving sandwich.  My lasagna was perfect! I was worried that it might be soggy, but it was very crispy! My boyfriend actually ended up with a turkey burger, and we aren't sure if it was maybe the way he ordered it that threw them off or if they just brought him the wrong meal. We did not bother even mentioning it though, and he still really enjoyed his burger.  I definitely give their menu credit for being so creative (both with dishes and names of the dishes). I have dined here twice before and also had very good experiences both times. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheese curds

UUBtjL5_fG4a0mUrGlrX7A.text: Came for an end of the season lunch with staff. The food was two fold good. I ordered the clam chowder they should have lead with that it isn't your typical chowder. I personally don't enjoy it but someone else at my table did. My wings however were absolutely delicious and I enjoyed the sauce. I overall like Harris Grill and will return again.

wNT5VL1LZHz6KIAy5dUN4Q.text: I was excited to finally get to try Harris Grill for brunch. My friend enjoys this place a lot, and the last time we tried to visit they only had a brunch buffet. I have a love/hate relationship with buffet, which is mostly hate, and generally would prefer to order a la carte.   We were in luck because brunch was a la carte style at the time of our visit.   So one cool feature of their brunch was that the brunch entrees came with a drink. According to the menu, it included a frozen mimosa or Bloody Mary.  Our waitress also informed us that we also had the option of a draft beer. My husband and I decided to split the 2014 Mad Elf and the Mongo Double IPA. She later informed us that the 12 oz drafts didn't count as a brunch drinks, however would still count it this time since it was her mistake.   Their brunch menu isn't listed online so I'm writing this off of memory. There was this pierogi lasagna dish that just stood out. Now that's my type of hybrid. It wasn't made with pierogi's, but consisted of pierogi ingredients combined with lasagna. Super tasty, but kind of small. It came with a house salad, although the salad wasn't listed on the menu, nor did the waitress ask for a dressing preference. We realized the dish was so small and had a salad to fill up the plate, because it was off the brunch menu. I mean $14 for a drink and entree, I guess you can't expect a huge portion. It's tasty but just not huge.  In addition to the pierogi lasagna, I split the breakfast mac and cheese with my friend. The portion was exceptional and I loved every last bite I got. In addition to their traditional mac and cheese, the breakfast mac and cheese also included bacon and sausage. For an extra $1, we got an extra fried egg. Our server forgot to write up the fried egg but was able to put in the order quickly after we received our food. The mac and cheese was super creamy and especially awesome with the breakfast meats.   I like that Harris Grill has humor. The menu is sarcastically funny. There's even a joke at the bottom of the receipt.   In honor of their 10th anniversary, they were giving away little cups of M&Ms.  They even had the M&Ms personalized for Harris Grill. Nice touch.   I'd go for a 3.5 star rating if possible. There were the few service issues noted above and I wasn't thrilled with the size of the brunch dish. Since our server made up for any mistakes and the price was right, I'm going to round up to a 4.   I would certainly go back to Harris Grill next time I'm back in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The receipt has humor on it. Check out the bottom &#34;ask about our extended warranty&#34;
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Short rib sandwich
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogi lasagna brunch dish

IlljQsSYombHjCMnvGKnTQ.text: lunch outside on a beautiful Thursday...peaceful. we enjoyed the strawberry/lavender mojitos...enjoyable...had 2 in the middle of the day. both had salads...chop chop...good. service was great!

RlEwqYIIJpAMXXvOW_X55A.text: Just as an update, we went back to Harris Grill (Shadyside) last night after about 6 months of totally taking it off of our rotation.  Honestly, we had three free food vouchers from the last horrible experience, so that's the only reason we decided to try again and see if they got the "kinks" worked out.  The answer is definitely not.  We thought it was actually worse.  The food itself was good.  Other than the fries being cold, which we just dealt with, everything was good.  I'm not sure if the server was just new, or completely in the wrong line of work, but we sat at 7:15, got greeted at 7:30, got our drinks at 7:45 (and they were just Diet Cokes), and our food a little after 8:30.  There were three of us.  We didn't end up leaving until around 9:15, and not by choice.  No one was apologetic (3 different people came to our table at some point), when he never gave us the condiments we asked for, we just ate our food and mentioned it to him when he finally came back, and his response was that at least we got our meals.  It's really hard in my book to justify complaining about free food, but all three of us unanimously agreed that we would have rather paid for food elsewhere than felt trapped in that place for the length of time we were.    On a side note, since the food itself was actually good, if you're like a lot of people and this is really where you and your friends are going to spend your entire evening and have some drinks and what not, you might not have any problem with this particular place.  We were just stopping in for dinner and then heading elsewhere, so two hours for a couple of chicken sandwiches was just not what we had anticipated for the night.

35fd5YLAzIcOZlKjqC8trg.text: We went to Harris Grill for Sunday brunch around 11:30 and called minutes before arrival and were seated as soon as we got there on the second floor. The stairs were narrow so people waited til it was clear instead of two way traffic. The buffet was in a little room on the first floor which also had a pancake station/bar which all were to die for. The buffet was so incredibly good.  Their eggs benny, macaroni & cheese, and the pancakes were my favorite. I cant wait to go back again

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Macaroni and Cheese, eggs benny, and a pancake including apple filling and bacon all from the buffet

EkFeS5Tf-a1Aj8tARSqA4w.text: I've been here numerous times with my friend since it's close to my apartment. It can get really crowded in the bar area they do have a really nice outside seating area. They have bacon night on Tuesdays which is pretty cool. The food here is ok in my opinion I think it's over priced for what you are getting since the food itself isn't that great it's just typical bar food. Other than that it's a cool place to go and have a few drinks.

V6X7gDlikD2zbWUyNaH8Ug.text: I'm a longtime fan of the Harris Grill so please note that my review is specific to brunch only.  My friends and I were lucky enough to get patio seating on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. That was the highlight of brunch- friends and the patio.   The only option for brunch is to get the buffet. They were packed and couldn't keep enough food out.  The Mac and Cheese, while cheesily delicious was cold. They kept running out of plates. They never had the salmon when I went up- yet I saw it on other patrons plates.  And, insult to injury, my Bloody Mary was watered down. My friend had a Bloody Mary and the olive in it tasted like chlorine.   I will give props to the guy making the omelets.  He had all the ingredients, was quick, and friendly.   Like I said, I'm a big Harris Grill fan and will be back again - just not for brunch.

KrEZWjiPgW5Roa7_blHeJg.text: Owner inappropriately place his hands on my girlfriend and blocked her party from leaving the restaurant after it was paid for.  He stated he wanted to resolve the issue of an uninformed mandatory gratuity charged.  However, not once made an attempt to rectify the situation.  Rather staff placed erroneous blame on the bank for the upcharge.  Lies, bullying, and charging extra fees without consumer card consent are just some of the reasons I implore people not to patronize this establishment.

iNdfxwhC8HQpc4ZhN8baTQ.text: Second time there for brunch. The first time I had menu items that was good, but the second time was the buffet. I have to say the brunch buffet was very underwhelming. I much rather had the menu items instead. Also interaction with the some of staff there very rude. One of them brought out a salad and I asked what kind of salad it was and he had the nerve to try to harass me because I asked.  The brunch buffet was not worth the $16

EMGYfc3b_MqLOYB5_ZEFbQ.text: Harris Grill and I spent an amazing Saturday morning together a few months ago when I was suffering from a near-death hangover. It brought me back to life with two stellar Bloody Marys (they were half-price!), a salad topped with locally made cheese curds (absolutely perfect, even for a shaky stomach) and hot, crispy wings (not half-price but so tasty I ordered seconds anyway).   The restaurant was slow so it was nice and quiet while my Advil settled in. The bartender was on the water refills like a hawk, but was chill enough to leave me and my dining companion in peace while we ate (it is impossible to overvalue an observant bartender).     The menu descriptions are on the rambling side but that's okay because they're pretty funny. And I wouldn't be a competent reviewer if I didn't mention that every Tuesday the bars are lined with baskets of free bacon. You read that right--bacon is their bar snack.  They have a huge outdoor seating area that I plan on taking advantage of late into Pittsburgh's warm summer nights--they're open until 2 a.m. every day except Sunday.

QrZy9lkQNlr_zn5G1DRBpQ.text: If it is Tuesday night and you are in Pittsburgh, be sure to make you way to Harris Grill for Bacon night! That's right, every Tuesday night bacon is served at the bar as soon as happy hour ends. The best part is that it's free! If you can, try to go a little before 6:30pm to enjoy the last of their happy hour specials right before they start serving bacon. They have a nice selection of beer along with an extensive seasonal cocktail list (definitely recommend trying the frozen cosmo!) and a wide variety of wines. I enjoy coming here when the weather is nice and sitting out on their front patio.  I have only been here for happy hour and bacon night and have had the Spinach dip and Buffalo chicken dip. Both are great to snack on while drinking with friends.  Fun place to get together with friends for drinks and a few laughs.

oG8b4GQipQiP2hOrB1A_CA.text: Good food great atmosphere nice dining room great outdoor seating cool bar friendly staff cold beer nice variety of mixed drinks specially drinks BOOM!!!

y4_mhRI6GIbJ_5HBIj2ZYQ.text: Mmm not too happy with my recent experience at Harris grill. I visit Ellsworth ave plenty and I have been to Harris grill on numerous occasions. After working all day, and driving 2 hours to get home I was a little grumpy and wanting a good drink.  My two friends and I decided on the sangria. I've had it on numerous occasions and it can really hit the spot. The waiter suggested the caraf but HB warned us saying that they stuff it full of ice. The waiter insured us we would get around a glass and a half. We bypassed HB and ordered the caraf. Upon arrival we knew it was no bueno! The caraf was heaping full of fruit on the top followed by way too much ice. Our serving glasses also were heaped with the stuff even though we had asked for lite ice. I asked the waiter to pour for us bc I knew sangria was going everywhere. We ended up with our glasses 3/4 full and a watered down juice cocktail. We all told the waiter that it was pretty awful but he did nothing to correct the insult. Never ever order the caraf!!  To eat I had the pulled pork sandwhich and a side of mac n cheese. The flavor of the pulled pork was good and the pasta was delish. I will say the pork had some fatty bites that I didn't care for. All in all when the start of  a dining experience starts the way ours did it can be salvaged with the right customer care. Ours wasn't plain and simple.

L78OxfQ_sMikVVSQ1XAPCg.text: Have been to the Harris Grill for drinks a few times, but only recently went for food. Decided to try out their Sunday brunch at loved it. $16 for buffet-style brunch, which includes your first drink. (I recommend the frozen mimosa!) The buffet had a solid variety of quality eats - chicken & waffles (together or separate), bagels & lox, made-to-order omelets, salad, fruit salad, potatoes, eggs, benedict, bacon, sausage...great food and great value. Will definitely be back.

6MMNzWwVVh-tiiKc7_rmug.text: I went here last night with my "man-friend" around 9:00ish to get some grub.  We were starving so we were a bit disappointed that it was a 30-45 minute wait but it was a friday night.  We perused the drink list (it is a bit confusing because it looks like a facebook page) but settled on a MOFOjito and a margarita.  The MOFOjito (mojito with pomegranate) and the marg were served in pint glasses which was a surprise but so was the $20 tab for both of them. My "man-friend" was appalled (he is normally an IC Light kinda guy).  After we waited by the very dimly lit bar for about 45 minutes the hostess sat us at a table in the downstairs portion of the restaurant (basically right next to where we were standing.)   I started off with the veggie chili which was hearty and filling. It was topped with sour cream and served with a pita chip...delish.  I also ordered a spinach salad which the server explained to me is now different from what's on the menu.  Something about no strawberries, crumbled blue cheese, spiced pecans... It was definitely a change for the WORSE. The salad came out looking rather lonely with sliced almonds, 4 orange slices and chunks of mozzarella cheese.  It was sooooo bland. The dressing was just straight up balsamic vinegar.  Not only was it bland but it was tiny (almost looked like a side salad for $9.50). My date got the 'Salad a la pittsburgh' he wasn't thrilled by it either. His was much bigger than my salad and came with chicken (i think it was $1.00 more).   We didn't get alcoholic drinks with dinner and our bill was $29.00 which isn't that much more than our bar tab for 2 drinks.   Pros: Lively, fireplace when you walk in the door, a bunch of vegetarian options, big drink list,   Cons: Pricey drinks, very dark inside, sub-par salads, "funny" menu ( you have to read the whole description to figure out each item, I understand how lazy that sounds but witty names are only good once in a while)  Overall: Might go go back and not get a salad.  The beer selection looked promising.

Ob6jXpoJll-smTE6S3mU3A.text: Harris Grill is excellent if the weather is nice and there's a table on the patio.  The atmosphere inside is super bro-y.  Bring a group if you're going inside.  Their food is decent for a bar--I wouldn't go there for dinner, but for a bite with drinks, it's more than fine.  The mac & cheese goes great with beer.  I have a love/hate relationship with their craft beer selection.  I love it because it's a nicely curated selection and there's always something I want to try.  I hate it because the beer I want is often kicked.  In fact, I once went to Harris only to find they had ZERO draft beers available that weekend night.  Zero.  The place was empty save about four regulars, so it would have been smart for them to offer an impromptu discount on something else--instead, the bartender was angry when we asked if they really were out of all drafts.  Boo that.

828IsZoeowhYWQC8ApcRKg.text: Great cocktails and atmosphere for a night with friends or hear downstairs for the bar atmosphere

9PW7noWs8h5tWJ0xIbgOBQ.text: I had a great time.  great food and cocktails.  exciting ambiance, not for a quiet night out.  but who wants that? :)

N49IbdOl6n81UY41eIcbXw.text: Disclaimer: This review is only for their Sunday brunch. Wasn't impressed by their Sunday brunch. Didn't like the presentation of the buffet. It was in a small area and felt kind of cramped. The salad was made with iceberg lettuce and didn't look appetizing. My friends ordered orange juice and each glass was filled to the brim with large pieces of ice, which means that they really just had maybe 1/2 a glass of orange juice. In all, it's really nothing special, just very basic. It was my first time eating at Harris Grill. What seems nice is the patio and if the weather had been nice, we would've sat outside and maybe I would've given it an extra star.

m_FfRTRZz8L8x-Xg914Xaw.text: I wish I could give this 4 stars as Harris Grill is one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh but the past two times I have been for brunch it has been less than par.  Many things went wrong during my most recent brunch experience which include them running out of plates for the buffet and not being able to replenish the food fast enough.  Once you waited for the food to be replenished (about 10-15 minutes) it was just average. The buffet had an omelet station, mac and cheese, waffles, potatoes, bacon, bagels, fruit and salad. I was disappointed that they did not have any pastry items.  I recommend going for happy hour as they have discounted draft beers and frozen cosmos-their specialty and they are delicious!  The food is normally excellent so I recommend trying this place for lunch or dinner.  If you want to try the brunch I suggest visiting during the winter when it is not a buffet and you can order off the menu. The frozen mimosas are so tasty!

Xv0kxLccoLLSqciNW7Di-A.text: Sitting outside eating the Mac Cheese + Chili + Pulled pork and drinking one of their many delish bourbon drinks I could not be any happier. good job Harris.

lVH9NJrBOvvoejxTJpCXpQ.text: I've visited Harris's Grill a few times over the past 3 - 4 years and every time I leave I ask myself "Why do people love this  place so much!?" The food is not incredible and the service is always mediocre at best. Minus the bacon gimmicks and pretentious Shadyside vibe... This place is an average bar/restaurant.

0-ji6V60bzNvS2nKHCSrig.text: I was in town for a job interview (in Moon Township) and decided to venture into the city the evening before.  Here's the run-down based on this one visit: Food:  I was half (or more) starved by the time I got there.  I ordered the veggie chili and it was quite tasty and the Philly Cheesesteak.  The cheesesteak was "hearty" and quite generous but given the size (and calories) I doubt I'd order it again.  I ended up taking it back to the hotel (for what I thought would have been a midnight snack but did not happen).  If I happened to be in the area and in the mood for a cheesesteak, I'd head back; otherwise I'd not bother.   Service:  It was "blah.".  I could tell my waitress had a rough day and it was a bit crowded that evening (a Monday night) but she just didn't seem all that friendly (perhaps at least she could have faked it I suppose).   Parking:  I live in the Los Angeles area where parking issues are a way of life but Shadyside parking is unbelievably complicated.  (or I just don't know the insider tricks just yet)  Unless I lived in the area or there was relatively easy public transport to this otherwise very charming neighborhood, I'd never recommend heading there for a simple meal.

5EiDrFqfEq8Mv8fIJXJP7g.text: I haven't been home to Pittsburgh for a while and I was really excited to get out and explore the food scene. Although Harris Grill wouldn't have been my first pick (I try to stay away from the preppy Shadyside scene), I was pleasantly surprised by  the atmosphere, food and service!  I really enjoyed indoor atmosphere that mixed trendy decor with dim, sexy lighting. Our server was excellent and kept the drinks coming and I was extremely impressed by their craft beer selection. And I would certainly come back to enjoy their expansive outdoor patio.  I got to sample a lot of different selections. We started with the Dippo de Queso con Carne, which was a spicy mix of chilies, cheese and chorizo. Served with pita bread, it was good but there are better things on the menu. And onto those, the Baby Burgers were delectable as were the 'Britney Spears' (I swear that's the real name). The Britney Spears were marinated and skewered chicken that was served with some zesty chipolte sauce and rich pesto.   After all of this I probably would have given 3 stars. HOWEVER, the Mac & Cheese was excellent and as a connoisseur of mac-n-cheese, I know my stuff.  What topped off this meal was the incredible Eggplant Lasagna (Lasagne Aubergine) that I shared with a friend. Now, I'm not one to ever order anything that doesn't have meat in it. But I would truly go back to Harris Grill JUST FOR THE EGGPLANT LASAGNA. The eggplant was breaded and fried and layered with pesto, marinara, and layers of delicious cheese. I would highly recommend this dish to anyone, whether you're a vegetarian or not.  And I will certainly be going back just to check out their bacon night.

xV03nFgdmq_a_12sZ1YLpg.text: So, I'm going to give this place 4 stars based on four key aspects of Harris Grill:  Star 1 - outdoor seating; the deck space is amazing, and although the wait for it can be long, it's nice to be able to enjoy fresh air.  Star 2 - the menu; not only does it provide entertainment value, but its eclectic choice of fare goes above typical bar food  Star 3 - happy hour specials; are amazing -- maybe I say this because I come from Boston where there are no happy hour drink specials  Star 4 - good mix of people here; from medical residents to hipsters, everyone frequents this place.  at least from what I've seen.    Downsides: waiting for outdoor seating; smokers outside

bNh3015nYmjJR2l3bY6p2g.text: The Harris Grill has remained one of my favorite places to eat in the Pittsburgh area for years. The food is amazing, and their customer service is seriously beyond compare. Definitely, definitely recommend stopping here if you're looking for a great place to eat near Shadyside.

kXE2L3jlHsgLaltI7D-LJA.text: Harris Grill is, by far, one of the best places to eat! It is such a fun, hipster place! The paintings on the walls have nuns and monks drinking and have a very artistic and fun vibe amongst the random gargoyle statues beside them! The menu is fun and is presented in a very comedic tone. They have an appetizer called "Britney Spears", so right there I'm a fan of the restaurant! The food is so fun and yummy! I always get the "Thanksgiving in Blawnox" burger, which includes turkey, cranberries, sage stuffing, and a wonderful rosemary aioli! Yum! Just thinking about me has me ready to go tomorrow! I also ordered the Henny Penny chicken sandwich, which was a little too "black" (burnt) for me. The service has always been good and the ambiance is always pretty much there! Sometimes, on a busy night, you feel like you're on top of the table beside you, but with food like Harris', it doesn't even matter!

qnvNJ3cw9FyrAvbuDFliCw.text: This is one of the sadder bars in Pittsburgh. It's mostly populated by people who work at other bars in the area, and there's a rather desperate cliquishness to it. Some of the wait staff are super friendly, but the main barman is roided up, snappish, and generally deeply unpleasant to interact with. You'll get the real measure of this place by reading the pathetically sexist, misogynist menu - this is the kind of bar that thinks that 1950s-era sexist jokes make the menu sound edgy and modern. Utterly and irredeemably classless, the kind of place that wouldn't survive a month anywhere in the northeast other than Pittsburgh.

zQrPfo12tN6OM4s-YgitBg.text: Appearance is best The drinks and food don't live up To expectations.

Xy2U0mSQRyFh7tof960A0g.text: Went for the first time today. Kitchen was just wrapping up a re-model, but they extended happy hour to accommodate and the food was pretty darn good.  The happy hour specials were a great deal and the staff was really nice. Also love that the patio is in the shade all afternoon/evening. Great summer spot.

MSwUbff_giIDTMeZtChpNQ.text: Terrible terrible service. Our server talked way too fast, was impatient while we were ordering and got upset with me when I didn't understand something he had said. Seemed cranky and overworked and ruined the experience completely. I was with good friends that I hadn't seen in awhile otherwise, I would have just left after his opening line of telling us everything that wasn't available that night on menu (99% of the menu) in lightning speed. Totally stressful. UGH. Horrible experience. Salmon salad was not good at all. Will not be going back ever.

U6WFsOIYzOOytEA5cLcYVg.text: Some of the best mac n cheese iv had. So creamy with a slight crispyness. However, no way in hell was it worth $12. They could have more beers on draft, but what they do have is always solid. Also, drafts are half off from 4:30-6:30 every week day. I could see myself rotating between here and Mad Med for happy hour.

ABXAz0uahwk5R-IIVkHMvg.text: Ask for Justin on the back porch. He's amazing. He knows his beer and has a really dry sense of humour, which I like.

hKvX0b8Oaelslg89cy718Q.text: I don't really have a good review for this place. It's not that the place isn't good it's just that I don't have an accurate experience to recount.  I went for bacon night. This is on Tuesdays.  I saw an outside patio on my way in. On a nice day, that area seems...nice.  But the happy hour was good. And once the bacon started it kept flowing. So by far this was the best part.   Oh, so while I would have usually given this place 3 stars for simply existing and providing me free bacon, I knocked it down due to the really inept barstaff. I spent way too long at the bar before being acknowledged to order a drink.  Yeesh. Too bad I wasn't as cute as one of those girls at the end of the bar.

sOoZ4-hy5HWex8I4ytvq1Q.text: My boyfriend and I are new to the area and Harris Grill was the first restaurant we chose to eat at in our neighborhood since it was in a convenient location and every time we passed it it seemed to have a lot of ppl eating there. He ordered the steak mac and cheese and I ordered the lobster mac and cheese. We also ordered one of their speciality cocktails, can't remember the name but it was one made for the summer season and for dessert we got the cookies-n-cream, which is a cookie baked and served on a cast iron skillet with vanilla ice-cream on top. We enjoyed our meals. They give a good portion of Mac and cheese. I was happy to see that they weren't stingy on the lobster like how a lot of places are when they offer lobster mixed with something. The cocktails were also good; light and refreshing. The cookie was warm, gooey, and delicious. We were seated outside. The seating was crowded for my taste, but it was a busy summer day so I get it. Our waiter, Rambo (that's really what his name tag read) was nice and actually took the time to converse with my boyfriend about our recent move to Shadyside. In all honesty, I'm not sure I'd order the lobster mac and cheese again given the price. It was really good, but I'm a tough critic when it comes to lobster mac and cheese (i've had lobster mac and cheese that transcends you into the heavens with every bite you take and at a cheaper price). Once I become better acquainted with the other items on the menu and with dinning in the area I may consider updating my review.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cookies-N-Cream
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster and steak mac and cheese
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cocktail

uUGRiWz35lW8PGeECzirxw.text: i really really like this place, but don't go so often because it's kind of on the pricey side and worth it for a special night every once in a while, but not an every night kind of place. i have to say, the first time i went i had the mac and cheese and have raved about it since. the second time i had some sort of chicken casserole dish and loved it too. they have a reasonable amount of choices on their menu with clever descriptions but the portions aren't really large enough to make up for the price. they also have some pretty good cocktails and a lot of choices in the alcohol department. again, they're a little pricey, but worth it. the crowd is pretty cool too. overall, the only real reason i didn't give it 5 stars is the price to portion ratio.

VE-tBL6ehOGhDzVs1RqSAg.text: As a frequent flyer to Harris, I have nothing but great things to say. The menu is hilariously superb and the bar items are excellent. I get the Ceaser salad frequently and also the macaroni and cheese and it is always top of the line. The "f-bomb" martini will satisfy any taste buds as it is always done right. The arugula steak salad is always a great choice and I could go on! Also be sure to visit its sister restaurant Shiloh on Mount Washington!

eMdE8G_jJMCw7fFT5063QQ.text: It was a lazy Monday afternoon, so I decided to head over to Harris Grill for a bite to eat on their deck. I ordered a glass of Merlot ($6) and their new roasted vegetable salad served with a side of fig dressing. For some reason or another, my glass of wine took 10 minutes to arrive. No apology from the server, but whatever she appeared to be the only person working outside. My salad was very yummy. Too bad the portion wasn't a tad bigger. I could have eaten the roasted veggies, especially the broccoli all afternoon.

unytcgKv2mgilGN7UIVKVw.text: Excellent bar service and a few great dishes make this place one of my local favs!  Jerk Mac and cheese knows few rivals

DrckXags0UD9fpyczrIQvQ.text: We went to Harris Grill for lunch while a friend was visiting from out of town-and it was fun! The menu and atmosphere is pretty entertaining. The food and drinks are moderately priced, and there is a nice selection of brews.  What we had:  Turkey Burger-fabulous-we agreed this was the best thing we had ( I added mozzarella cheese and it was soooo good)  Flat Iron Pork-I guess our friend thought he was ordering flat iron steak-this was ok but I wouldn't get it again.  Some Spicy Chicken sandwich-Pretty good-paled in comparison to the turkey burger  Tots-Delicious  Beer-good! (duh)  Other: Service-Fab!  2 Patios-front and back

ws2U-lSAWaZET3Ja8RiipA.text: Harris Grill is, hands down, one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh.  Yes, it's in Shadyside, which I usually avoid at all costs, but I never have a problem making an exception for this spot.  I don't think I've ever had something on the menu that I didn't fall in love with.  My husband and I are huge fans of the 'goat in a boat' (cheese and pepper dip served with yummy hot pita triangles), but there's nothing more satisfying after a few rounds of drinks than their baby burghers and horseradish mashed potatoes.  Speaking of drinks, they have one of the most extensive mixed drink lists in the city.  If you find conversation with your dinner mates a bit dull, you can just page through the 'Grill Swill' menu for a few good laughs, and even some conversation starters.  I love the 'Surly Temple,' and my husband prides himself on sampling each and every type of Manhattan they offer.  Harris Grill is home to some of the best bartenders in the city (and also one of the hottest ;).  Tuesday night at the Grill is Bacon Night, which means you can get unlimited (until they run out) bacon.  It's free in a basket at the bar, or $1 per basket at your table.  And if that's not enough bacon for you, they've even got bacon-tinis.  Yep, bacon, in booze form.  It's every Yinzer's dream.  Their other booze specialty is the frozen cosmo, which is like a Slushee version of the original.  It's good, but as a girl who can't even do frozen margaritas, I seem to get a brain freeze every time I try one, and usually wind up sticking to the classic version, which is always perfectly mixed.  Lately, I've been getting their chicken salads there, Pittsburgh style, with crispy fries on top.  There is something about their ranch dressing there that is just amazing.  See previous comment, re: everything here tastes like heaven.  In nice weather, you can sit on their patio and put in some serious people-watching.  It gets crowded on the weekends, but all the more opportunity!  There are a lot of stairs at this place, and let me just say: drunk people trying not to fall down stairs... well, they're funny.  :)   And the best part about Harris Grill?  You can hang out there without any of the Shadyside rubbing off on you.  So go forth, and bacon away :)

lT954a-L7uSRK8hXXIZ60w.text: I came here with a few friends today for a late lunch after a race. The service was quick and very friendly.  We ordered Totchos (tater tot nachos) to start and they were delicious! The buffalo chicken dip disappeared within minutes as it was better than any buffallo chicken dip any of us have had at a restaurant.  The seasonal cocktail menu was also great- I had the rum spiced cider and a pumpkin pie cocktail.  To top it off, one of the people in our group has a severe nut/bean allergy, and the entire staff was very accommodating in making sure no nuts or beans touched our food. Will come back again for sure.

5WzSSeH1UwZoWUIqnydNLw.text: We came here for the all you can eat Sunday brunch. Food was not great...but for the $15 brunch it came with a hot and cold drink. And you can pick an alcoholic drink.  I didn't think the brunch selection was that great. The area where the buffet was located ended up being really cramped with everyone standing in line for their food.

d4tP_UPxQVgmrX8rsxzDeA.text: I had the tomato soup (around $3.50) and a side order of macaroni and cheese (around $4.50). The tomato soup is very peppery, so if you don't like things spicy at all, don't order it. The macaroni was quite good. I also tried the potato and cheese pierogies (around $7.50), which I liked, but it was my first time trying pierogies, so I can't compare them to anything.  The waitstaff was quite pleasant.  The restaurant was noisy, so possibly not the best place for people who are hard of hearing.

sZXOTJL9xHPG0a8oxgXEbg.text: Ordered food through GrubHub on a particularly-cold day and it arrived hot delicious! Ordered a bowl--pierogies are out-of-this-world and the tofu had a bit of a spice to it. Grilled veggies were nice. Never been to Harris Grill even though I'm in their 'hood but will def frequent it from now on!

RpV83JWsj93kBv5GHWONcg.text: Best vegetarian chili on the planet!   I love their pierogies.  The menu is unique and diverse.  Alcohol selection is great too!

PUtnsKZfaMBZE1QfRb1tDg.text: Two words: Bacon. Night.   Yes! Do not adjust your screen, you read right. They have a bacon night here.  Contain yourself! It happens on Tuesdays!  I started coming here when I lived in the area a few years back, and it still has it's charm. I try to make it out for Bacon Night whenever I am in town. The other food is good too, so don't overlook it.   As for drinks, well, I became knowns as a mojito abuser overnight because of this place, and I don't care who knows it.

HmWe2BuIllx-ozi_MU7N4w.text: This place seriously hit the spot tonight.  I have had a variety of things, and, prior to tonight, would have given this a 3 out of 5 stars.  The only things I've had that I've not liked were the frozen cosmo and the turkey burger.  Everything else I've had - burgers, sliders, french toast brunch plate, both buffalo and spinach dips, eggplant lasagna, hummus...I'd recommend it all.    Tonight I got the white chicken chili ((cuz I was feeling a bit chilly myself)) and the calamari appetizer to share with NOBODY!    Ok, my husband had a few bites, but after I tasted the first piece, I moved it back over to my side of the table.  I realize that they probably just drizzled it with sweet and sour sauce but it was fried to perfection then sweet and sour and just ohsogood.  Simple, but perfect.   The chili was very good as well.  My husband had the Delmonico sandwich and mac n' cheese side which he was quite pleased with as well.  I had a bite of the mac n' cheese.  Very tasty!  And Tuesday is bacon night!  What more could you want in a bar?

w9zbPufCZKpGgj0ym2m3Ig.text: Best gem in Shadyside. The drinks! The food! All consistently great. Servers are friendly and very funny. Always leave with a smile on my face, full belly, and often a bit buzzed and anticipating spending the remainder of my day vegging on the couch napping and half watching food network.

8pGSWZEYSyAP95IbyCC9Og.text: I love the outdoor patio area during warm weather at Harris Grill. The drink list is fun and a little more expansive than others in the area. Unfortunately, I just cannot get on board with the food here. I've tried a couple different items and find the best thing has been the side of French fries. Tuesday is bacon night where you can get a basket of bacon appetizer for cheap and it's okay.  Overall would recommend for a place to get a drink or somewhere to sit outside but not as somewhere to get dinner.

QQ0n_uNu_oeM4lw1xqPE8Q.text: After waiting for over an hour for our food, in mere freezing temperatures (it felt like the north pole), we received appetizers served on paper plate and had to beg for plastic silverware. If that wasn't enough, back to he cold, the whole on the ceiling was leaking cold air.  For the service, our waiter, who was obviously stoned, rarely returned and never asked for a drink order. Do not come here. The food was below mediocre and cold and was some of the grossest atmospheres I have ever been in. Go to Elbow Room across the street you won't feel violated when you leave.

rxoMzagCry68rgKzr9hk9Q.text: Great night out and our waitress Christina (Kristina?) was amazing!!! She got all our orders right and we were a large group! Food was delicious (as usual) and we love the options here!  All of the dip appetizers are delicious and the Henny Penny is my favorite!   Lastly frozen cosmos forever :)

3WAkiJQ_tO205bpT1ReqYQ.text: OMG the HG mac & cheese... If heaven exists it's in that dish! Great salads and so much more to choose from. Menu offers so many fun choices. Nice place for Sunday brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TGiyvDt2_bFmotBnngnRig.text: Located in Shadyside. The food is fantastic, We had an appetizer if Hammara and for lunch we shared pierogi, short rib quesadilla, Mac and cheese and roasted vegetables. It was very fresh and delicious. The restaurant is in a big old house. It's pretty cool inside. There is also outdoor seating. Dress in layers, it's very cold inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

JD55L9-s9tpfOUv_V_WHEg.text: I love Mac and cheese.  After seeing the pictures of a variety of mac and cheese options, I knew I needed to test out Harris Grill.  I came in with two friends a few days ago.  My friend and I split the "I Can Has Bacon Cheezeburger" and an order of Mac and Cheese.  The total for this was about $12.50 with tax each. The burger was good but not special.  There was more bacon on the burger than most places, but it was not the star of the meal.  The mac and cheese, however, was fantastic.  The portion was quite large, and our awesome waiter brought us some Sriracha, which was a great addition!  There was lots of rich cheese sauce, which was extra yummy on our french fries.  This is one of the top mac and cheeses I have had in Pittsburgh.  The place is a bit dark, and even on a Wednesday night, most people were already toasted at 6 PM.  The witty menu is fun to read while waiting for food as well.  Parking can be challenging on Ellsworth so be prepared to walk a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half of a Mac and Cheese and half of the &#34;I can has cheeseburger.&#34;

dCHa9xSY5QrU7AAZUKri_A.text: Pleasantly surprised service and well crafted comfort foods I chose to be outside comfortable

fhGRDKQG855LiD4MqMEctQ.text: Harris Grille is a great spot on Ellsworth Avenue. Upon entering the building you're greeted by a charming fireplace, which is much appreciated at this time of year in Pittsburgh. If the fireplace doesn't warm you up try a cocktail or two. There's a great list of wines, beers, cocktails, and signature specials.   Recently, a small group of friends and I experienced their Sunday brunch for the first time. We definitely intend to go back! The brunch menu itself is fun to read, so give yourself time to read it in its entirety. Its clever and quirky descriptions of menu items makes picking just one thing to eat that much more difficult. We solved that issue by each ordering a different menu item, and then sharing. Remember, sharing is caring when dining out. How else do you expect to sample a wide variety of foods in just one sitting?   The portions were generous, to say the least. The brunch included a Mimosa, Bloody Mary, or a fresh squeezed orange juice; coffee or tea, a fruit cup, and one brunch entree. Needless to say we had a to-go box or two by the end of the meal.
