Did you know Harris Grille is on NoWait? Grab a spot in line before leaving your house from your phone.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UTXHUBA8OyvXNoFp3MqDow.text: Although there are truly a lot of interesting, cool , chic new bars and lounges springing up all over the Burgh...(check out my top 11 list later this month) it feels like the established places with tons of character are slowly but surely fading away.  Change is inevitable and usually trends good.  Harris's is one of those places.  Great food (hummus is top notch), awesome beer (Sierra Nevada Celebration ale on tap for example) and lots of charm.  Service is always of high quality and friendly.    Bonus promo tip ---Tuesday is bacon day, get free BACON all night long along with some drink specials I believe!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SjYT7YsShqmcBciijDXYhA.text: We have eaten at the Harris Grill in Shadyside numerous time and have never had a bad breakfast.   Always hot, super fast, clean and staff is great   Portions are great as well.  Love Sunday breakfast here.   Keep up the great work

95xeQfIyYmyltI9h0o20Pw.text: Pricier than expected but portion is huge. Love the tater tots nachos. Also got spinach dip, fried pirogies , and a number of sandwiches. It's not a place to get healthy.  Service was very friendly. Menu was hilarious. A nostalgic place.

BNBlRTTl7fNyaYObKcX1rA.text: Staff was super courteous about this however Harris grill really started out our day pretty awful. We couldn't eat outside because we had our dog and they have an elevated patio. It's a city rule but maybe they should put it on their website or something so I don't waste my time driving there! Super upset!   We also went another time excited about their bacon and apparently they don't serve it all of the time. Plus, the food was less than average. I don't get it and I'm definitely not recommending this place to anyone

78bs4HQcncfRzBJ4XkmXmA.text: Updating my review because I recently came to Harris grill for brunch, for the first time! It was amazing!  It was a gorgeous spring morning and I wanted to get out of my house and go somewhere awesome for brunch, with a patio. I tossed around a bunch of places and my boyfriend and I agreed on Harris. I checked in on the "no wait" app when leaving my house (a 40 minute wait was estimated), drove the 20 minute drive to Harris and was seated right away! We sat on the patio, of course, which was such gorgeous.   The brunch at Harris is a buffet- which I had no idea about until arriving. It was only $15 and included your choice of juice, a frozen mimosa or a bloody mary. I went with the frozen mimosa (duh)! It was delicious and had a nice kick of alcohol to it, which I loved ;)! The buffet was pretty impressive! Eggs benedict, chicken tenders and waffles, omelets made to order, bacon, sausage, bagels with all of the fixings, fresh fruit, potatoes and sauteed onions with peppers and macaroni and cheese. The mac and cheese was a little dry, but everything else was AWESOME. I loved the chicken and waffles and went back up for seconds after. The sausage was also very good. My boyfriend and I were also in love with the potatoes.   For $15 a person, we were stuffed and very satisfied. I didn't think I could love Harris Grill more than I already did, but coming to brunch proved me wrong!

K6nIrQJAMYWVxUmQSTJ0_A.text: I appreciated finding this late night restaurant. Great patio for outside dining. Friendly staff. My friends and I shared three entrees -- short rib quesadilla, mac and cheese, and crab cakes. All were fantastic. Hard to choose a favorite. Would go back when I'm in town again.

1A8E_CXcwqEabVYYtj0GVQ.text: Adequate, but nothing special. Tried their blue cheese burger. It was good, but nothing to compete with burgers from other joints around town. The outdoor seating is nice, but the indoor ambience is dull and dated. They also need to clean the place more often.

ayp1PZ2QVM91GjhHeY73pg.text: For delivery/takeout only - This is literally the smallest thing of soup I've ever seen for $4. I measured it out of curiosity and it was 4.5 ounces. I've eaten inside the restaurant before and these servings (Salmon Cobb salad) are not full size but they are full price. The fries were soggy and cold - but that happens with delivery. I wouldn't care too much but they have a $2.99 delivery fee, on top of tip as well as charging full entree price.   I wouldn't order delivery with them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Take out soup - coming in at 4.5 ounces.

DgADl0l_aPePLv4_WlixDQ.text: Fun little spot with a great patio and awesome classic rock playing. We ordered the muhammara and it was amazing, served with warm pita chips and the spin spin sugar salad and roasted veggie salad. My only thing was that I was looking for more of a lighter salad with the vegetable salad but it's actually a big size and could be more for a filling meal. Served over greens it had Brussels sprouts, carrots, potatoes, broccoli, onions, peppers, and a fig vinaigrette. Overall very good and the service was perfect too!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spin spin sugar salad with chicken!
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted Veggie Salad with steak!
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GvYBdCwAg7evJBf5EyzNjg.text: My friend and I went to brunch here a few weeks a go on a Sunday. It wasn't outstanding or great--the buffet food was just lukewarm, and the frozen mimosas were just okay. The omelet that came with the brunch deal though was fantastic! Service was just okay, but the biggest highlight for me was the awesome front patio--it made for ideal friend hang-time.

8RPED3Xz1BQeYmDmzpdgtg.text: Called to pay a friend's tab and was told that wasn't possible. Totally understood as I understand how business works being a business owner myself. My friends (of the tab I was covering) were told I cursed the manager which I'd never do.

GEcN3JEDADgr9j_LZ0Hs6w.text: Bobby and I stopped here for dinner on Saturday to celebrate his birthday as well as the anniversary of him dealing with me for 3 years (ha-ha)  For drinks, Bobby ordered a long island (you probably could've guessed that though) & I ordered a glass of sangria (The original. They also had pumpkin sangria). He didn't enjoy his drink too much and i offered for him to try mine because it was delish! Wow, they make an amazing sangria! Bobby also enjoyed it, so we ordered a carafe of this delicious-ness.  For dinner, Bobby ordered the Thanksgiving burger. It's a turkey burger with cranberry stuffing inside. It sounded really tasty! I almost thought about ordering it before he brought it up. He originally ordered the November throwback of a pork shank, however, someone from the kitchen came upstairs to inform us that it was defrosting since they didn't think another person would order it. It would've been an extra 15-20 minutes which is why he decided on the turkey burger. For his side, he ordered the Mac & Cheese.  For my dinner, I ordered the ever so popular Henny Penny and a side of "smashed" potatoes. The server informed me that the chicken sandwich was a little spicy. I honestly thought i could handle it, and for the most part i did.. but i honestly couldn't finish the last half. It was just so spicy even water wasn't helping. Bobby ended up finishing my other half of sandwich and he gave me his mac&cheese. PS- the mac&cheese is delicious and sooooooo creamy!   For dessert, we ordered "The wrongest dessert ever" (Please see picture to see why it was given this name.) The dessert was on their November throwback menu and consisted of a fried twinkie, two scoops of vanilla ice cream with a raspberry sauce (maybe chocolate sauce as well).. complete with whip cream. I loved it and i don't even care if you judge me for the calorie intake that i took in at this restaurant. I have full intentions on heading back before November is over to enjoy that dessert again!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sangria!
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;the wrongest dessert&#34; fried twinkie, 2 scoops of ice cream w/ raspberry &amp; chocolate sauce &amp; whip cream (Nov. Throwback special)

9Epv6msCv-3qZAW9e67ytg.text: 4 stars because their bar food/appetizers are delicious! Especially their wings and pierogies.  Their mixed drinks though are sub par. Even their famous frozen cocktail is not as good as I thought they'd be. Stick with appetizers and beer!

y-p4xGYVReCz4Ryq7tgdSg.text: I can't properly review the food or beverage selections since I never actually got seated.  I came as part of a large group, who specifically chose Harris Grill because it could handle a crowd.  When we arrived, the lounge area--clearly designed to seat 15-20 people--was occupied by precisely two individuals.  That's right, two people leisurely sipping drinks.  The host informed us when we entered that they would be leaving soon.  Half an hour later, they had ordered another drink and seemed to be making small talk with the host: clearly a friend of theirs.  This begs the question: why on earth would a host seat two people in their party section?  I came up with two possible answers.  1. The restaurant hates money 2. They hired the worst host in Pittsburgh  I'll be returning to Harris Grill sometime this month to try their food, all of which looked and smelled amazing as it whisked past me on plates destined for tables.  In response to the comment below, I wrote this review to call attention to a business practice which seems mutually detrimental to both the restaurant and the customer.  I don't hold grudges and I'm willing to treat the experience as a one-off.

gUPC5nnebJyf4fJyrjdx7g.text: Wow, what a nice little spot on Ellsworth in Shadyside. I drove down Ellsworth with the intent of stopping at one of the establishments in the cluster of restaurants/bars around Harris Grill. And the thing that caught my eye about Harris was the romantic patio set up they have which is unbelievablely awesome.  The whole entire patio area they have outside is definitely one of the best in the city. I sat down with my date on the patio, which is perfectly lit up for a night spent eating outside, ordered some whiskey drink, while she ordered a glass of wine and we ordered the goat cheese appetizer. Harris has a healthy selection of cocktails, beer, and wine, just like Shiloh does, which is perfectly alright by me.   The Goat cheese appetizer is served cold with warm pieces of pita. The actual cheese was very rich and was good to pick at, I don't see how only two people could finish it, we couldn't. It's just very filling.  For my entree I went with the Jamaican chicken tacos, and they were absolutely perfect. The spicy chicken was cooled off nicely by a cold cilantro sauce that was drizzled over each taco. Mois Bien.   The only reason I'm not giving Harris 5 stars is because all of our food was brought out at the same time!!   GODDDD!!! Come on server!   That's why there are appetizers, entrees, and desserts.  You wouldn't bring someone's dessert out with their meal, so why bring out their appetizer with their entree, especially on a date!!!

uHGhA5IOVT74bvhfp2oJUA.text: Definitely my favorite place in Pittsburgh. Frozen Cosmo is amazing, so are the pierogis are awesome. Bring back the CHEESE BALLS!!!   Love the outdoor patio and the happy hour rocks!

K11dEzH4aXtnkR20DoxrIw.text: This place is going downhill fast. I went for the infamous bacon night this past Tuesday and wow - it sucked. First off, our waitress just wasn't good. She forgot to put our order for a basket of bacon in and we had to ask for it thirty five mins later. Bacon doesn't take that long to cook. Then, we had to ask for ranch with our wings - which we'd already requested, but she'd brought us bleu cheese instead. Oh, AND they were out of bacon wings! On bacon night! WTF.   Anyways, we also had to request sour cream for the pierogies, which is normally brought out with them, plates (b/c we were sharing several appetizers), and ketchup. Why ketchup? Let me tell you. We'd ordered the sliders as well, and it was the saddest display of baby burgers I've ever seen.   They were brought out on one of the same small plates that we had for sharing our apps - like the size of a saucer that you'd put a tea cup on. And there were only TWO of them. Two! For six bucks I'll go get six non-mini burgers at freaking mcdonalds. And to top it off, they were dry as the sahara and served with NOTHING.   I got the sliders at Harris about six months ago and there were four sliders to an order, and they were served on a fanciful, long plate with a selection of condiments - you know, ketchup, tomato, onion, mustard, etc. Normal things that people put on burgers every day. So, that was really disappointing. But it wasn't over.  The bacon "baskets" arrived. The simple fact that they serve it in a basket seems to imply that there will be a pretty decent amount of bacon in there, right? Nope. There were literally exactly four sad little pieces. The big basket only made 'em look all the sadder. And they'd somehow managed to burn half of each slice black, while the other half was rubbery and undercooked. Yuck.   Overall, I would never go back again if it wasn't for the fact that I have a gift certificate. The only things Harris has going for it right now are its patios, cleverly written menu, and nice location on Ellsworth ave. Oh, and a lot of condescending d-bags, if you're into that kinda thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. What is this?! A bacon basket for ants?!

cr7d2u_JfkLxMEkerG4A7Q.text: The food here is good. Nothing too interesting on the menu though. Reasonably priced, too.  My favorite thing about this place, and what keeps me coming back, is their frozen cosmos. Soooo satisfying on a hot day. Beware - too many can ruin your night. These babies are super strong. Their beer list is great and their other mixed drinks are really interesting combinations.

-bWlDouFZDVAORlYyZgP7Q.text: Fantastically Happy place to eat!  The building looks like the remains of an old house.  The walk to the hostess is a bit awkward as you're walking through the front patio full of guests already enjoying their meal.  That not really being an issue, you'll step into the 'foyer' where you're greeted and offered various seating options.  We were escorted upstairs to a cute dining area with large windows and a very charming ambiance.  We were seated and not shortly after were greeted by our server... 'Shipwreck'.  Yeah, I'm not kidding... He said his name was "Shipwreck", even after questioning him... this set the tone for the night.  He was very knowledgeable of both the liquor and food menus and was jolly, and appeared to really love his job; Attentive and courteous as well as entertaining.  The food was amazing!  When you go, if you're like me, you'll be snapping photos of the names they have come up with for the array of 'American Cuisine'.  Things like the "spin spin sugar' Salad, or the "Aw, you're pullin' my pork" pork sandwich.  Everything was geared toward putting a smile on my face; and I thoroughly enjoyed myself.  Next time I visit Pittsburgh; I'm definitely stopping in again.  Probably one of the most memorable dinners out in a while!  Thank you.

NyZO2QASCSn242616Qt4Eg.text: Deck seating during Happy Hour gets a big thumbs up from me.  I personally prefer the frozen cosmo without chambord--it's sweet enough.  At three bucks during Happy Hour, I don't care that the frozen cosmo looks ultra girly pink.  I also had an East End smoked beer, that was completely vegetarian, even though it might not have tasted that way.  The food's decent here.  The pasta in the macaroni and cheese was cooked perfectly--not too mushy.  The sauce was rich, though I might have liked some toasted breadcrumbs for a crunchy contrast.  The bread that came with the spinach dip, though, was too hard.  The food is more three-star worthy, but the deck and Happy Hour drink specials bump the overall rating to four.  I can't complain about the service here.  They treated us fine even though we were a large group, and you know how large groups can be kind of pesky because we're not terribly coordinated when it comes to ordering and all that.  They even gave us separate checks without complaint.  The gratuity was already included, which was okay by me--it's just a lot more convenient having my own bill instead of trying to figure out my share from one communal bill.  Gentlemen, I'm told the urinals in the men's room are "interesting."

G6KQ0cfxvk9Ezcm_Z26V8Q.text: Came here with a friend the other night for food and drinks. Had the pork sandwich and it was so-so. My friend had the jerk chicken mac and cheese and it was amazing. If I ever come back that's definitely what I'll get. Our server was a little wishy-washy and seemed like he was having a bad night. Overall, not bad but nothing special.

5RXCZ5VW29GRgWdVMPWGQQ.text: Meh.  The Harris Grill is one more American business in a long line to have great ideas ruined by terrible execution.  An entire page of delicious looking burgers?  Bland and overcooked.  Cool looking spaces?  Can get cramped and awkward with groups, and sometimes it's hard to get a server or bartender to notice you (I've never once thought a group outing here was anywhere approaching "comfortable").  And what about the famed BACON NIGHT?  It's not even good bacon!  They'll have to knock their game up several notches to achieve the potential contained in their great ideas.

-veRLv8aj5x15vjYevaHng.text: I go to Harris frequently, usually for happy hour, so I feel I should leave a review. They always have a pretty decent line of beers on draft, and the tots are great.

-hFPrtyQwS-yEkrojuao3Q.text: This little bar and grill makes me want to move to Pittsburgh so bad!  I've been here twice.  Once in 2009 and again in 2011 and the food and booze always makes me happy!   Both of my visits were for the Pittsburgh Bacon Bash and of course I ate tons of bacon things, but I also grabbed a few items from the amazing menu of humorously-named entrees and appetizers.  My favorite app was the bacon chicken wings which were lightly battered and bathed in BaconSalt and then topped with crumbled bacon awesomeness.  With a big bacon bloody mary, it's the perfect meal!   I also had The Central Park, The Old Fashioned, Hog Heaven, the Bacontini, a few cosmos of greatness and a lot of great local beer!  For such a small place the beer options are great.  While the prices were a bit high ($12+ for some of the drinks) compared to anything near me, the quality and quantity both make it worth the bucks!    I also played "What's Up, Pussycat" on the jukebox 10 times in a row and made a lot of people laugh hysterically!

JVJz7-OsP4jV7N8T5OulZQ.text: I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THIS PLACE AGAIN!!!!!  We went to Harris Grill for lunch, we ordered some entree and calamari for appetizer. It was calamari on top of some salad with Thai chili sauce dressing. Just when we almost finished the calamari, I found one entire cigaret in the salad. CIGARET!!!! I have no idea how a cigaret can be in the salad. IT IS JUST DISGUSTING. We left without having the resting of the food.

KxIqnj6c9b0RRRlTCTy_Dw.text: Brunch on the patio with a complimentary bloody (or frozen mimosa)! All you can eat, too.  Loads of fresh fruit, omelette man whipping up whatever kind you want, BACON, great home fries and more. Two thumbs up!

LlrGL2kR9RZRltyD7NZOOw.text: Frozen cosmopolitan with chambord. Delicious.  Also try the Henny Penny, chipotle mayo on ciabatta?? Two of my favorite things.

KW4cwb39K8DR1PC8RAVIbA.text: A little expensive, but a really trendy place in a cute part of the city. The mac and cheese and desserts are incredible. Its dark inside but the unique food makes up for it!

Z6Pu3RmTXek54UKMsHs4qw.text: I have been here many many times and overall my experience is very good.  They have a good selection of drinks and decent food.  They mac-n-cheese dishes are delicious and so are their burgers (my favorite used to be their sliders but unfortunately they removed them from their recent menu). The ambiance is also great for both winter and summer (they have outdoor patios), while the service has always been friendly and useful.  I am sure I will be visiting Harris Grill quiet a few more times in the future! A good choice if you find yourself on Elseworth or Shadyside in general.

91DUwfovbx0cVIPcV9T4wg.text: Harris Grill is great during happy hour and OK during all other times. I used to live right down the street from Harris Grill, so I would come here often. I like the sangria, but since I only come for happy hour these days, I generally just stick with the $3 cosmopolitans. I've had a few different dishes for dinner and they're OK. I remember going ape over the macaroni and cheese a couple of years ago, but I had a bite of a friend's macaroni and cheese on July 4 and was completely underwhelmed. Maybe my macaroni and cheese tastes have evolved, or maybe the quality has just gone down.   My typical happy hour snacks are hummus with pita and the pierogies. I like the hummus - nothing bad to say. I actually love the hummus. I like texture and there are chunks of whole chickpea. I also like that Harris Grill lets me pick whether I want pita, pita chips, and/or vegetable sticks. The pierogies, to me, are hit or miss. I've had them probably three times and once they were so cooked that they were crunchy and dead, once they were perfect - lightly panfried but still softish, and the other time they were somewhere in between. They always taste like butter though. Seriously. Paula Deen would love these pierogies.   My favorite thing that I've ever had at Harris Grill is the deep dish cookie with the ice cream on top. I dream about that thing, but since I am not actively trying to gain 400 lbs, I stick to eating it once every 6 months or so.   The menu is... cute, if you like cutesy menus. The outdoor seating is great on a warm summer evening.

d0dehIDHgLRGD5oc_y3KMw.text: Good Belgium beer selection!!  Small patio even smaller bar.  Appears to always be very crowded regardless of time of day.  This place has a lot of neighborhood dive bar charm complete with tatt'ed hipsters both server and served.  There is one dude with dreadlocks to his knees.  The locals observation of this guy is he is usually in a bad mood and rude.  I didn't interact with him so I cannot comment.  However, I really don't like the idea of someone with hair that has been unwashed for more than 5 years handling my food or walking by food with 4 foot long dreadlocks - which is why we only drank there.   The locals suggest that the reason he appears to be in a bad mood all the time is that he has not washed his hair in the past decade.  :o)  We didn't eat, but the beer selection was awesome.  There were several Belgium beers and our waitress was very good at suggesting some very good beers that I have not had before.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Harris Grill

gio_-0U-t1dgfIXdKgPgtA.text: I've been to this place twice once for happy hour and once for lunch. The drinks were pretty delicious. For lunch, I found this place really not worth the price. My husband and I got a bacon cheese burger and a pork sandwich.  The burger was ok. We asked for medium rare but it was medium cooked. The sandwich and grilled vegetables sides were very salty and dry.

sFXPMIn4NnnPzjlFyryKxA.text: Harris Grill is a fun place to eat and drink. For years I recognized this restaurant as the place with the giant spider around Halloween, but I am glad that I finally went in! The staff is both friendly and accommodating and you can tell that the owners are fun people just by reading the menu. They are great decorators and throw some really unique events like Hoggapalooza which is a party for Groundhog's Day. This is not the best restaurant for large groups, but they do have some lounge seating on the top floor. However, it truly is lounge seating, meaning the table is lower than your seat.  Also a recent update: the infamous Sunday brunch buffet is no longer a buffet. While I was a little bummed about missing out on the buffet, the brunch was still wonderful. Brunch costs approximately $18 and consists of unlimited tea or coffee, an alcoholic drink of choice (frozen mimosa, screwdriver, vodka cranberry, and another option I can't remember), fresh fruit, and an entree.

cIjTFQTNWxT1gxnWax46MA.text: This place was great! Visiting friends in the area we came here twice over the weekend. Each time we were a big group but were seated quickly and given prompt service.   The first time we went it was a Saturday so while we were expecting brunch we found out that only their lunch menu was available (brunch is only on Sunday's). Wasn't a big deal at all since it was noon and their menu was huge and had a lot of great options.  I went with the chicken wings and they were amazing. Actually some of the better wings I've had in a while. I got them with the buffalo sauce however my friend had the chimichurri (I'm sure I spelled that wrong) and he loved them.   We came back on Sunday for the actual brunch and it was also a great experience. The menu is a pre-fix which gets you unlimited coffee, a drink and one of their entrees for just 18 bucks. I went with the eggs Benedict burger. To be honest it wasn't my favorite as the burger meat was pretty over cooked and was a little flavorless. But, others I was with had the breakfast Mac and cheese and that was fantastic. The portion was also massive. I don't think any human being could finish that thing.  Also, they have a great drink menu (which I actually recommend just reading because it was pretty funny) and a decent beer list.  I will for sure go back here next time I'm in the burgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xkBwP4jrZ9TTA1mq5cEz3A.text: Stopped by here for their Sunday brunch buffet and I was not disappointed! They had a delicious spread of biscuits and gravy, smoked salmon, sausages, bacon, potatoes, eggs Benedict, pierogis, and fruit (plus more things that I'm probably forgetting...)  I heard that their fried chicken is super good (but unfortunately they didn't have it that day...) The brunch buffet comes with a drink and I got the frozen mimosa, which wasn't bad.  Service was decent and our waitress was really nice. I would definitely come here if I'm craving brunch again, I think it was around $18 for each person, which is a little steep in my opinion... but for my first time here, I think I had a decently pleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

fuWNIArkN365wNNdKxNUCA.text: Good spot for brunch! They have a great deal: coffee, a drink, and an entree for $18. I had the breakfast Mac & cheese (with egg, bacon, sausage and tater tots - awesome combo) which was quite good. Big portions - my meal could have been split between two people. To drink, I got the frozen mimosa which I enjoyed. I am eager to try the frozen cosmo next time I'm in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast mac &amp; cheese (with egg, bacon, sausage and tater tots) - quite good!
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frozen mimosa! Free drink with brunch entree.

wXROo1YTUi8RtCjC1r0F_Q.text: Harris Grill was the spot for happy hours when I worked for WQED in Oakland. But I've never had the full dining experience.   A friend and I hit up Harris Grill at 6:15pm on Wednesday night. It was a very snowy day in Pittsburgh, so we got seated right away and it wasn't busy. We sat downstairs at a table for two. One server brought us two waters and told us that another server would be over shortly to take our order. Our waiter then brought over two additional waters. More water the better, but one of the glasses was dirty - so we sent it back.   Our waiter was nice. He let us know that it was still happy hour, so we ordered some drinks - we both started with the frozen cosmos. Their frozen cosmo is the best. We also ordered the buffalo chicken appetizer - it comes with pita bread and celery sticks. At first, we didn't get celery sticks - so we asked the waiter and he did bring them. You also can order more pita; but it takes a little while for it come.   We had told our waiter that we weren't ready to order our meals when we ordered the appetizer, but  we had to hunt the waiter to finally order our entrees once we were ready. I ordered the original Mac and cheese - because of the snowy day in Pittsburgh- I wanted some some comfort food.   When the Mac and cheese arrived - it looked good, but I was soon disappointed. Their Mac and cheese was more like pasta and cheese. It wasn't flavorful at all. It wasn't cheesy - just very runny. I was very disappointed. I was hungry, so I ate the Mac n cheese - but I definitely order it again.   I think I'll stick to Harris Grill for their happy hours and appetizers - the food is nothing to write home about.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yTP99nmCY3k3l2-fvWyoxA.text: I got a reservation at this place for the valentine's dinner and although I was trying to surprise my wife they surprise us way better than I expected.  The whole place was shut down and there was a big lock at the front door. The funny thing is I got like 6  confirmation for this reservation. By email, text message and app notifications. I didn't even bother to call after all these confirmations.  Luckily we found another restaurant near by and had an amazing dinner. But this incident could literally ruin my plan for valentine's day.  My advice: don't rely on online reservation and call to confirm.  Update (after the reply from the owner) Apparently the restaurant recently burned down and I'm sorry to hear that.  However there is no need to be sarcastic about my plans and the way this incident affect me. I wasn't responsible for whatever happened to this restaurant and it's the owner responsibility to inform the customers and prevent any confusion. Clearly the owner had time to post this sarcastic response but not to cancel the reservation functionality.

ro_exr1Jb9qk76XjQJYWEw.text: Happy Hour is a steal! Frozen cosmos for $3.50 & they are amazing ! Our server Anna was attentive & nice! We always come here when my friend is in from out of town. Love the service food & drinks !

TE4e4wwxA7OJZ8NWKY05bg.text: I'd say that my dining experience was a solid 3.5. I came for a late night snack and although the servers all have amazing personalities and very hospitable, service was a tad slow and food could've been little more flavorful.  Things I liked: - great servers, patiently took our orders, had sense of humor   - Jamaican jerk chicken wings were delicious!  Things I didn't like: - original Mac and cheese, pasta was a bit watery, perhaps slightly over cooked. Flavor was awesome. I really appreciated the use of crunchy bread crumbs to add variations to texture. Could some some kind of salty cheese or other seasoning to bring flavor to the next level. - French fries had great substance. I enjoyed the thick cuts and perfectly fried texture but could be enhanced with seasoning, perhaps salt/pepper.  -this was purely on my poor judgement, but I got too excited with the coming good weather. I ended up sitting outside and freezing my bony bum off!! As a small suggestion, would be awesome if some kind of outdoor heating was introduced (table candles don't count but they create a warm ambience!)

DK6xp9IKWcEzopEXxIwH9g.text: This place is awesome for brunch. A menu with pretty much anything you could want, plus your meal includes an alcoholic breakfast beverage or fresh-squeezed OJ.  Our party had the Mac n Chee, Breakfast Simile, Huevos Rancheros, and Eggs Benedict. The Simile came with tater tots which I really appreciate, in addition to generous portions of toast, eggs, and meats. Huevos Rancheros had delicious shortrib and excellent flavor. Eggs Benedict was a classic example of the dish, plus slammin' hash browns with peppers and onions. Mac and cheese was a very generous portion and rich and tasty. Don't miss out on the Bloody Mary's.   Service was excellent, but the food did take a while -- not a problem for us at all since we were in for a leisurely brunch. Such a fun joint...I would definitely go back.

n-RzViVy_984v4Y6snH9Ig.text: This was my first visit to this location. I was welcomed warmly on a bone chilling day. I was taken upstairs for a seat. Upon entering there is a log burning fireplace. The building is a couple of stories and the stairs are a bit rustic and the seats worn. That however, did not deter me from a very good dining experience.  The soup of the day was cream of mushroom but I deferred on that when I learned that they make an outstanding crab cake sandwich using real crab cake! It comes with a choice of one side so I chose the grilled vegetables. When I got my food I was thrilled with the portion size and I noticed that the vegetables were crunchy. My waitress explained that they are made purposely that way to include the nutrients.My crab cake sandwich came with lettuce, tomato, onions, and pickles and it was so good and messy to say the least. But I love them that way! I was thoroughly pleased with my lunch. Even though I was too full to order dessert I noticed on the dessert menu that the use Millie's ice cream from around the corner for toppings or stand alone ice cream.  The Harris Grill and the Shiloh Grill on Mt Washington are run by the same company. I was told that the Shiloh Grill will soon take over the Harris grill name because at the end of this month they are opening a 3rd location downtown on 4 th Ave near Market Square. That location will be three stories high and will be open on weekends. It will take over the spot formerly occupied by Old Tavern 245. Be on the lookout for it when it opens.  I also liked how the place was all decorated with different pigs even one with wings! Cute touch to the place.  Located on Emsworth Ave in Shadyside you can get limited free parking in those permit areas for up to two hours. There is one of these on the street north of it. Otherwise you can bike or feed the meter.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab cake sandwich with grilled veggies

7XWj_Dn6CUG1MQOykSRvbQ.text: When it comes to good food and drink, Harris Grill will deliver...albeit on their own time table. Their portions are generous, and everything is tasty (watch out, the jerk chicken is spicy!). Even with the ingredients they were out of, there was plenty to choose from for both omnivores and vegetarians. But don't expect to get in and get out quickly, even on a Monday evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

V1S12T6r9EBDgO9WGZbYAQ.text: a little note from @mcgobro :   long story short, my wing dings took FOREVER and the staff felt so bad that they took care of not only my WING DINGZ but also TWO FROZEN raspberry COSMOS.   This is high quality service, and awareness of appreciating your customers.   go to Harris Grill and enjoy kind people, they are all kind.

A5G0WWKuQTuY8c3uyFXa9Q.text: Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch after a date at the Carnegie Museum. The restaurant was crowded.. there was a 10 -15 min wait for a table so we sat at the bar. The bartender was friendly and rocking out that bar. He was no doubt seasoned. So hungry..ordered food.. the wait was at least 25 min for it to arrive. Maybe they were short staffed in the kitchen? My burger n fries were uneventful (meh) and at that point we would of ate anything. The spicy cole slaw was delicious!   There were plenty of interesting options on the menu from periogies to tacos. It was fun to browse.   I had a feeling the mac and cheese was the hit on the menu.. just wasn't in the mood for it.   The prices vary on the menu .. some menu items are high such as the tacos (pork) for $15.00 and burger with a tiny handful of fries for  $8.00.   Chose Harris grill because figured the prices would be more reasonable than other restaurants in the area... it was and was an "ok" lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cozy fireplace

Y41iAhSwt0H_pK4rsrZ22A.text: Each time I come I like to try one thing new.  Had a $5 frozen cosmo at happy hour again and never disappoints....yum!  Tried the fried calamari again and this time it was well overcooked! Tried the popular Henny Penny for the first time and enjoyed it.  It was spicy but they advertise it that way and server warns you too.  It was good, although the salmon BLY is still my favorite sandwich!  Service is good.  Always friendly and accommodating!

knhLFEnRUnqbUTe5RZW9Cg.text: Harris Grill is an awesome spot for a just beer or a full meal. I've been coming here for years and it never fails to provide a laugh or a delicious dish. The menu is hilarious: dish descriptions connect to pop culture (Stranger Wings) and politics (The Trump Tower Martini). But in addition to its entertaining nature, the menu never fails to provide a delicious option: roasted vegetable salad, lobster Mac and cheese, spinach dip, creative drink options, etc. The outdoor patio is an ideal location in warm, pleasant weather, but the inside also had a great ambiance. Visit Harris Grill for any occasion! It's the best!

ZzOynp3CZNHXAhBEWGOPsw.text: I like to come here when I'm in town, I had the crab cakes, they were very flavorful but I have to say they were on the verge of cold.  We went early and the service was ok, she didn't keep our ice teas full and many times they were empty by the time she stopped back to check on us.  I've had better experiences here in the past so I will give them the benefit of a one off type of day, but I hope they keep their eye on the ball and don't ruin a good thing.  Till next time .......

00MzDhXe9fpzIMTLVn_R0w.text: This wasn't a great experience. I was excited for the Salmon Cobb salad but I was very disappointed. The salmon tasted like charcoal and was dry. The salad lacked flavor and was overpowered by the blue cheese and the onions. The bacon was too crispy and tasted like store-bought, microwaved bacon. The service was also slow. It took 45 minutes just for a salad! I wouldn't recommend Harris Grill. There are better and tastier options in Shady Side.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon Cobb salad. Salmon was dry and over-charred.

n6F1fNkq8vkSV0I7HShjCg.text: Frozen cosmos are the best !! Make sure to get the extra shot!  Outdoor seating is great but the indoor Is just as good.  The food is always good and great service !

RQe-aM3PDejwDshkORU68g.text: I went here again for dessert after another restaurant.  They have a fun wacky menu and outdoor patios.  I ordered the oreo cookies and cream dessert. It was a homemade cookie in an iron skillet with ice cream.  The environment is hip, trendy, collegy and gay. It's like a big frat house with food and a bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cookies and ice cream dessert

5V3jJzIcRud13kalZ75zog.text: Stopped in for a late Sunday dinner and was not disappointed. Seating was instant and the appetizer was on the table with great timing. Waitress was very helpful by telling us her favorite dishes along with some other patron favorites. The chips and queso as an appetizer was an excellent choice, the cheese was a perfect temperature and had a wonderful flavor from the peppers mixed in. The Jamaican tacos were bursting with flavor and had a nice kick at the end. To cool the palette down they serve it with a fresh quinoa salad and some grilled vegetables as well. The portions of this food were actually quite large, which left me with some leftovers for a nice lunch the next day. Amazing first time experience, definitely will be coming back!

vsgtrHp7FIYgoAf32O5AMQ.text: This place offers really poor service. The waitstaff go out of their way to not help you. This has happened to many people I know multiple times. We put up with it so we could get the brunch. We stopped going after we got some serious attitude from our waiter. He was flat out rude and upset my friend so we left and won't be coming back. The food isn't that great (the tacos/fajitas are terrible and flavorless, as is the salad), the drinks are grossly overpriced, and the service as I mentioned before is slow and inept.   On the plus side the brunch is great (it just ended because of winter), the food is relatively well-priced and the location is great (if you can find parking). I recommend going elsewhere though because it just isn't worth being treated so poorly by the staff. Management should take note.

MtxVKWaaWquOa1RBpWseLw.text: We went here tonight for the first time since I was craving a burger and we've been meaning to check this place out. It has a cozy atmosphere: dark, some leather chairs and mis-matchy furniture, candles, a gas fireplace at the door, good music...  We were told there would be a wait, but we were more than welcome to sit at the bar. We were fine with that. Just after we received our drinks at the bar the hostess came over to ask us if we'd mind sitting in the lounge, a table with couches as seating. We gladly took the table in lieu of waiting 20-30 minutes as we originally planned on. We closed our tab at the bar and were seated in the lounge. The couch was comfy and we were happier with the couch than a standard table and chairs, since we were having a date night and we were away from the other patrons, able to sit next to each other :)  We had a pretty entertaining time reading through the food menu, and the drink menu. It's written hilariously.  I decided on the I Can Has Bacon Cheezeburgher (the title! gah!) and my date chose the Thanksgiving Burger (the actual comical name escapes me). My cheeseburger was delicious. Piled with delicious bacon and  cheese, and came with pickles, onions, tomato and lettuce. It was wonderful. I've had many a charred to the point of burnt disgusting burgers in this town and this burger was not one of them. I ordered the fries with it, though I was offered a plethora of options, and the fries were delicious. Crispy, salty, delicious. On the other hand, the thanksgiving burger was MUCH too spicy. In the rosemary spice kind of way. Way too much seasoning. His breath was pretty ungodly the rest of the night, and he didn't particularly enjoy it.  As far as service goes, I specifically want to note that we were well taken care of the whole night. Our waitress as attentive, we never had empty glasses of water or drinks and were not in need of anything. She brought our check when we asked, and it took a few minutes for her to come back to charge our card. Another staff member saw that it hadn't been done yet, came by and took care of it for us without our asking. So either they've been reading the Yelp reviews about service or we were there on a good night.

WhguXOeIeKItnFoJBgl5HQ.text: We stopped here for lunch while waiting for my dad to get out of recovery after surgery to remove a cancerous tumor. The food and drink selection was great, our bill came to $102 and rather than leaving a tip on her card my mom left a $20. After a long, ass, emotional day she got home and was reviewing her bank statement. They charged her card $121 WHILE pocketing the $20. She called and asked why and they told her "oh, our credit card company automatically does that when people don't leave a tip." Ummmm...excuse me?? SHE LEFT A $20 TIP IN CASH. Their reasoning didn't even make sense for adding an extra $20. Shady business practice.

-awmgwfOvclearEcJeOC7Q.text: This is a place where I've never even had a just-OK experience. Every time I come in, I have an enjoyable meal and a killer cocktail or several. If you like Manhattans, I implore you to work your way down their list of variations (over several visits, if you want to remember where you live when you leave).  The last time I went in, I had a splendid hummus and pita plate -- and although the pita ran out before the hummus, my request for more pita was immediately handled, with no critique of my rationing capabilities.  If hummus is not your thing, 1) I don't understand you one bit, but 2) try their baby burgers, the arugula steak salad, or the "labor-inducing vegetarian chili". They all have my seal of approval.  Lastly, if you like bacon, be sure to try this place out on a Tuesday. That's Bacon Night, and Harris serves it at the bar in baskets of four -- free of charge until they run out for the night. If you're dining at a table it's a buck a basket, but you can still eat to your heart's (dis)content.

4V8Ugmqh0_yVy4K2sEX4TQ.text: Tuesday Night is Bacon Night? Yes please, and thank you!!!  Their menu makes me smile.  And not to mention, this is where I met my fiance!  I also like their frozen cosmos... They're delicious!

b7FzuTzBYOtDP6_smrWSKg.text: Went here during a weekday happy hour..appetizers were great! I had wings, pierogies and sauteed veggies.  Wasn't a huge fan of the frozen cosmo (too bitter for me) but we enjoyed the atmosphere!

J4fwt0GxSnPiDzTvDOD_qQ.text: Don't understand the hype, as this place serves slightly above-average bar food in a hipsterish, semi-romantic atmosphere. I cannot comment on the bar and/or alcoholic beverages as I did not imbibe on my recent visit, but the menu didn't do much for me.  We arrived on a busy Saturday night, but were seated within 20 minutes. Not bad, but our table was questionable. They took a big, corner booth and split it in half so that 2 parties of four could be accommodated sitting directly across from each other. It was kind of weird obligatorily staring at the couple across from me, but I digress.  Some of my fellow diners started off with the Vegetarian Chili. I sampled some and it was well-spiced and hearty, I didn't miss the meat. We also started off with the Spinach Dip. The dip itself was fine, though I've never really eaten anywhere that could screw up spinach dip.  The entrees then arrived. My companion decided to have their signature Mac and Cheese. The noodles were a perfect al dente, and the cheese itself had a sharp bite. It became difficult to eat after a few bites, however, for the dish was missing a textural contrast. It would've benefited from some breadcrumbs baked on top.  I decided to sample their bacon cheeseburger, which the establishment is apparently pretty proud of. It was cooked to a True medium rare, which is a rare (no pun intended) find in this city. Also, the bacon was heavenly, an ideal combination of lean and fat. They take their bacon seriously here, and it was easily the most interesting part of the burger. The pros of the burger end there however. It was, besides the bacon, pretty boring. The accompaniments (lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, ketchup, mustard) were standard. The patty itself, while well-cooked and of a good quality, was unfortunately underseasoned. The burger could've benefited from something that gave it pizzaz, like a sauce, some spice, or even some more salt!  I opted for onion rings as a side to my burger. They were large, battered, sweet, and a little crispy, though quite greasy.  Maybe it was because it was a busy Saturday night that I was disappointed. I was expecting some high class bar food at this spot. The common theme of the meal was that although the dishes were competently executed, they all lacked something (such as textural contrast) that could've elevated them to True greatness. Definitely not worth the price.

JFCm56SKjpH1OnKVHzHQow.text: I love Harris Grill because they have a gluten free burger and bun option, and this is a rare and wonderful thing for a Pittsburgh restaurant. It also happens to be delicious -- not at all like some of those dry, flaky gluten-free buns that suck the life out of a burger. I will keep returning.  Love, love this.

MxPMVkhQ3gNfxV94AeLUJA.text: I've been here four times now and have yet to be disappointed. The servers I've had have been very knowledgable of the (very entertaining and unique) menu and specials offered at the time. The atmosphere is very relaxed and comfortable without being too loud. An upstairs lounge area is great for relaxing nights out with a few friends. The food is delicious (highly recommend the Mac and cheese). Always a great experience!

h1ukTi4xyTnejliVO0ZeNA.text: I had the jerk Mac and cheese and it was spicy... I have nothing else to add about that.  I also had the frozen Cosmo (which the bartender tells me they are famous for). It was ok - if you like frozen drinks.  The wait staff however was original with their loud talk about personal hygiene...

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jerk chicken and Mac and cheese ... Spicy but disappointing.  Right along with the frozen Cosmo...

bJeVDY-lupF2uIsk6jjA0w.text: The food was really terrible..I ordered the well done rising titanic burger.... after almost 45 mins they came with a pink burger....after I complained they bring a bacon burger instead with over coocked side vegetables!

KgVhhK42UgEM6-S0WMIU2g.text: Atmosphere was fun and entertaining. Tuesday night bacon night was something to be seen to be believed. They had a great bar with a good selection of beers at reasonable prices.  When we sat down the waiter was helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. We ordered wings, a bacon basket and the mac and cheese with Jerk chicken.  The wings were done well and the flavors we unique, not the best I've ever had but worth having if you need a wing fix.  The mac and cheese was divine. the fact that you could make any combination you wanted was appealing but we went off the menu and I was very happy with it. The right combination of cheese to noodle ratio with a creaminess that was complimented by the savory profile of the jerk chicken.  I am sorry i don't go to Pittsburgh as often for work cause this place was a gem!

m4ybls7Ft8jZOh-_IC-yAQ.text: Awesome place to eat, hangout and catch up with friends. The menu is funky and fun to read. Make sure you ask your waitress/waiter if you have any questions about the food so you don't have any surprises when the food comes. The Mac and cheese is awesome!

jvzw2I44_w0B6-F4zN8kCw.text: The fact that this place has a bacon night has impressed me for years.  I would receive fat-smudged pages of letters written at this bar, the samples of Dogfish head dripped onto dog-eared corners for me to scratch, sniff, and lick at my discretion.  The men's room alone is a reflection I would leave unchanged in my description of this place.  The orange/yellow urinal and the sink are shaped in the Rolling Stone's mouth logo.  Next time I visit Pittsburgh I will do brunch there with friends,

_pmYo7gBk4gBeHzVg4Qwkg.text: Amazing experience! I travel to a lot of countries and states for work so I eat out and Stay in plenty of towns and cities we were in town from the Cleveland area for a mini vacation! This has been by far one of the best dining and bar experiences I've had! Took my girlfriend here for her 31st birthday! She went to The college nearby and said I wouldn't be disappointed! She was absolutely right! The food was superb and even though we had to wait 45 mins for a table it worked out And was Worth it, because we found a place at the bar during the Wait time, which the service was just as Great!!

0o8kCnjGpJwx1UdJFx5yeg.text: I stay 2 blocks away from Harris Grill. I have been to shiloh's grill as well, a caouple of times. Harris Grill used to make awesome food an year ago..now its just boiled vegetablea..steak cut out for you..who would want that!!!!

4NJ9Rydx6xVXo3EGfeGY5g.text: The food here is mediocre at best. If it's packed get ready for a shit show. You witness things like, a steak well done when you really asked for medium. Apparently hand washing is also a forgotten past time at this place.

cTQMimb7JWRbQSJ6lrc5-A.text: First off, the drinks here are amazing. I go to this more for the happy hour specials than for the food.  The food is decent here, but it's not my first choice. It's more of an "Oh, I haven't been there in awhile place. Sure!" The service can be a bit slow at times, but it doesn't typically bother me because I'm socializing with friends over a cocktail. If you're into tacos, definitely check out their jerk chicken tacos. QUITE fantastic.

LiuS-nOIc7crO8LmNrEnmA.text: The first time I went to Harris Grill, I had been living in Pittsburgh for about a week and was on a first date. A year later, my love for Pittsburgh, my date, and Harris is unwavering. I've gone to Harris about twice a month on average since, whether it's because friends or family are in town and I want to go someplace that's both fun and has an approachable menu; because it's 11 p.m. and I need to go someplace where the kitchen's still open yet it isn't overwhelmed with a party crowd; or because I want to enjoy happy hour food paired with an extensive beer list.  I haven't been dazzled by everything on the menu, but I generally think the food is good to very good for the price and atmosphere. The only thing I really haven't liked there was the "Lasagne Aubergine," or eggplant lasagna, which I thought was too salty and generally unappealing the one time I had it.  On the "okay" list: chicken quesadilla (also a bit too salty), spinach dip, and tots  Good: pierogies, vegetarian chili, Jamaican jerk wings, and macaroni and cheese  Very good: "The Clogbuster" (what I consider to be a real salad, not some pathetic bar "salad" with a bunch of fatty things atop two pieces of iceberg lettuce--this one has a bunch of root vegetables, peppers, et cetera)  Love: turkey burger, "Macaronis et Fromagede Langoustine" (seafood mac and cheese), and dry-rub bacon wings  The Harris staff has always been incredibly friendly and attentive (even during busy times that are typical of nights, weekends, and happy hours). The bar really isn't big enough for the kind of crowd it draws, and it can get pretty packed and noisy, but when the patio's open, it helps relieve some of that crowdedness. Oh, and the parking on and off Ellsworth is a nightmare. Still, I think it's worth a visit for anyone who's looking for a no-fuss night out.

RtK3z9pC20Bv7jtwYNVssg.text: Went for lunch. Really fantastic service. Good menu options. Food was okay. Okay, maybe a little better than okay, but not as mouthwatering as the menu left us anticipating.

w92AC5WgiLAr6j8lRVkWRg.text: No complaints about this place. I tend to gravitate towards this place mid afternoon with my laptop...love the vibe here. Outdoor patio or, NICE window seating upstairs. Creative menu as well. Check it out!

Y1bb0RJykwGKhJrYD2c2Uw.text: I am giving Harris 4 stars because it is my neighborhood bar and has sentimental value to me. Minus that, it is probably a 3.5. They have a stellar frozen cosmo but the rest of the drink menu is just okay. Their food menu is a hit or miss. Their turkey burger and mac'n'cheese are great but the rest is probably just okay. Their desserts are unimpressive and it is hard to underwhelm me when it comes to sugar. So I would say, go for the atmosphere and the cosmo but not for much more.

aUeel2wXAEQ6M20JySPD-w.text: Completely surprised by this place! The drinks were good, strong & cheap. The food was excellent. For 3 vodka drinks, 2 beers, chicken & veggie quesadillas and mini burgers, we paid $35. Cute, dark, little place with outside seating. We sat at the bar. Got great service!

Sp1m2krtHGYxePES89ypsQ.text: best freaking restaurant and bar. all the food is amazing. all the drinks are amazing. all the staff are amazing. very knowledgeable too.

uSNQ-XV8bNtgAcrnY-Pw7w.text: I wish i could rate it 3.5... There are certain foods that are mediocre, but certain foods that I loved! The steak burger was amazing  (is it delmonico?).  And definetly get tater tots instead of fries. Fish tacos are delicious as well. Also they have great frozen cosmo and amazing bloody mary!  I personally did not like the waiters as they are a bit pushy with trying to get you to order more drinks/food. Their selection of beer seems pretty cool, but I have never once tried any of their beer and liked it, also they seemed a bit on the warmer side. Also their dips (like the babaganoush) are awful... seems like they have a big bucket of it, then slap some of it on a place, reheat for 30 seconds, and serve.

PbCuiCIQcYcA3ZEDuyVTQw.text: My initial impression of Harris Grill was depth and character.  It was a feeling of visiting a friend's family during a holiday.  I could literally feel generations of customer satisfaction and implored character from the ownership.   I have yet to eat a meal there, aside the experience of maybe 12 pieces of bacon during their seemingly imfamous "Bacon Night".   Should you find pairing foods with drinks, try the volatile yet interesting challenge of pairing imports and domestics, maybe even wine or liqour, with a tray of sizzling bacon during Harris Grill's Bacon Nights. Once again, the feeling of personal relationships and character run deep within this establishment, which seems to be the norm in shadyside.  I plan on visiting this establishment more frequently to get to know its staff and regulars.   I'm eagerly awaiting it's spring and summer enviornment so I can give a well rouneded, highly anticipated 5 star review.

miUavmjw74shHAklF6VImg.text: When I thought of Harris Grill, I'd think of a bunch of hipsters sprawled out on the patio with clove cigarettes and PBR, talking about their new garage band or their sister's new girlfriend. I suppose that is largely still True, though it's not nearly as off-putting in real life as it is in my annoyed imagination. Harris Grill lives on Ellsworth Avenue, a notoriously "trendy" section of Shadyside. Usually when I employ that word, trendy, I mean it in a bad way...trendy haircut...trendy leg-warmers...trendy Vampire Weekend album. At any given moment, you could probably find all three of those things at Harris Grill, but the restaurant itself is not "trendy." Its style is refreshingly original, sultry even. From the smart-assed menu to the creepy paintings of clergy-folk on the restroom doors, Harris Grill has injected so much weirdness into the atmosphere, it's impossible for me to not love it. And love it, I do. I've had many great times at the Harris, and when it was out of commission for while after a Pompeii-style fire evacuation, I missed it dearly (ok, maybe that's an exaggeration). It's been my birthday celebration host for a few years now (Harris Grill is the new McDonald's ballpit) and at the recommendation of the aforementioned menu, I've been known to take advantage of their weekend brunch Prix Fixe menu to shake off a hangover or a bad date. One of my all-time favorite memories of this city is the day my buddy Sam & I sat on the patio and drank 37 whiskey & lemonades. (Man, I love drinking outside with friends. Harris Grill is PERFECT for that; if only Pittsburgh had more than fifteen minutes of sunlight a year). Anyway, I thought I had the place figured out...Harris Grill is a good time for a crazy little lush like me. It wasn't until I went there for dinner, with a real official date, that I realized just how perfectly the food and service complement the fun atmosphere and drink menu. Ryan and I walked over to the Harris Grill for dinner on an especially creepy & crispy fall night. Of course the patio was packed, so we took a table for two upstairs. It is surprisingly sexy on that second floor; the walls are dark, but there neat light fixtures all over the place...you can see your food and your date, but you aren't distracted by the knuckleheads surrounding you; it's intimate and nice without being cheesy. Luckily that is not the case with the Buffalo Chicken dip appetizer, which was very cheesy and also sexy. Served with warm pita and topped with crumbled bleu cheese, this concoction would make any chicken proud. For dinner, I enjoyed a fresh (fresh! fresh!) Greek Salad, complete with grilled chicken, pitted Kalamata olives and feta cheese (hmm...didn't realize how much I love cheese...). Ryan practically ranted about how good his Henny Penny was...blackened chicken sandwich with lettuce, tomato, red onion, and spicy mayo on texas toast. Oh, and I had a really killer draft beer, too; Anderson Valley Winter Solstice. Jamie, our waitress, was friendly and attentive throughout the meal. She told us before we looked at the menu what the restaurant was out of that night, but then she also made recommendations for other awesome dishes. (Thanks, Jamie!) The whole thing came in at just under $50.00, and that's including the bar drinks- pretty good. The only complaint I have about the place is that it's always crowded. Then again, even the out-of-the-way tables are not excluded from the interesting atmosphere & great service. (Oh! The second floor of the Harris has large booths facing huge floor to ceiling windows...if you ever want to take a handful of hungry people to dinner, it's perfect for people-watching.) Obviously, I really dig this place. I'll probably write about it more than once, just so you can get an idea of whether it is consistently awesome (or not). I find that it's got different vibes at different times of year (mainly due to space because the patio is closed on snowy winter days). In the meantime, I'd encourage you to check it out for yourselves...just don't park in the lot next to the restaurant; watching tow trucks haul cars out of there is more fun than a Pirates game. And I almost forgot: Tuesday is Bacon Night! Harris Grill 5747 Ellsworth Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15232 Phone: 412.362.5273 harrisgrill.com

qczNANRrRTkZOKyKfd2x-Q.text: This has been my go to suggestion when friends want to meet for drinks for years. The atmosphere can't be beat, the outdoor patio is one of the cities best, the drinks are consistent, and the menu is just good fun. The brunch at Harris is really something special, and a frozen mimosa is probably the second coolest thing ever. The first, naturally, is the frozen cosmo, which the Harris Grill has perfected (I get mine with a shot of Chambord...mmmm). They have lots of vegetarian options for me, although they've done away with the falafel wrap recently...what gives? It was a favorite! They make some badass Mac & Cheese, and the portion is huge. Their desserts are worth saving room for. The second floor is my favorite place to sit, feels intimate and kind of dark and cozy. And I especially like the big booths right in front of the giant window overlooking Walnut Street, so you can do some people watching while you dig in.

ZkR9YgDZpxT6ze_BlIMc2w.text: I like this place, I really do, they have a great selection of beers and a nice atmosphere. My most recent experience here was a three-starrer though- we had to wait about 20 minutes for a table for 6 and were seated at a table for 4 with 2 chairs on one end (it was new year's day at 8pm, they weren't THAT busy), and then it took at least another 30 (maybe 45) minutes for our 4 food orders to come. To boot, my "medium rare" burger was overdone and lacking in flavor. The fries were excellent as usual though, as was the beer.

EISraFWnCRELIYtTfFPjng.text: Harris Grill is a good Pittsburgh standby--a place I like popping by when I'm back in town. The atmosphere you get is so mixed though, depending on which crevice of the joint you get stuck in. The upstairs corners are invariably awkwardly cold or quiet, but the patio is awesome. The quality of the food is also as mixed. Sometimes the burgers are absolutely scrumptious, sometimes they're overcooked and chewy.   Whatever. I like it anyway. Bacon night, frozen cosmos. What more do you want.

TjmhZLFTJtPPz4SW8IXv3w.text: Frozen cosmos with a shot of chambord = AWESOME.  Priced for Happy Hour (4:30-6:30) at $3.50 is hard to beat.  Mac and cheese is excellent, as is the lasagne aubergine.  The service wasn't noticeably bad, so I have no complaints there.    I take all my out-of-town guests there.

KOUzxzlySKrQidPKNyWPiw.text: We showed up at 6:25, and the bartender didn't give us an attitude for trying to hurry up and order apps and beers before happy hour ended!  That started the night off good.  Our eggplant lasagna was TO DIE FOR, and the spin spin sugar salad was really freaking good!  I recommend it!

7WJ20wQ6Aj4mwAHxlZbxsg.text: One of the best spots in the city. Gorgeous crowd, hilarious menu, awesome patio. The absolute best people-watching and drinks spot in the city. Glad to have you back, Harris Grill!

RjrmZpxs64rIUSQNqteGeA.text: For a summer chill-out spot in Shadyside--especially during happy hour--I don't think it gets better than Harris Grill. Patio seating and half-price drafts: yes please. The menus for beer and food are both varied and interesting, as well as full of enough snark to almost make you forget you're in Pittsburgh's most demure neighborhood. I've never eaten or drank inside, but the surroundings seem darker/slower in there than on the patio.

91KBvZPgFIHHLkTOgKt8aw.text: It's a good thing Harris Grill has good beer and Bacon Night since otherwise you wouldn't have anything to occupy you for the 45 minutes to an hour it takes to get food on your table from the point in time that you order.  FYI - definitely order that last round of drinks (plus an additional one) as you ask for your bill since the poor service doesn't stop when the food actually gets to your table.  I wrote HG off the first time I went there, then gave them a second chance after a friend asked me.  Guess what my final assessment is.

sMrs52TgsoXkwGqNyZnF7A.text: if this place was not around the corner from me, i probably would not frequent it as much as i do.  however, i have had many good times here...the atmosphere is cozy and has become my #1 spot for sat/sun brunch gab seshes with the girls. i equally enjoy the frozen cosmos (w/ the shot of chambord of course!). the food is a little pricey for what you get but the menu is pretty amusing.   lastly, i absolutely love the vegetarian chili- it is probably my favorite item.   see you again in '09 harris grill!

MrHQMSuaPf3g6ZBPE057xg.text: My go to spot when I just want to relax with some friends.  Great drinks and craft beer selection is coupled with very good food.  Make sure to checkout the lounge upstairs during those cold winter months.  During the summer grab a seat on either the front patio for people watching, or the back patio for a nice quiet and private drink.  Good brunch turns great once the patios are closed, as the brunch buffet becomes a la carte.  This brings about the Breakfast Smil... err, Simile.  Home fries, bacon, sausage, eggs, and pancakes all on one giant plate.

jfOY-io3SDtjKLUXK0_0hg.text: I go to Harris most every week for happy hour, which features excellent half-price wings (I like the "Colombian Gum Numbers") and beers.  The atmosphere is very classy, and there's  a nice patio to sit on when the weather's pleasant.  I never go outside of happy hour, though, because it's just too damn expensive.  $6 beers?  $6 for 6 wings?  Why do hipsters like overpaying for things?  I don't know, but they must, as this place is always packed to the gills with them.

MyalmYygUddHGd7OBj_uDw.text: Not the most amazing place you've ever been, but if you're walking distance or in the neighborhood, it's worth a trip. Very decent selection of beers, and for those of you with sweet tooths (teeth?), they have a framboise on tap. Lovely. Had the hummus/pita snack there last night, and that was much better than I expected. Atmosphere and service are o.k. Best on a Thursday night, IMO.

S94Om8aith9RBe3NXlR6HA.text: Harris grill is lively, unpretentious, and has good food. Its patio is a great place to linger on a warm evening, and the bar and restaurant are good places for cheap food on colder winter nights.

dR9_7cqQIYC6qlor4yrl7A.text: I really want to like Harris Grill more, but there is always something that turns me off. It's in a great location, with a lot of outdoor seating. Their food is good. They have a hilarious menu, with descriptions written to make you laugh!The pirogies are so good and I've gotten a ton of different sandwiches and salads here that were pleasing. It gets busy here with their lower costs items and drink specials pulling out the college crowd. So be prepared to deal with that some nights. What turns me off a bit, it always seems dirty. I wish it had more of a cleanly feel so I could get into eating here more. The bathroom smells, the menus seem filthy, but I like the food!  Pretty much, it puts me in a tough place because if the rooms are dirty, what does the kitchen look like. I still come back when friends want to go, but I'm never running back.  Clean it up Harris Grill and I'll be back!

CJsFfreWn6t9HebO9RpS7w.text: Love this place and the staff. Recommend the calamari as a starter! And then try everything else. Lol

WRFKmXfdqSJU_utNUTiLpQ.text: I started coming here for work lunch meetings years ago, back before I was even 21. I was told it's the best menu in town, regardless of what food is on it. Years later, I still agree that it's hilarious bringing newcomers here just to read the menu.  The drink menu is massive and overwhelming, and when you ask for a recommendation they will usually tell you to go with a seasonal item (cocktails or beers) or a manhattan (they also have a full page menu of manhattans.) They currently have a pumpkin sangria that is to die for. The patio is always packed, even when it's cold out, because it's pretty fab.  The drinks aren't cheap, which is a bummer. Luckily the cocktails really are pretty special, though. Happy hour is good for beers, but that's about all. If you're looking for cocktails to please the manliest of men to the girliest of girls, go to Harris Grill. He can get a manhattan and she can get a dessert chocolate and baileys concoction, or something.  I've been here for all kinds of reasons, but I think it's best for snacks and drinks. The food menu has some Pittsburgh specialties that I would recommend for fun and for out-of-towners, but I've also had many "tots n beers" nights that have hit the spot perfectly. (The vego chili is also perfect to pair with a meal or as a snack).  Sometimes the drinks are better than others. I have ordered the same manhattan and the same bloody mary on different nights, and they were worlds apart. That is disappointing, but Harris Grill has always got something to make up for any pitfalls.

beYAu8dKl7Vr7iwKf6XS2Q.text: 2 words: TATER TOTS!   tater tots give me such a nostalgic feeling thinking back to my elementary, middle school days-- i get them everytime im at harris grill for the following reasons:  (1) a plate of them costs, lets say, $3 bucks n they pile like 20 to 30 tots so that makes it like .10 cents for a bite of salty heaven  (2) the unexpected great companion for booze ---- especially since harris grill does have a whole book filled with different cocktails, you're gonna b there for a while... and you're going to get hungry sooo u no where im going with this  (3) tater tots are AWESOME!  (4) every good thing associated with tater tots, do i need to say more?  but seriously i have tried other things there, n they are just as fabulous, the calamari is definitely a must-try.. their bacon n cheese burger is glorious, even the vegan falafel tasted like i was eating meat (meaning that it was just as flavorful as everything else)  the ambiance is what you want it to b, i've come here with my girlfriends, i've also come here with a posse of dudes and not to mention on suit night with my best guy friend.. its always a good time.  i love dining here esp when its warm out so my friends n i can chill on the deck n drink to the moon and stars
