f7RQi5MVPYb2TvLZtizl2Q.text: Very tasty!  Casual, nice, medium sized bar.    Great bloody mary.  Very, very good.  The bartender even made us an off menu blue cheese, bacon, and egg bloody mary which was just insane basically.    The Jerk Chicken Mac n Cheese was very good too.  Spicy, spiral noodles in a lightish cheese sauce.  Not super decadent but that's good because it was a HUGE portion.  Everything everyone in our group got looked pretty good.    Slightly expensive for what it was but whatevs.

h_YktBBXqtS4cYFJcelquQ.text: The place is good for drinking but definitely not to have a meal. There're not much options on the menu.  I tried the pasta once and it was tasteless.

RuxzxWS1k73iytGb3v5Dng.text: Harris has a few great things going for it.  First, their happy hour from 5-7 Monday-Friday where all drafts are half off, a few specialty cocktails are 5 bucks, and several appetizers are half off.  Second, they have a fairly high-quality, medium sized selection of craft beers.  Third, they have an awesome outdoor patio seating area for nice days.  Fourth, for the area, they have above average food at a reasonable price.  A few of the negatives are the limited bar seating which often fills up at busy times, service which can be variable in quality, lack of drink specials outside of happy hour, and the somewhat cramped tables inside.  Overall, this is one of the better places to try in the area, especially at happy hour or when looking for outdoor seating.

vClDE1PmNlfYlWe4CGmyag.text: Have been here a couple times for brunch in the last few months. Great food and love that the brunch comes with a drink! Will keep coming back.

LEEkV4HenYW_H4L9Qp4Epw.text: Have been here a few times. Decent reliable place.  My favorite food - Mac and cheese with jerk chicken. It's good!!!

AIWcMQ68IMwX3BjvwK7ztw.text: Love this place! Extensive vegetarian menu despite bacon night. Staff is extremely friendly especially the bar staff. We come here about once a month and they are pretty consistent. Don't skip out on the seasonal cocktails!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frozen spiced cider fucking delicious

vmDDduYSCBVY6OjDGSwUdA.text: I love the Harris Grill!  The food is consistently good, and while the prices are a little steep, I've never had a bad meal here.  The service is generally quick and attentive.  I love their creative menu and have tried almost everything on the menu over the last 8 years since my first visit.  Some of my favorite items are:  The Polish Church Basement Pierogies - my maternal grandmother used to make homemade perogies every year for Christmas and Easter, and these perogies are just as delicious as hers were - I definitely recommend them if you like perogies!  The fish tacos are always great as well, and the mac and cheese is rich and creamy, especially the Macaronis et fromage de langoustine - if you are a fan of "fancy" mac and cheese with crab/lobster in it then you will not be disappointed!  It's a great dish to share!  I've tried most of their salads and my favorites are the Hail, Caesar! and the Great Salmon I Am.    There are lots of choices on the menu for every kind of person - kids, carnivores, vegans and vegetarians, it's a diverse menu which makes it easy to dine there with a large group of friends or family because of the variety.  They also have a full bar and a great selection of beers and wine available.  The atmosphere is casual and laid back and I've been there for work events on a few occasions and we've always been pleased.  I will definitely be back!

iSn8HG36ef6G6YMHhEgVsg.text: I used to love this restaurant, which is why I wanted to come here for my birthday earlier this week. I live in Chicago but was in town visiting family in Pittsburgh. Since we had plans in the evening, we came for lunch. The place was empty, and since two people in my party have trouble walking up and down stairs, we asked to be seated on the first floor. For the entirety of the meal, we had to share the small, first-floor room with a group of employees having a rather loud staff meeting. I get that the restaurant is relatively empty on a weekday afternoon, but it affected our enjoyment of the meal. Well, mostly the food affected our enjoyment, but I'll get to that.  Harris Grill's bacon cheeseburger is one of my favorite burgers I've ever had, but on my visit, it was pretty lackluster. Someone else in my party got mac n cheese, and the amazing mac n cheese I remember is now bland. The tater tots on the side with my burger arrived overcooked and so crunchy they hurt to eat. You could tap a knife against them and couldn't cut them, that's how hard they were. I mentioned this to the server, and she was apologetic and put in a new order of tater tots that took 15-20 minutes to arrive at the table. By the time I got the new order of tater tots, I was almost done with my burger. I'd understand if the restaurant were super busy, but it wasn't. (Aside from a table outside, the only other customers were my party, as far as I could tell.) Usually, if there's something wrong with a side and it takes that long to come out, the side will be comped or you'll at least get an apology for the wait. I got neither.  Service was very slow. Getting drink refills took a long time, as did our food. Again, I'd understand if they were busy, but we sat there for a long time.  Harris Grill used to be so good and one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh, but I don't think I'll be coming back.

Z8oywGnydzRqN0iHc1lhsQ.text: I'm new in town, but by far this is my favorite restaurant so far. It's simple. Do you like foodie twists of classic food? Do you like places with a good beer / drink menu? If yes, go there. If no, don't go there. We always get the hummus appetizer, it's a fav. Also love the tacos and mac 'n cheese. BTW it gets mega packed on the weekends. Prepare to wait (and maybe sample the drink menu).

UuEG_b-kkWNmoaQVMy0LNA.text: With the wealth of breakfast and brunch offerings in the Pittsburgh area, it's great to go to one that isn't snubbing it's nose at the rest of the crowd. We were riding around, trying to find a place that didn't have a 4 day wait and would satisfy a monstrous appetite. And of all the brunch places in all the world, this one came walking into my life.  Here's the deal that can't be beat: an unlimited Breakfast buffet with smoked salmon, eggs Benedict, an omelet station, and a frozen mimosa for $15. That's right kids! Add to that the great selection of beers and cocktails and you may need to move in. I was so satiated that I didn't eat another meal the rest of the day.  The bonus was that there was great outdoor seating so we could participate in some obligatory people-watching.  Next time I am back in this great town, I will definitely be hitting this place up again. I just need to see where I can purchase one of those additional stomachs and an extra-stretchy pair of pajama jeans.

H-cTMS32bd83NzCXm6FMvw.text: 4 stars for their happy hours and service, 2.5 stars for food/drinks/value outside of happy hour  Despite my slightly-less-than-enthusiastic rating, I am going to preface this review by saying that Harris Grill holds a very special place in my heart.  It's definitely not a place to take your "foodie" or wine/cocktail enthusiast type friends, and it would be hard to convince me to come here outside of the happy-hour hours, but it is a staple of the pittsburgh grad student experience.  Happy hours at Harris Grill are very happy hours, indeed.  Everything on the "fun things" appetizer list is $5, the wings--which are one of the tastier items on the menu--are half price, and frozen cosmopolitans and craft beers are all half price!  Frozen cosmos are a Harris Grill specialty...and, if you're into that kind of drink, you will find them delicious.  They are frosty cold, strong, and not too sweet, with a very pretty presentation.  The craft beer tap list is always rotating and often includes an excellent selection (plus, you can't beat the $2.50-$3.50 prices).  The outdoor spaces are lovely -- the front patio (a prime location right on Ellsworth) is the best, and the smaller back patio is cute as well.  Because they're so awesome in warm weather, you have to arrive earlier than 4:30 on weekdays to claim a table for your party if you're coming for happy hour.  Outside of happy hours, though, the food is very mediocre for the prices you're paying, and the craft beers are normally priced at $4.50-$7.00 (and suddenly the selection seems so much less impressive compared to the big beer bars like Fat Heads and D's Six Pax).  The other drinks are fine enough, but nothing to write home about.  They do brunch as well, but I was less than impressed with the food and my bloody mary.  The service can sometimes be slow during very busy days/hours, but it's almost always very friendly and goofy.  Harris Grill servers are some of the most fun and accommodating of any place you'll find in Pittsburgh.  They've done all kinds of weird things for my friends and me in the past, including accept their tip via personal check and move an entire couch for me because I dropped my purse behind it and could not reach it.  Despite the unimpressive quality of the food and drink value outside of happy hour, Harris Grill definitely has personality.  This is not only evidence in their service but also in their menu!  The menu has a cover that rotates through photographs of the staff making crazy faces and being silly, and it features dish names such as The Britney Spears (chicken tenders on a skewer) and Traditional Italian Divorce Soup.  All of these things ultimately combine for an almost guaranteed fun time with friends.  I just prefer to do it during happy hour!

LUJJJIcQaaSH-pDHFzEyUA.text: Might I say that this is one of the best places in Pittsburgh to get a late night bite and brew?  Yes, I might and will say this.  After a frustratingly long day during a frustratingly long week at work, I decided I needed to stop here and ease my nerves with some comfort food and try out a few brews.  This, my friends, is just what the doctor ordered (no pun intended in relation to my work).  My friend had beat me there and already had one of each in front of her.  She decided on the Trailerpark Tatchos and I'm not quite sure what she had to drink, but it was interesting in an interesting glass.  The Tatchos were amazing.  Nothing more than nacho toppings on tater tots, but a brilliant idea none the less.  The mixture of tastes on the fried up tater tots was great.  In a single bite you got spicy, hot and cool.  I decided that I needed to order something else myself, as I feared that my friend might end up raising her lip and snarling at me for eating more than I should.  I got myself an order of Cloudy and a Chance of These.  I dare you to take a wild guess as to what this order pertained to.   DING DING DING...you, sir get a prize...not really.  Nothing but an order of meatballs swimming in a big huge potion of their sauce.  Served with a side of bread to sop up what the fork missed.  The right combination of spices mixed with the melted cheese on top was what did it for me.  And that bread made sure I didn't miss a smear of that sauce.  As for the brews, I tasted three different ones while I was here.  It was kind of hard to choose, but their nifty little binder filled with the choices made it easier.  What also made it easier was the fact that our waitress was able to make suggestions, not just guesses like most places.    Different flavors hitting my palate at just the right time made for a great night here.  I will definitely keep this on my short list when I need to calm myself after a hectic day at work.

F66WbB-4vBG3sZOpzmG1wQ.text: Went to Harris Grill last night for my last night in Pittsburgh.  Really cool experience and it was a beautiful night to sit outside and enjoy the atmosphere.  First, Tuesday is bacon night and I'm not quite sure how it works, but I heard it's free bacon at the bar and $1 baskets of bacon if you're sitting at a table.  My friends and I had a drink and some bacon at the bar while we waited for a table (obviously bacon night is a hit and makes the restaurant busy).  I really enjoyed the selection of beers.  I wanted to try the Game of Thrones beer, but liked the amber beer they had too much to switch.  As an app, we shared the buffalo chicken dip.  It was not the biggest portion, but it's always nice eating grilled pita instead of just tortilla chips every so often.  The dip had very large pieces of chicken and was crusted with blue cheese.  Pretty basic and well executed.  The menu is pretty simple, but difficult to read.  My friends had been there before so they knew what to look for, but I had a difficult time reading through the commentary and trying to tell what was in each dish.  One of my friends recommended something he had gotten before, so I decided that was easier than wasting my time with the menu.  I got the mac and cheese and added in lobster and bacon.  It was really decadent and better than I expected.  The cheese was very creamy and flow-y.  A lot of times, the cheese on mac and cheese doesn't flow well, but I really liked the consistency of Harris Grill's mac and cheese.  The lobster was also very delicious.  As for the bacon, they just put it on top.  So basically it was lobster mac and cheese with some bacon strips on top.  I was expecting either bacon bits mixed with everything or even bacon strips submerged in the cheese.  Nonetheless, the bacon was very crispy and i dipped a few strips in the cheese which was a solid idea.

feOrh8c8-97dK8nAkSXw8w.text: Very much like it's sister restaurant, the Harris Grill shares quite a lot. Menu items are the same, beer menu is frequently different, but the seasonal beers are the same. They even have the same parking issues, when the Harris Grill is hopping, you'll park blocks away.   The Spring/Summer menu is on the docket now, some great items new are build your own bowl, I picked Quinoa, Grilled vegetables, and grilled salmon. The grilled vegetables were expertly cooked, crisp tender, smokey sweetness and the salmon was just under done, perfect! The quinoa was tender and an excellent foil for the smoked vegetables. Also on the menu is a greens free salad called Alexander The Great. It's Quinoa, chopped red peppers, Feta cheese, cucumbers, cured olives and a lemon vinaigrette. Light, yet filling from the protein packed Quinoa, it's a great dish for those HOT summer nights and sitting on the deck, great with a cold IPA or a Malbec.   Both restaurants offer great servers, bartenders and friendly hosts. If you're a snooty Yelper and expect white collar waitstaff, these bars aren't going to be for you. If you are looking for a fun place to eat and imbibe, meet honest to goodness down to earth people, then the Harris and Shiloh grills are for you. Open for lunch now at 11:31 am. I removed a star because I had to circle the bar three times before I could park my car.

19rvwBwczepIYfSRulegyQ.text: Got the Britney Spears and bacon cheezburger- flawless. Best goddamn cheeseburger I've eaten in the last 26 years.

hKATxg7HH3mTkhbpSBzTGQ.text: I've been to Harris several times before but always seem to forget to Yelp afterwards. However, my last visit left an impression and I couldn't forget to share thoughts with all of you!   We started with an appetizer of hummus, pita bread and vegetables. I was actually introduced to hummus at Harris about a year ago and judge other hummus selections in comparison to Harris'. It's sooooo good. It's thick, a tad bit spicy and perfect to munch on before and during your meal.   During my last visit I ordered the Henny Penny and I was definitely satisfied. From the description, I knew it would have a "zing," but I didn't expect to be a fire breathing dragon (it's all good, though! I like spicy stuff!). They used a certain breading that almost reminded me of a wing-dust seasoning to bread the chicken in and topped it off with vegetables and a delicious homemade mayo that added to the zesty-ness of it all. Of course what sandwich isn't perfected without fries! Yum!  My only complaint is the crowd. Maybe because it was a Friday night? Maybe because it was during the Pride Pub Crawl? I don't know... I just don't do well with screaming and obnoxious people as I'm trying to eat my sandwich and have a conversation with my friend. We were even upstairs and away from the bar. It's all whatever, though. Between the food and the good service, Harris always has me happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Henny Penny.
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hummus.

GzkWye_cw7A-RNRNpzSOGw.text: This place USED to be my favorite. They haven't been the same since the fire about 7 years ago. I will say that they have gotten a lot better in the past year. I think they were focusing more on alcohol sales and less on quality food but hopefully that tide has turned.   I loved the baby burgers when they were around and now they have a similar slider appetizer but it's the same. Their ranch dressing is great, and take it from me, I KNOW GOOD RANCH. Also sitting on the front porch is nice in the summer; I love the second floor window seat too.   Dislikes include the long waits, sometimes slow service, hit or miss food, and often loud atmosphere.

sq83vuw42-6xj1eA5w1zJw.text: The drinks are strong and the staff is friendly. It looks like a great place to be from the outside and the warmth inside carries. D lighting and cozy corners make for a great atmosphere.   The food is good and came pretty quickly for being with such a big party. They put up with 20+ women talking about all sorts of things and were courteous and attentive. They even split up the bill for everyone, which a lot of places won't do for groups.   No complaints here. I hope to come back with a smaller crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish tacos

YCyiESeXQx9Wwj4iKgaXpA.text: My husband and I were in town just for the weekend and we went to Harris Grill for dinner - Thanks Yelp! Great great experience there. It was quite busy and we had about a 30 minutes wait. We walked around the area and came back for a beer at the bar while we were waiting for a table. People at the reception desk were nice and our bartender was really kind. We had..  Calamari for appetizer - great!  Fish taco (fried) - pretty good for an American bar-restaurant.. of course I didn't expect it to be amazing. Jerk chicken mac and cheese - AMAZING!! we would come back for this dish again and again. cocktails - Moscow mule was good and Happy Ending was Fantastic!! - highlight of my day.

SaWM7Lt3iR5KOJd7Uxvjzw.text: Easily my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. I've been frequenting Harris since the summer I turned 21 as a wee college senior, and this place grew for me to become a staple for my grad school classmates and I for post-exam celebrations, birthday bashes, and general shenanigans. The menagerie of frozen cocktails that Harris slings up throughout the year centers around the crown jewel that is the frozen cosmo, of which I will gladly avail for half-price during happy hour in July and January alike. Also, Tuesday night is bacon night. Need I say more?  Drinks (and free bacon) aside, though, I don't think I've ever had a bad meal at Harris. Highlights over the years have included their turkey burger (look for its Yinzer moniker, "Thanksgiving in Blawnox," on their wholly entertaining food menu), the wings (half-price during HH--get the dry bacon rubbed wings with a side of the Columbian Gum Nummers sauce), the mac 'n cheese (I got some sort of breakfast-style once with peppers, bacon, and fried egg--the M&C is big enough and fun to share, but no judgment from me if yinz want it all to yourself).   IRL: I took my family here on my grad school graduation day, and despite skepticism (looking at you, mom), everyone loved their meal, from said skeptic mama to my 86-year-old grandfather. The service is excellent and the ambiance welcoming. Harris, you'll be my Shadyside standby for what I hope to be years to come.

Pn0dlUnEZ-LcEcwZJ4RhRg.text: I sat outside, on a warm night with friends and had a really nice time. It was my first time at Harris Grill and with that being said, I found the menu to be very irritating. Having "cutesy" names for all of the items on the menu made for a long ordering time because I had to read descriptions of each items as opposed to taking a quick glance at things with the fear that I may miss something that I would have preferred to order. Our server, was just ok, but the food was awesome! I will definitely be back to try more of their menu options. I can't wait to come back for bacon night!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry chipotle barbecue chicken wings.

yTH6XanX2fv77_lAuiASHw.text: My friend suggested meeting up here for Friday happy hour. Though I trust her recommendations, I really wasn't anticipating that much. The name -- Harris Grill -- seemed a little ho-hum, and I was expecting your typical Pittsburgh-type place with basic appetizers and lots of Yuengling.  However, as soon as I sat down, I knew this place was going to be different. First of all, it was packed! The cute little patio had lots of young professionals ranging in attire from girls in maxi dresses to guys wearing dress pants, button-ups, and ties. Thankfully, one of my friends had arrived a few minutes before 5pm and secured the last available table on the patio. Lots of local residents were taking advantage of the absolutely incredible weather to sit outside.  After quickly becoming intimidated by the enormous drink "book," I just took my friend's recommendation and ordered a frozen cosmo. Wow! Delicious!! It was the perfect blend of cold but not too icy and not too sweet but not too sour. I could drink these things every day! Well, maybe not every day... because they pack a serious punch! I was warned not to order the additional shot when it was offered to me, and thankfully I heeded the warning. After two of these beverages, I was definitely tipsy! In my opinion, two of these little frozen cosmos pack the same amount of buzz as 3-4 glasses of wine.  In addition to amazing frozen cosmos, I enjoyed trying their appetizers. The spinach dip and pita was tasty, and the pierogies, though very different from the pierogies that I have had in the past, were out-of-this-world good. I was tempted to order a second round of the pierogies but didn't want to appear gluttonous.   Service was pretty good, especially considering how busy the restaurant was and how tightly we were packed onto the little patio. Our waiter both resembled and acted like Conan O'Brien, which was just the icing on the cake of a great happy hour experience.  And, finally, the check arrived. My jaw nearly fell on the floor. Three of us girls drank 7 frozen cosmos and ate 3 appetizers... for $40. How is that even possible? If I had known in advance that the frozen cosmos were $3/each, I might have just chugged them and taken a cab home.  Needless to say, I'll be back!

6jqMq88a7zVP1yZpd8hqvw.text: Food was ok.  Our server, who introduced herself as Maddie, was horrible.  Not friendly at all and provided horrible service.  My friend and I were celebrating a special occassion and her attitude ruined our evening.  Probably wont be back.

yEqGGEWZpSJhOcpq0eYb2Q.text: The food here is definitely some of the best in the area. They have really creative names for all of the menu items, and a lot of those items are very interesting themselves. The atmosphere/environment isn't the most comfortable. It's dark and a little out-dated. But employees are helpful. Food is good. Prices aren't ridiculous.   They're well known for their mac and cheese, so this time around I chose to try the jerk chicken macaroni. Our waiter quickly told me that he thought it was the best thing on the menu. All in all, I was pleased with my meal and with the amount I owed once I got my receipt. I'm really going to have to come here on Tuesday to experience bacon night. I hear it's a good time.

OuoWAwc60jlQKBgUl8hOuQ.text: My sis and I came here the other day for lunch and IT CHANGED OUR LIVES. Sure, the food was great and atmosphere was calm, but our waitress really made our experience great. She (and others walking around) was fun and really knew the menu to give recommendations.   My sister had the steak sandwich as a wrap and it was incredible. I had the fish sandwich, which was so big it hung like 5 inches off the bun. We will definitely be going back!

khRTzW2LtMaikaleApDJjA.text: Harris was one of the places I first visited when moving to Pittsburgh. Its another place that should go on the list of places that I've had mixed feelings about.  I had originally mainly visited during the happy hour, but to be honest the happy hour is just alright. $5 cocktails and apps, or something else not super memorable. The drinks are good and the appetizers are nice, but small. They usually have some type of frozen drink option, such as a frozen cosmo or mojito. I've had the hummus multiple times and it comes with a nice spread of vegetables and is a pretty good size.   I had gone for brunch a few months ago and was actually really happy about the food and service. I went for the brunch buffet and was actually really impressed. They didn't have a ton of vegetarian options, but they did have a create your own omelet station in which my omelet was cooked in front of me. They also had the best breakfast potatoes ever. And a good assortment of fruit and mini bagels with lox.  The servers are pretty good and most places you can be seated are nice, besides the weird window seat which seems nice at first, but is a hard place to converse due to the only seats facing one direction (instead of facing each other.)

u_LxV1n4-N5gp_maShT9Sg.text: On our first night in Pittsburgh, we walked up the street and Harris Grill's front patio was full of people and had a good vibe so we decided to try it.   The first thing I noticed about this place is the cheeky humor throughout the menu! I giggled the entire time I reviewed the menu. +1!  Service was also great - attentive but not too involved. When the host sat us, he gave us a great overview of the menu, specials, his favorite dishes and drinks.   And the food! I ordered the steak salad (boring, but after 3 weeks of eating out while moving, I wanted VEGGIES) with the Lemon Garlic Vinaigrette. The salad = love; the dressing wasn't my favorite but fortunately, the salad didn't really need it. My husband ordered the Crabby Road (crab cake burger) and I had a bite and it also was delish.   Given it's proximity to our apartment and our really nice experience, we'll be back for sure!

xu623IwI0jQoIPngfcqxnw.text: The charm of this place is definitely unique and stands out amongst an array of iffy and uninspired restaurants around the area. A three-story, re-imagined Victorian house, this place really provides the atmosphere and creativity that the people of Shadyside require. However, I would like to emphasize the distinction between appeal and delivery in regards to what we're there for (the food)! The regular menu is diverse and entertaining - I actually ENJOY the sarcastic descriptions. The wings are great and the custom bowls look heavenly. With that being said, the brunch menu is a bit frustrating. A standard price of $20.17 per meal is ambitious for what you get, especially if you can't drink. Without the mimosa, you get a coffee, dry biscuits, and breaded chicken under thick gravy with potatoes (Chicken Littles). Regardless, very solid and will definitely return after 5 pm.

Fn5kqdYf8vSQuK-oPySm5Q.text: We went for a quick drink and dinner on our way to an event. The staff sat us downstairs in front of the entry door (25 degrees outside) and forgot about us as we were the only diners downstairs. We requested to be moved upstairs because we couldn't take our coats off and then waited forever for our drinks (If they served us more timely, drinking would have kept us busy). It was almost an hour before they served our food - why? They ran out of burgers on a Saturday evening?! They did give our appetizer for free but definitely made us late for our evening out.

GJ0H-_XxfK4iUbUt3AqckQ.text: My mom and I came here for a brunch date since we've never been here before. As soon as we walked in, the hostess was extremely stuck up. I didn't feel welcomed at all. She asked us if we wanted a table and obviously we said yes we've never been here before we're excited to try it. The wait was 20 mins and that was fine with us but it was 25 degrees out and there's no waiting area considering the bar was full. We asked for menus while we waited and she reluctantly handed one. After we stood awkwardly for 5 mins in front of the hostess we decided to leave. I've never posted a review before but I felt like I needed to say something on the costumer service. As we walked out we overheard two other people talking about how one of the waitresses wasn't very nice. I would've liked to try the food, but I won't be back.

ix_bSGTboXCzXY_wXWdomw.text: I have been here several times in a drunken stupor, and let me tell you the warm cookie with ice cream is exactly what the doctor ordered to ensure sufficient energy for the stumble home. But, this week was my first sober experience of the place, so I felt more adept to review the place.   We went during happy hour. $5 apps and 1/2 off beer. NICE! We got the spinach dip (meh, but Sarah S. liked it), the pierogies (YUMMMMMMM), and the calamari (also YUMMMMM). I got the spiced stout, which was also delish. AND the bill was like $20!  My only complaint is that they don't show how much the food would have cost without the discounts on the receipt, so I didn't know how much to tip :(

wL_aOv_ihLl1CU_HLwxzfQ.text: Harris holds a special place in my heart because they love bacon as much as me. Every Tuesday evening, free bacon baskets at the bar! They have an excellent beer selection and drafts are half off during happy hr M-F 4:30-6:30. Also half off appetizers. In the summer, their deck is a great place to pass the time.

-Po_x3YZRWO-47cGccnskA.text: My previous reviews were all 5 stars but my last few times at the Harris have just been so 'meh' that I'm taking it down to 3 stars.  The Harris is my favorite bar in Pittsburgh and they have fantastic bartenders...Byron, Caleb...mix excellent cocktails w friendly smiles.  BUT.  They keep changing the menu and I know many restaurants do this but its starting to get tiring.  If you dine here, please ask what they are out of first and have a back up menu selection made just in case.  If you do eat here, I recommend:  The Chicken Riggies The hamburger the mac n cheese The wings the pierogies The Henny Penny The Garden Weasel  I suggest you avoid:  The greek salad.  For some reason I ALWAYS get a hair in this salad.  And no, they are not strings from onions, they are dark hairs!  Eww.    The tarragon dressing:  It's basically liquid salt and will render anything you are eating inedible.  More effective than Sensa.  Trust me.  The Delmonico A  go go:  sounds like the sandwich is going to be good, but its very gristly and not that great  I really, really, really wish they'd bring the falafel sandwich back but it seems it's gone to Harris Menu Item heaven.  Also, they have good brunches here on Sunday's but it is buffet style when the weather is nice.  I like their brunch, but I prefer it when they have a menu in the colder months.  With the buffet you can't, for example, just get fried eggs or anything like that.  But it still pretty good.  I like this place, but maybe I've just dined here too often?  I don't know.  I just havent had my mind blown here in awhile.

3P5vPp-kk23WT14cZbH2Hw.text: The food was really good, but the place needs a major cleaning.  I love the old architecture and old buildings that are restaurants, but I just felt as if this place was not the cleanest.  I could see coming here after doing a bar crawl in Shadyside and being extremely pleased.  Very creative menu (although nothing was particularly healthy), service was fine and rest of staff was friendly.  Just wish it was a bit less grimy.

opKWRLLQ_2ObXTl6GievNA.text: I had frozen cosmo with the creme de cassis. It was probably my bad to add the liqueur to make it extremely sweet. I only had a couple of sips and that was it. All of my friends' drinks were very sweet, even after the ice cubes melt. The quality of their fries remained surprisingly consistent across my two visits: the worst I've ever had. I couldn't believe that I only had two pieces of the fries during my recent visit.   If I ever come here again, I'll get a beer instead of cocktails.

Dc9UvScG5d9qdBNINgOIOg.text: Bacon night was fabulous. I will be back for more. Also we had great service with Paul the service guy, well definitely be returning!

sGJr-pEWpz1G-TFNLYRXiA.text: This place is awesome! Loved the outdoor patio and bacon night was on point! Also our server Paul was absolutely fantastic! Seriously such a nice guy! Definitely coming back!

KH3tR93-an5KR6bC_zLDAg.text: Goat in a Boat = very good Mac and Cheese = pretty decent, definitely better than the diner stuff Creme Brulee = AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE Nice selection of beer  The menu is pretty obnoxious, but the prices are reasonable.  Had deck seating so can't really comment on the inner-decor, however the deck was nice and large, service was prompt, and only a few loud cars driving by.  The parking for this place is horrible.  DO NOT park in the adjacent lot or you will be towed; street parking only.    Food: There are quite a few veggie-friendly options.  We ordered the Goat in a Boat appetizer.  Pretty tasty--a concoction of feta and roasted red peppers. It came with warm pita bread to dip and if I were to come back here, I wouldn't hesitate in ordering it again.  As for the main course, my friend ordered the falafel which he seemed to like, and I ordered the mac and cheese.  This mac and cheese is supposedly very large and famous.  I wouldn't necessarily agree with either of those labels.  It is a normal bowl size full, and the sauce has a slight kick, but I wouldn't claim it to be anything too too special.  However, it was good, the noodles were cooked perfectly and the sauce wasn't too runny;  I would probably order it again.  $11 something for a bowl is kind of hefty though.   Dessert:  This is where it all went wrong.  I am a huge fan of creme brulee and this is probably the worst I've eaten.  It comes in a boat-like dish with a very shallow amount of custard.  The sugar was torched poorly, the custard wasn't cold...cause there wasn't enough of it to not be affected by the torch... and ugh... a total disappointment.  Not only was it prepared improperly, it just didn't taste good.   I have no idea how it is a "Harris Grill Favorite."  I did hear from someone else that their oreo something? is excellent.   Side note:  Bacon Tuesday is pretty bomb, but don't expect crispy bacon.  Overall, this place was good.  I wouldn't say it's wonderful, like I've heard from many others, but I wouldn't not recommend it either.

ke5FPZjbxmi8WNy8UN3xYw.text: Beer selection is pretty decent. They have lots of "Sex in the City"-wannabe martinis to go w/ the "Sex in the City"-wannabe crowd. But don't expect to run into some skinny b!tch in Manolos. It's more in that "That's SOOO my life" delusion way so common these days.   Food is okay, but I find it's kind of hit or miss depending on what you're ordering and what night it is. Nothing stellar. One does not go here for the food rather the patio and the free bacon on Tuesdays. Service is also possibly very good or very bad.   I actually don't even remotely hate this place. It's a fun place to be.

JbwhYknCKJGRaEEJ_frdqA.text: I've been to Harris Grill many times. My favorite thing is their happy hour -- half off all drafts, frozen cosmos, and wings from 4:30-6:30 PM. I'm happiest if I just stop by for a couple of brews and wings. The strawberry chipolte wings are great -- I just love the flavor of the sauce. It's not too spicy but very good.  Aside from happy hour, I've had very mixed experiences with the food there.  Sometimes it's been good, other times it's been overcooked and/or bland. I've also had some fairly slow service there but nothing bad enough to stop me from going back.  It's definitely a place worth checking out (you guys be sure to take a stop in the bathroom while you're there... I hear they have a very interesting urinal), but I tend to stick to bar food/brews when I go.

gauYv_HLwUMj_4qcAQ5j0w.text: Great drinks (frozen cosmos!!) but the food and service leaves something to be desired. Try the Sunday brunch!

bz-KrhMsXJZWPigMB3l2ww.text: A Solid 4 stars for the right night and right person.  It's a fun, hip place that has a lot of good qualities.  Bacon night is for sure a great attraction.  Also, I really like their Sunday brunch menu.  If you are under 35 and are looking for a cool place to relax and grab a few drinks with friends this is it.

jFCIIuO98vurIyV5-e1piQ.text: I do love me some Harris Grill! From the cool vibe to the witty, extensive menu, to the plethora of creative, strong drinks, it's a winner. I came here for the first time on a first date with my now-husband, but that really hasn't influenced my positive review of the place. Everything I mentioned above has taken care of that. My favorites are the fish tacos (though I preferred them more when they let you choose your side--tater tots!--and were cheaper), the "goat in a boat," and the frozen cosmos ($3 during happy hour). Yes, it can be busy, but most good places are!

pVVETdb2Fi57FI4RobSPgA.text: Harris is awesome. My friends and I come almost every Tuesday for bacon night. A dollar for a basket of bacon unless you're at the bar, where it's free. The menu is hysterical and will make you laugh all the way through and the drinks are delicious. Definitely a must for anyone who's never been. You'll just want to keep coming back

nGUtFXhQnqr-y6ID3c46_g.text: As a cocktail lover (more than a sports-bar fan), Harris' is by far my favorite bar in the area. I can't even count the amount of times I've gone here with a group of girls and the waitresses have had to manage trays and trays of frozen cosmo's (which, like many have mention, at about $3 for happy hour = awesome). They have a vast and eclectic cocktail menu; another of my favorites from which is their caramel appletini with a floating apple slice in it.  I'm also a big fan of their food; most notable the buffalo chicken dip which has a really strong, zesty flavor and their Thanksgiving burger (ground turkey w/ cranberry, a little bit of gravy sauce, and mash potatoes on the side). Also, who can forget free bacon Tuesdays? This place has it all.

tJyrZvLTRLf9132ak4to0w.text: good food. good drinks. good patio. GREAT urinal.

YGTdUXfGBE_Dv4A0zvF_VQ.text: Very friendly fun, warm and welcoming place.  Nice attractive young wait staff.  Big portions of comfort food.  You don't go here for gourmet dining but to have a nice newish American meal with pretty fresh ingredients and a fun vibe.  Bring you hearty appetite.  The cookie and ice cream desert is delicious.

M5aVqLQ_vkAiLjtXiuE4sA.text: Two Words: Frozen Cosmos  You need no other motivation to go to Harris' (although, the food and service is good too)

CdHEHG7YBp8zRjJkXudC6w.text: It was just... eh... The service was slow and the food was mediocre. Not a terrible place to go for a late night bite to eat, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back. Drink selection is fairly good. It might have a better atmosphere during the summer when outside seating is available.

5FXSEBwhy1fN1MiiUdbtOg.text: Great atmosphere, good food, and lots of unique cocktails. The patio is very pleasant in the summer.

6JWDo63aPMiTuv9fC_AHIQ.text: harris grill, i think  your menu is trying too hard.  first place i went on my visit to pittsburgh.  menu was a little overly silly, waitress was a little underly friendly/helpful/timely, and food, while decent, was overpriced for the quality.  i may be back to pittsburgh, but won't be back to harris grill

32GjJfEmo9IYikCoL_4hxA.text: Wasn't that hungry and was looking for a good places for alcohol and appetizers and stumbled upon Harris.  Fun times.  NICE: - Unique selection of beers.  I'm no expert, but I hadn't heard of 3/4 of them and the waiter recommended a tasty blueberry one. - Decent, spicy mussels.  Not the best I've ever had, but be honest with yourself, you're not going to find awesome seafood in Pittsburgh.  Wasn't rubbery at all and the sauce was nice. - Tasty, perfectly-sized, bite sized cheeseburger appetizers. - Wings that weren't too greasy yet very flavorful. - We were there for bacon night.  Who would have thought eating strips of plain ol' bacon would be good?  It is! - Nice patio.  Not too packed so you can talk, yet busy enough that you feel like you're part of the action. - Friendly, attentive, helpful waiter.  WEIRD: - Took forever to get drinks and food. - My coworker said the wings weren't legit jerk chicken like advertised. - The patio was a little too... romantic.  Meaning it was so dark I couldn't read the menu except by holding it up to the little candle at our table.  Ditto when we went inside for a bit.  Maybe that'd be awesome if I was on a sexy date instead of with two coworker dudes.  I wasn't.  :(  All in all, I'd come back if I was looking for a date place to have a light dinner or a place to chill with some close friends.

CJmx6YfIuZpyVgOW3IJLDQ.text: Excellent vegetarian options, excellent beer selection, good non-vegetarian options, and an all-you-can-eat bacon night.  The wait staff is awesome, friendly, and knowledgeable.  The average patron, unfortunately, isn't half as cool as the staff, and I avoid the mixed drinks, as the scotch and soda I had was just bad.  Plus, there's an awesome patio, but it's the smoking section, unless that's changed.  Sunday brunch is also designed to cure the common hangover, which isn't a bad plan.

u4nV-D_giBljiqizIFXpsw.text: Zero stars for service.  Zero stars for price. One star for food.  I have been to the Harris Grill three separate times for dining.  The first was happy hour - with a party of six. We waited 30 minutes for a table; we watched several tables empty out and stay un-bussed and dirty for more than 10minutes at a time.  Obviously they must have been understaffed.  Once seated, service was extremely slow.  Our server was slow to arrive at our table to begin and take our drink order. Our drinks took even longer to arrive (approx. 20 min from when seated.)  The appetizers were tasty, although overpriced. Buffalo chicken dip was very good. Service remained poor.  Perhaps they were just very busy and understaffed.   The second time I came was midweek, midday, for lunch.  The place was mostly empty.  Surely we would get good, prompt service now?  Not so much.  All I ordered was the chocolate cupcake dessert.   It took about 25 minutes.  It looked like half a cupcake was dropped on the floor, and then attempts made at making the broken pieces look presentable on a plate.  Half of it was luke-warm, half of it was cold.  Terrible.  WTF?  The most recent and I promise the last time I will ever go to the Harris Grill was a Sunday for brunch.  Again a 30min wait for a party of 3 to be seated.  I understand that - its Sunday - its Brunch - lots of places have a wait.  But again we watched table after table go empty and stay dirty.  Finally seated it again took 20 minutes to get our drinks - orange juice. And then the waitress only brought two of the three beverages.  The third took another 10 minutes.  Seriously??  Our food took an hour. SERIOUSLY OVERPRICED!!  Several items on the menu were out.  (We arrived at noon for a brunch that was supposed to last from 10-2pm).  The menu was prix fixed at $14.  $14 for two pieces of French toast with disgusted, dried out frozen tater tots. (They had run out of home fries). The eggs Benedict were dried and hardened - just plain gross.  The eggs over easy had no runny yolk. The sausage was very good.  They served us the wrong toast.  You couldn't get worse food or service at a McDonalds run by newborn donkeys.

zWkIc9XUiHxGJEIK2tpnvg.text: Yummy, love that they integrate local ingredients.  Lunch menu affordable.
